Reviews.Title: “Fajardo Inn is a great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Carol P
Reviews.Content: We had a great room with an amazing view. I was a little disappointed that the coffee maker in the room didn't come with coffee. I guess I am spoiled by the hotels here in the states. Other than that our stay was great.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to Puerto del Rey”
Reviews.Author: PPatterson
Reviews.Content: I am in the final few days of an extended refit at Marina Puerto del Rey. For anyone doing business in the Eastern Puerto Rico area the Fajardo Inn is a best bet. The hotel offers North American business hotel standards, is very clean, conveniently located and staffed by friendly professional employees. The rates are very appropriate and the front desk is capable and willing to assist with business needs. The hotel is located in a less than appealing neighborhood but is very secure and in a perfect spot for exploring the various nearby attractions like El Yunque, Los Carobas, Seven Seas, Loquillo, etc

Reviews.Title: “My fourth stay here - and there will definitely be a fifth!”
Reviews.Author: Tarnwood
Reviews.Content: This is a true gem of a hotel - it would be called a resort any where else. Not once have I been dissatisfied with my stay here. The rooms are clean and comfortable. There are two swimming pools which are immaculate and rarely crowded. Hotel staff are friendly and helpful. There are two restaurants on site, unfortunately not much diversity of selection and no restaurant for breakfast or lunch. But there are plenty of restaurants in the area. It is minutes from the Ferry that goes to Culebra and Vieques, only 45 minutes from San Juan. There is definitely a need for a car here, but a car is needed if you plan to stay in Fajardo. I have no reservations whatsoever in recommending The Fajardo Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this older hotel.”
Reviews.Author: zktraveler
Reviews.Content: Great location for visiting sites outside of Old San Juan. Views here are very good and pools, restaurants clean and nice.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: leighannangola
Reviews.Content: My only compaint about this hotel was the pillows were flat as pancakes. The room was very spacious and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Inflexible schedule for guest services.”
Reviews.Author: YRRJA
Reviews.Content: Not so bad hotel, but they have poor decision making when it comes to guest satisfaction and services. Hours of operation and guest services adjusted to hotel policies rather than customer needs. We have been a several times and there is always a reason why they can't satisfy our needs... I will not go back!

Reviews.Title: “Good price point, spacious rooms, have your own car”
Reviews.Author: Northern-Observer
Reviews.Content: Do not stay here at the Fajardo Inn and Resort without a car. It is not near much of anything within walking distance. There are two restaurants on location, one is open for breakfast and dinner, the other is open for lunch. The Green Igauana Bar and Grill has a very limited lunch menu of non-Puerto Rican (though Mexican) selections. We had burritios, a chicken salad, and tacos. The burritos were good in quantity and flavor, the tacos and chicken salad were adequate. Plan plenty of time if you eat breakfast at the Starfish restaurant, it is very slow, though nice staff. It was so slow the last morning I timed it. After being seated it took almost 9 minutes to get menus, then almost 34 minutes after ordering to receive food. We ended up renting a car from Avis which will pick you up and drop you off here at the Fajardo Inn. The Avis office experience was superior. Although the Fajardo Inn website lists â€œConcierge Servicesâ€� it is not what you might expect. There is no specific â€œdeskâ€�, it is just the hotel front desk handling you along with all the other guest needs. The brochures offered are limited. Their primary recommendation is to rent a car and do the reservations for any tours on your own. Not all the recommendations we received from the front desk were good advice, so make a lot of phone calls to assure any and all reservations for any type of tours. The staff is certainly friendly and helpful, it is just the structure and procedures of the hotel management that seem difficult. For instance, if you want a hair dryer, you must go to the front desk, sign for it and then take it to your room. If you want a pool towel, then you must sign a liability waiver and get a pool towel card. To get a pool towel you do not go to the pool, nor to the front desk, you get pool towels from the Juice Bar at the gym, located quite some distance from the pool. There is a microwave, minifrig and coffee pot in the rooms. For coffee you must go to the front desk and purchase it, or drive to a local grocery store to get coffee and genuine milk or cream. Room maid service did not occur the first day, nor the second day. We were at the hotel for five nights. The first day, in late afternoon, we asked for maid service and just received a couple new towels. The second day for maid service, we called at 3:30pm and received nothing after half an hour. We called again and received maid service a half hour later. This was full maid service except for the coffee pot not being cleaned. The next two days we did receive good maid service. The rooms are spacious, quite spacious, and bathrooms are large with two sinks in the vanity area, along with plenty of shelf space at the sinks and in the bathroom. Hot water and water pressure was great. For charging up electronics there were plenty of outlets as this is a fairly new hotel, there is plenty of parking, two nice swimming pools, a mini-golf course, and the rooms have balconies with nice views. You are a long ways from the water and beaches so, again, you will want to have a car. They do arrange at-cost transportation for you to and from the hotel from the San Juan area. This worked out well for us and was good transportation. However, we now realize the correct way to stay at this hotel is to arrive and depart with your own transportation. For the price this is a very reasonable place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a good price”
Reviews.Author: Houndlab
Reviews.Content: The Fajardo Inn was a pleasant surprise in this neighborhood of Fajardo. Alexis at the front desk was very accommodating in helping us extend our stay despite some Internet red-tape. Don Miguel made excellent food and beverage suggestions in the Blue Iguana Grill. Try the rib special, strawberry mojito, and cheese flan!

Reviews.Title: “Old School tropic hospitality”
Reviews.Author: peterathomas69
Reviews.Content: Situated at the eastern tip of Puerto Rico in the ferry town of Fajardo is this hotel. The accomodations are clean and comfortable, the amenities include two pools, very well equipped fitness center, two restaurants, a modest nature trail created by the owner, etc., but the real draw for us was the hospitality and warmth of the staff. The restaurants and bar are convivial gathering places and the food was OK (Medalla Light is GREAT light beer!). Linens are thin-- its not the Ritz-- but for the price and the ambiance we'd prefer to stay here. BTW the ferries to Culebra Island (NOT TO BE MISSED!) and Viejes are right down the street, and we strongly recommend the BucketList experience of a night-time kayak tour through the mangroves to a large lagoon to experience the splendor of the bioluminescent dinoflaggelates!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel! Super deal for the $!”
Reviews.Author: megzilla
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I recently stayed at the Fajardo Inn and had a great time. The location is ideal for reaching the port (for ferries to Culebra and Vieques) and is also fairly close to El Yunque. We enjoyed the lovely pool with the slide and the mini golf! The restaurant was pretty good (we didn't eat at the seafood place, it looked good but it was pricey). The only complaint I have is there was no fridge in our room. That would have been handy. There is a coffee maker, although you have to buy coffee at the front desk. The fridge was a minor complaint in what was otherwise a very fun stay. Given its price, I was very pleasantly surprised.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to spend quality time with the family...”
Reviews.Author: Edwin_Almodovar
Reviews.Content: This has been definetely the most rewarding place I have ever been with my family. I have two kids, 10 and 5 year old. They enjoyed the pool and the water slide. Even my wife had a blast! Rooms are very clean, confortable, spacious, and great price. We planned a Vieques/Culebra trip and although we visited both islands during the weekend, we knew we were returning to a fun place to spend a nice evening. They have two pools, one by the hotel, the other by the fun park. The only down to the fun park is that it closes to early in the night. Maybe is because it lacks lighting, but it would a great plus if the park would open until at least 10 or 11pm. I've stayed a few times, for business and pleasure. The rooms vary on sizes, so it meets all your needs. The staff was really helpful and available to us. The hotel has a Caribbean taste which makes you welcomed at all times. Will go back any time!

Reviews.Title: “Old style resort”
Reviews.Author: suzanbyshore
Reviews.Content: Finding Fajardo Inn can best be described as a challenge, particularly if arriving at night. My daughter and I booked our stay and had planned many day trips. Our room was spacious with 2 queen beds. The bathroom was very dark & it seems washcloths are unheard of & impossible to get. Towels are like gold and @ one point, a used & rather wet bath towel was folded by cleaning staff & left on the bed??? Another time the entire pile of used towels were left on floor. The only ice machine is on the 1st floor -inconvenient to those on the far end of the 2nd floor. The only Wi-fi service is on the porch by office as noted by numerous people each evening sitting there with laptops. On our last night the noise level in the hallway was out of control & didn't stop until I finally called front desk @ 1am. On a positive note the office staff is very helpful with local attractions, & will assist with making reservations. They are both knowledgable and friendly. The pools and workout room were excellent & clean. We would stay there again on future trips.

Reviews.Title: “nice to stay worst place to at or drink”
Reviews.Author: virgen_10
Reviews.Content: i stay place is clean and confortable , overprices, food and drink not rec. quality and serviceo of the restaurant is very poor and careless. but there more rest to fo at Fajardo were prices quality and service , also ocean view you will enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay for one or two nights not your entire vacation.”
Reviews.Author: loveshotels21
Reviews.Content: Great location to do some day trips from (Like to SJ or El Yunque)and then return to del Fajardo to enjoy the awesome pool. Great for young kids, teens and even adults! Mini golf and a gym are nice. Great staff and very helpful! Overall not the best hotel because not on beach, but if you are only staying a couple of nights it is PERFECT!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Tenoch
Reviews.Content: Great Location for making a base to explore the east end of PR and Vieques and Culebra. very clean and very reasonably priced. and the A/C worked wonderfully. Great pool and restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “We love the Fajardo Inn!”
Reviews.Author: Embarcon
Reviews.Content: Just spent 15 nights at the Fajardo....this is our7th stay and we couldn't be happier(well maybe if the wi-fi was in the entire hotel) The grounds and pools are beautiful, the rooms are spacious and you are close by Seven Seas Beach,Luquillo Beach and the kiosks. The ferry to Culebra and Vieques is a short distance away ...close enough to San Juan and El Yunque.all in all we think it is almost perfect!

Reviews.Title: “FAMILY OF 5”
Reviews.Author: jocelynsmith
Reviews.Content: Positives: Room was clean, the 3 queens were a great deal for our family of 5 (2 adults, 3 kids 10, 8, 4). The kids loved the pools and slide. We had it almost to ourselves and brought cocktails in a cooler. NEVER saw an attendant or employee at the pool. The kids went into the smaller pool while we waited for lunch at the blue iguana. We were close to El Yungue (a good 1/2 day hike, the snorkeling on the Traveler and the Bio Bay Tour. Excellent gym. Food at both restaurants was ok but $$$ for what it was. The Beach at Loquillo was great. Umbrellas and chairs for rent, good food and drink and shallow for swimming w kids and even w a snorkel we saw fish. The Seven Seas Beach in Fajardo was OK, no food vendors and no tp in the bathrooms. Negatives: Steep hills to the pool (hard if you aren't physically able, swim up bar was closed, b ball hoop at pool OLD and the ball almost never went through, front desk wasn't always accommodating (couldnâ€™t fix safe in time to leave room for day, no detergent for washers, no lost and found???) and on our second to last day the smaller pool had iguana poop on the deck and in the pool. After I told the front desk the "swept it up" but it was still there and gross to look at. The morning we left the pool was closed for cleaning. You get passes for the pool and have to exchange for towels. Shouldn't be a big deal but OF you lose one it cost $25.00. Restaurants on site were $$ for what you got. We ended up driving every day to the Golden Sweet Bakery, about 1.5 miles downhill for breakfast. Cheap food but no fresh fruit or yogurt so eggs and pastries but great hot coffee. Restaurants that were good in Fajardo: El Passion (sp?) and Las Estacion. The Ola Tapas had good setting for drinks and apps but nothing special. In conclusion this is a HOTEL not a RESORT and if you go into knowing that it will be ok.

Reviews.Title: “Fajardo Inn”
Reviews.Author: jas50
Reviews.Content: Just recently spent 6 days at the Fajardo Inn... it was a lovely hotel, very pretty, generous sized room, nice pool and lobby... It was not a resort, but a hotel, and one should not expect a "resort" The location was central to many things, and an easy starting point to snorkeling, Vieques ferry, San Juan, etc. Very nice fitness center, mini golf, two restaurants.. nice staff. If the swim up bar was open, it would have added so much.. it was puzzling that it was not open and a hot tub would be nice, but all in all I would recommend it... Good value for the price...

Reviews.Title: “I was disappointed.”
Reviews.Author: Bruce G
Reviews.Content: Good points: the room was clean and quiet, which is important; the staff was nice; the two pools were excellent. Bad points: bad location: hole in bedspread the size of a baseball; no travel consultants, and only one or two brochures in lobby; staff was not good at arranging tours; breakfast was poor. On the first day, toast was served with little packs of butter and jelly, but two of the jelly packs had mold. The second day, I wanted pastries, but they were out. The third day, I drove a mile down the road for pastries. We ate dinner twice in the restaurant, and the meals were very good both times. The first day, we had towels but no wash cloths. We had to call twice before we got any. The third day, no towels or wash cloths. After the first call, we got towels but no wash cloths; we made two more requests and never got the wash cloths.

Reviews.Title: “middle of nowhere; views of factory”
Reviews.Author: jasmine5454
Reviews.Content: I was so disappointed when we arrived here! The location is horrible; nothing like what you'd expect. You're not in walking distance of anything and the "view" is a run down factory and very rundown neighborhood. You MUST have a car if you want to do anything. This IS NOT a "resort". The rooms are decent once you get inside, but the area is just awful & depressing. I don't know who wrote the glowing reviews here, but they mis-represent the place and I should not have booked my vacation based on these reviews - lesson learned. You will not feel like you are on a luxury vacation at this hotel. The staff we dealt with were very nice, but I feel bad for people who look at the photos on the website (like us!!) and end up here.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: leisuresusie
Reviews.Content: This hotel has the worst lay out t have ever seen. You walk up many stairs to get to anywhere. You also have to go down long halls to get to the rooms. These halls are dark and depressing. The furnishing and art work looks like it was found on the curb. Don't stay here

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: markbryants
Reviews.Content: Michelle and I stayed at the Fajardo Inn for a week. The room smelled damp upon arrival but that should be expected in the Caribbean. We opened the windows and everything was fine. The rooms are clean, spacious, comfortable and nicely appointed. The views of the countryside and ocean are breathtaking. The staff is friendly and helpful. The location is ideal for exploring Puerto Rico. The hotel is sItuated a short distance from the ferry to the islands of Culebra and Vieques. it is also close to El Yunque which is the only rainforest in the national park system. The fitness center is state of the art and the pools are nice. All told, this is the best choice in Fajardo. Mark and Michelle i

Reviews.Title: “Already making plans to go back !!”
Reviews.Author: seansun74
Reviews.Content: Love the staff, its great if you are looking for a place to relax. Planning to go back with my kids.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: millie516
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a hotel near the Bioluminess Bay. The Hotel was off the beaten path but totally worth it. The Staff was very helpful and the room was beautiful. There are 2 pools on the grounds and a mini golf course. Also they don't charge for parking like some hotels. If you did any research at all on the hotel you would realize there is nothing to do in this area other than the bay or ferry. So when people complain about nothing to do, it is true but it is the area not the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Place”
Reviews.Author: Ce S
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night, 1/23/12 t0 1/24/12. Views from Inn swere awesome. Beautiful, clean comfortable place. Staff was very friendly & accommodating. Ordered a late supper from one of their restaurants the Blue Iguana Mexican Grill & Bar. Food was Tex-Mex/Mexican and was very good. Their other restaurant the Starfish, which serves P.R. fare was closed when we were there. Would stay there again. The Inn was close to the El Yungue Rainforest & the Laguna Grande (Bioluminiscent Bay). These two places were the reason we traveled from Guayanilla to Fajardo.

Reviews.Title: “Vacation”
Reviews.Author: StoneyK
Reviews.Content: Worst place ever visited.Upon ariving we walked around to check the place out. It offered nothing. They have a no refund policy for this reason. Go anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Fajardo Inn”
Reviews.Author: wisess
Reviews.Content: Convienient location for around eastern PR. Close to the rainforest and travel to Vieques. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful. The pool was fun though I never say the swim up pool bar open. The 3 Q bed room was huge.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but not close to anything!”
Reviews.Author: h2o_mermaid
Reviews.Content: The Fajardo Inn wasn't close to much. There was a bar a little ways away. 20 min walk if I remember correctly. No continental breakfast, but they did have a restaurant downstairs. Went there quite a few times. We had to take a cab just to get to the beach, and we all felt like fish out of water there. When we went snorkeling we went with the company East Wind. Also went to see the Bio-Bay that night. Catamaran and 2 or 3 snorkeling spots. We also saw a whale while on the catamaran. Definitely bring sunscreen! Pools were very nice. They have a bird cage next to the second pool that's down from the first. The swim up bar was not in service when we were there, or they just stopped running it. Very good place to tan...or get burnt.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly atmospher - no presence at first class”
Reviews.Author: roadrun50
Reviews.Content: At one time this was a first class resort. No loner at the top of the heap makes this an excellent bargin. My room was large, the queen size bed comfortable. The shower had excellent pressure and was very roomy (aprox. 3' x 6'). There was shampoo and conditioner - no hair dryer. I usually travel with one but had left it home. There was an iron and ironing board. I never asked if a hair dryer was available. The air conditioner has a remote and multiple performance option. The small TV received satellite TV so, for those missing a bit of NYC can see the channel 7 news. There is a washer and dryer on the premisis for guest use. There is a huge multiple area pool down the hill from the main building. The entire resort is on a hillside. There is also a pool next to the main building. There is a gym but a membership is required to use the facilities. There are locations for bars and refreshments near the pool but none were in operation in December. The hotel is located in an industrial area so taking advantage of activities within walking distance is not an option. Fajardo is east of San Juan and really requires the use of a car. You are writhing a short (20 minute) drive to El Yunque National Rainforest, the whole area is lush and green with multiple bathing beach locations. Breakfast is available I the Starfish restaurant for between $7 - $11. Service is hit or miss - always friendly. Everything is kept very clean and the grounds well groomed. It isn't the Hilton, but it is an inexpensive base for exploring the greener side of Puerto Rico.

Reviews.Title: “A correct place”
Reviews.Author: GeniGo
Reviews.Content: We stayed just one night after our visit to Bio bay. We arrived at night and leave early in the morning so we didn't see or used to much of the hotel... Rooms were nice, big and clean. Staff was very nice and heopfull. It is a correct place to stay!!. It was not easy to find it... it is located on a little hill outside the town, and there are not much signs..better to ask people for directions!.

Reviews.Title: “Took great care of me!”
Reviews.Author: Cynthia F
Reviews.Content: I was in Fajardo on business. The staff at the hotel took great care of me. The food at the Blue Iguana was excellent. For me, Fajardo is not a vacation spot - but if you have cause to be in Fajardo - The Fajardo Inn is the place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Decent chain hotel”
Reviews.Author: NewEnglandGirl38
Reviews.Content: We spent a night here. We arrived late and left early so don't have a lot to share but will say the price was good, it was clean but a bit generic (and did smell a little odd). The staff was helpful and went out of their way to be helpful. Great location if you are headed to Culebra or Vieques via ferry in the am.

Reviews.Title: “outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: newyorkkid1954
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Fajardo looking for a place to stay and got very lucky to fine this place. I really and highly recommend this place to all who travel this way. The staff and all the people in the restaurant were the nieces i have every came across. Once again thank you very much for everything. Aloha

Reviews.Title: “Nice pool, room not so much”
Reviews.Author: bgins
Reviews.Content: The rooms (we tried 4) all smelled of mold. It appears they don't run the a/c when the room is not rented. Pretty strong smell, but it was tolerable. But the large pool area was great and the gym is very nice. The food at both restaurants was okay, not great, not terrible. In keeping with what seems to be PR style, they added a surcharge to the room rate, so check what the rate is when you book, the price of the room is not the price of the room advertised.

Reviews.Title: “Good facilities, poor room”
Reviews.Author: hills168
Reviews.Content: Many excellent common use facilities at this hotel, including two good size pools, basketball court, miniature golf, tennis court, small zoo, good size gym. The room I stayed was poor, tiny vanity top that not enough place to put towels and necessary person items. Really poor design. Expensive room charged in low season, I saw only single digit cars parked there. The owner of this large hotel has no idea to lower its charge to attract more local visitors during low season.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable but not a great location”
Reviews.Author: grapesh
Reviews.Content: Pros: decent price, clean and spacious rooms, not a bad restaurant and a bar (open even on Monday night, when all other places in vicinity are closed). Location - close to ferry terminal. Away from traffic congested areas of San Juan. Cons: Location - too far from the ocean, not much entertainment. Food choice - not much variety. Service - too many hotel employees doing basic chores in sight can get annoying. I prefer invisible service. Also, yellow "caution wet floor" cones in the corridors seem to be placed there permanently, which distorts otherwise nice interiors of the hotel. Rooms - old AC units, pre-historical cathode TVs.

Reviews.Title: “The staff was wonderful”
Reviews.Author: fredruth
Reviews.Content: After Hurricane Irene knocked out the power and water in the deluxe condo we were staying we had to move. Under short notice we got a room for my wife and 3 sons. Clean and comfortable AND the had power from a generator. We had A/C and internet. Our room was directly above the lobby so we could get internet in the room. Mecian food was average, drinks good. They were really nice...we were staying day by day waiting for the power in our condo to come back on (took 3 days). The actually charged us 25% LESS because of the emergecy...not even a hint of price gouging. The El Conquistador mega resort had power for] the resturants, but, hotel guest has no A/C for 3 days accccording to what we were told. All in all the saved our vacation! Thnaks to Unice and all of the staff

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - bad area”
Reviews.Author: P R
Reviews.Content: Fajardo Inn is a decent hotel - friendly staff, pretty clean, except their ridiculous rule about charging $25.00 if you don't return their pool towels? $25.00 for a used towel?? Really?? Otherwise, beautiful pool - but not too many eating choices - just Mexican - that's it. Fajardo itself is another story. Very run down and poor area. People live in beat up old shacks. Kind of afraid to roam around at night. Nothing to do there but go to the Conquistador Hotel for entertainment. I would not honestly go back to Fajardo.

Reviews.Title: “Almost Heaven, almost hell”
Reviews.Author: Jimtrip53
Reviews.Content: The Fajardo Inn was a totally mixed bag of an experiences. You simply could not have asked for a more personable staff, extremely willing to go the extra mile to help you set up excursions, rent a vehicle, whatever. The location and grounds were both beautiful and well maintained. And, the pools? Well, it is hard to describe the meandering waters from what was basically 3 large pools tied together with water ways, plus the adults pool up near the dining area that was very nice. There are plenty of places to sit and relax around the property, most with very scenic views of the mountains and glimpses of the sea. To the contrary, there was no restaurant or lounge open while we were there. There was an independently owned bar/restaurant on the grounds. It served foods that were named as Mexican food names (Tex-Mex actually) but not recognizable by taste. The location of the property is off the side of a side street (nowhere near where the GPS takes you) and difficult to find. The â€œFree Wi-Fiâ€� only works in the lobby or front porch area so do not expect any in the rooms and do not expect any wired service internet either. I have to say that the rooms and furniture looked nice enough, however they were extremely musty with a heavy mildew smell and the showers were horrible. Shower heads should have been replaced back in 1980 something but were not and the bath as a whole was small and very cramped with no shelving and very poor lighting. Donâ€™t pay extra for the balcony rooms, there is not enough room on the balcony to stand and close the door without squeezing tightly into the one corner where the door does not reach. All in all; Looks Great, very friendly, not quite what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Stay and we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: Hector S
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay there last week from August 6 thru the 11. We enjoyed and had a very fun and exciting experience in Puerto Rico. My kids loved the pool, slide and play area above all. The room were well kept. And when i needed contact numbers for fast delivery, the reception staff was ready to help me out. I would recommend and stay there again when i return.

Reviews.Title: “Not our first choice, but the best Fajardo had to offer.”
Reviews.Author: GraceinVirginia
Reviews.Content: Our one night stay at Fajardo Inn was not terrible, but nothing spectacular. The sheets in the room were thin, the bathroom poorly lighted and dirty. No restaurants nearby except the ones located inside the Inn. The neighborhood surrounding the Inn is run down and honestly, scary. Although we never used the pool, it seemed very nice. Our GPS could not find the address of the hotel, but there are signs pointing the way to it, which happens to be the only hotel in Fajardo.

Reviews.Title: “I good hotel with a great pool!”
Reviews.Author: spilatm
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here as part of our honeymoon trip. The hotel was very impressive, much larger than it would seem from the pictures on their website. I was impressed, their hallways were almost 10-15 feet wide! Just a random observation. We didn't stay in the most expensive hotel but if you look in our pictures, our balcony view was amazing. The balcony was just big enough for one chair. The staff was very friendly and helpful in finding us activities (since it rains so much in June there). A lot of our activities were canceled due to too much rain. The pool is great, its very large as you can see from the pictures on their website. It is way more fun since they have a small slide and a wet bar. I would recommend the place to anyone looking for a nice place to stay but it isn't near any beaches and the area around it is a little depressed. Luckily everything is very close so there isn't any problem with that.

Reviews.Title: “Did not clean our room. Had to beg to get fresh towels.”
Reviews.Author: Dominicsavga
Reviews.Content: The bed was awful did not sleep well. They did not clean our room and it took forever just to get fresh towels for a shower. Don't recommend this hotel spend the extra money to stay at the Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and beautiful...in the wrong location.”
Reviews.Author: noblehalogen
Reviews.Content: I found the place quite easily because I'm a native. People who aren't familiar with the place will surely have difficulties finding it. When I arrived the woman at the front desk was very polite. I was even asked if I wanted to go to the Hotel El Conquistador to play at the Casino, so they could arrange free transportation to the Hotel. The room was cozy and comfortable. TV was a bit outdated though. My only complain is that the Air Conditioner was leaking. It also has a very nice pool that kids and adults would love. Oh...the woman working as pool attendant was quite rude...there was an open gate and we didn't knew we couldn't enter going through there and she was implying we opened the gate when we didn't.

Reviews.Title: “has become the standard for our family”
Reviews.Author: 2boys2011
Reviews.Content: We loved this place! It was affordable, had fun things for the kids to do, was relaxing, and just beautiful. The gardens were fantastic, and I loved finding fresh mangoes on the ground from the many fruit trees. This was the first and thus far only hotel our family has found that makes everyone happy. My 2 boys are age 5 & 7. We travelled all around puerto rico, but honestly if we had spent the whole trip at fajardo inn, it would have been better. The rooms weren't gorgeous, there were long waits for overpriced food at the restaurant, but still - for that price, it was way more than I was expecting. I wish I knew how to find ohter fajardo inn's everyplace we go -- if you search on "resort," you get fancy, high priced places. I'd rather not pay and have something more down to earth. One thing -- we used google maps directions, (or mapquest?) and got hopelessly lost on the way there, so use hotel directions!

Reviews.Title: “TOTALLY DISGUSTED AND WILL NEVER GO BACK”
Reviews.Author: silkyslim41
Reviews.Content: Hmmm...Where should I start. The rooms were mosquito invested. When asked for more towels and wash cloths, we were only given ONE for myself and my husband. The website is misleading and looks nothing like a paradise and more like a run down motel you see on the side of a highway. There were ants all over the room, the lighting was horribly dim, the safe in our room broken and the pool was disgusting and not cleaned properly. The hotel is located in the ghetto of Farjado so beware........Oh and did I forget bars on the windows and the food and service in the restaurants were TERRIBLE, slow and matter-of-fact. I could go on and on. Don't stay here unless you have to.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, nice pool and recreation area, close to Ferry.”
Reviews.Author: dena0107
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fajardo Inn for two nights. The pool is nice and the room was clean and spacious. There isn't too much around the hotel, but we had a rental car so it was okay. If you are looking for a place near the ferry, this is a great option.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed Stay for our Class Reunion”
Reviews.Author: Roque63
Reviews.Content: We just arrived from our class reunion 30 years in this hotel. Our activity comittee had arranged several activities for the group and for our surprise when we got there they have change the location without notification . Service in the faclities was a disaster my wife had to wait one hour in Blue Iguana for a simple hamburger . Restaurants close at 10:30am so need to wake up early .Hotel Staff has no idea of servicing and make clients happy.Horrible will not go back My class mate will has the same opinion

Reviews.Title: “Solid and reliable hotel”
Reviews.Author: Urlauberforever
Reviews.Content: The Fajardo Inn is a good place to stay for one or two nights but nothing exceptional and as they have a lot of rooms also not the coziest place. The rooms are spacious and clean but the interior is also not very cozy. If you want to spent your holiday at a nice pool and do some sports and use this hotel as a base to see other attractions (El Yunque, beaches) in the area (you need a car) this might be your choice. The service was helpful and nice. When we visited the Fajardo Inn only one of the two restaurants was open. The prices were ok and the food, drinks, and the service were good. So, overall an solid and reliable hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Where are these bad reviews coming from?”
Reviews.Author: JBATrojan
Reviews.Content: I thoroughly enjoyed my one-night stay at The Fajardo Inn. It is perched on a hilltop slightly outside of Fajardo with views of the rainforest and the beach. The two pools, gym, and mini-putt course seemed very well maintained when we were there. The room was spacious, the bed was comfortable, and it was a 5-minute drive from our BioBay tour that night. It is a little far from Fajardo proper, if you want to go into the town. The prices at the two restaurants on-campus were a little higher than normal, but you have to expect that if the hotel has its own restaurants. The food and drinks were good, and the service was about par for the course for restaurants in Puerto Rico. Really enjoyed my experience at The Fajardo Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place”
Reviews.Author: FinlayTP
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night and loved it. Staff was very friendly. We arrived late, just as the restaurant was closing, and they welcomed us in as though it was 8:00pm. loved the grounds. nicely manicure, but not overly so. pool was fabulous and had lots of different spaces - a lap pool, a little river space, basketball, a slide, a waterfall and a space that very gently sloped into the pool so it's great for sitting in the water without getting all the way in; wld also be great for babies and new swimmers. There's a swim-up bar but we had to leave before it opened. there's also the mini-golf, an aviary that you can walk around the outside of, a playground, basketball and tennis. it's great. not a great neighborhood but we were had a nice walk down to the ferry to buy tickets and the kids got their first taste of not being in the US...chickens and dogs walking about. We LOVED it. We got an adjoining room and when I said it was more than we could afford, the agent kindly dropped it to a price we could afford.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice!”
Reviews.Author: mark_bryant
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I could not find a room in Old San Juan prior to a cruise because of San Sebastian Festival. So, we decided we'd drive to Fajardo and booked a room at the Fajardo Inn. We thought the property was well-maintained. The location was good. The restaurant and bars were decent. All told, it was an excellent value and a good choice. I am returning to Puerto Rico for the 4th of July and will consider staying there again. The Fajardo Inn is an excellent choice and a base camp for visits to Culebra, Vieques, El Yunque, Old San Juan and dozens of beaches.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it so much, we went back for a third night!!”
Reviews.Author: Paula60763
Reviews.Content: The Fajardo Inn is a wonderful oasis on top of a lovely hill. It is comfortable, clean and very reasonable. The grounds are beautiful and landscaped. The pools are terrific...nice and warm. Only problem, the whirlpool was not working but this was not a big deal. We enjoyed ourselves so much. There is a real local feeling there and the staff were very helpful and sweet. We stayed two nights before leaving for Culebra and when we returned, we decided to stay there again. They offered us the opportunity to leave our rental car there, which we did, and I was very pleased with the whole experience. The restaurant was terrific ( the Puerto Rican one, not the Mexican one, which we did not go to) and the birds that are on the property were gorgeous and fun to look at. Great place and very affordable.

Reviews.Title: “Could be great if they tried harder...!”
Reviews.Author: annarchy
Reviews.Content: Where to start! Check-in with "Nancy" was great. We didn't understand the late 4PM check-in as the place seemed rather empty. But they "just happened to have a room that we could have earlier..." Yes a room with an awful view (we'd emailed ahead stating that we were on our 10yr anniversary...which went unanswered and obviously ignored). We looked onto a building roof and a cement yard with 5 broken down and rusty army jeeps (!). If you get a room number from 310-319 or 320-327 (above ours) or 300-309 (UNDER ours) on the cement yard (we felt for those guests!), don't accept it. Nancy mentioned our "Expedia" booking a few times (we booked through Hotels.com) and we wondered later if that downgraded our guest status?? I reported all of this to Hotels.com too and told them all about our experience(s) here. This hotel needs to update its TV's, and get wireless internet for entire complex. (It was only available near Reception and only with a code they had to give you...) The room was OK. The TV was an old tube TV with 1-2 channels. Remote did not work and when I called reception who said they'd send a new one: it never arrived...The bed was realllllllly great and comfortable and BIG. And although there was daily housekeeping, the floor of our room turned our feet black (seen by our footprints after showering on white bathmat). The first night, I hardly slept as the fridge sounded like a jet engine. When I fell asleep finally, although I had deliberately put out a "Do Not Disturb" thing on our door, we were CALLED on the room telephone at 8AM (!) to see if we wanted housekeeping???!!!!!! I was so annoyed. When we went to reception to complain about the room and enclosed "jet engine" and to request a new room, "Nancy" suddenly was not so pleasant anymore. Ignoring our room change request, she merely stated (dismissively) that she would have the fridge changed. I mean, the fridge changed out???? It was not like the Inn was full.. Needless to say there was no fridge change... On the third afternoon, after being poolside, we were in the room and then heard a struggle to get our door open. Reception had given new guests our room# when they should actually be checking into the room next to ours. By now we were just like, seriously? On a positive note, the pool areas were great. The grounds themselves are pretty nice (aside from the incarcerated tropical birds near the bigger pool area).. The bad rooms are clearly reserved for Expedia/Hotels.com) i.e budget travellers. The drinks at the Blue Iguana were huge and cheap. The poolside bar was never open except "Family Day" on Saturday, March 26th which had been advertised to the public so all could come in upon paying an admission fee!! YUCK - strangers with the guests! We made sure we were out all day & only went to get a glimpse of this fiasco at the end of our day. Fiasco is one way of putting what we saw. It was also clear on weekends that they were additionally upping their revenue by doing weddings. The area was great though in terms of travelling etc. el Yunque was close. Luquillo too....at Monserrate Beach, where all the kioskos lline the roadside, we ate at #49 and met Saul. Great guy who said he actually lived in Fajardo ...Beach was completely covered in litter and trash cans full and covered by small white egrets rummaging through the garbage. We'd definitely return to PR. The people were so friendly and nice and we felt safe, most importantly. We've been attacked 3 years ago in St. Maarten (near our accomodation at La Caravelle on the French side) so SAFETY is quite important to us. That island was awful incidently. Anyway... We went over to the el Conquistador one evening to see what all the hype was about. It was awful. Huge. Tacky. And after we spent $10 in the casino, we decided to NOT have drinks and leave. You also have to pay parking while there!!!! L'Estacion Restaurant nearby was very good. But L'ole ola a little further down the road was FANTASTIC. Jose behind the small bar made our night. Pason Restaurant/Bistro (also on the same road) was not worth it at all. Overpriced and overrated. Best afternoon Beach/Eat spot: "Costa Mia" in Los Croabas!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Lunch for two (incl 4 Medalla cervesa) = $22!! Nice people working there too.. Anyone who wants further info on our stay or has any questions, feel free to contact us. Cheers and bon voyage!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, No-Frills Hotel”
Reviews.Author: smf1209
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Fajardo Inn for 4 nights last week with my boyfriend. The best part about this hotel is the price when compared to the resorts nearby. The hotel is a good value and a decent place to stay but has the potential to be great with some attention to detail and a few upgrades. We stayed in a room with a comfortable king-size bed and a kitchenette. The room was very clean, and housekeeping came daily. The view was horrible -- we looked out at a parking lot, roof of another building, and unfinished construction. The kitchenette appliances were worn & old but seemed clean. Like other reviews, our pillows were flat & lumpy but we didn't ask for new ones, so I don't know how management would have responded. The pool area is beautiful, but the swim-up bar was closed and we learned that it rarely opens - very disappointing! We ate a few times at the Blue Iguana bar & grill and the food/drinks/service were all good. They have a new chef or chef manager who seems to be working hard to improve the food, etc. We had no problems with speed of service at the Blue Iguana - everyone was very responsive. The neighborhood looks rough, but seemed perfectly safe - it's true, non-touristy Puerto Rico. Close to the ferry, which is nice if you're heading to Culebra or Vieques for the day. Just be sure to get to the ferry early to get in line for tickets! Also close to El Yunque and Luquillo, which is a nice perk. We discovered Golden Sweet Bakery and La Estacion restaurant nearby and loved them! Overall, if you don't plan on being at your hotel much, this is a good place with a central location for day-trips. About an hour to the airport during morning rush-hour, 15-minutes to the Luquillo kiosks & beach, 20 minutes to El Yunque, less than 5 minutes to the ferry.

Reviews.Title: “VERY detailed review, including as many pics as "TA" allows”
Reviews.Author: tickerlock
Reviews.Content: GET a CAR! If you come to this side of the Island don't plan on walking, (there's not much for sidewalks) Cabs will take you where you need to go, but its spendy. (25 bucks round trip to the 7 seas beach 10 min. away) If you use the Hotel shuttle and you land in San Juan, it is $139.00 round trip to get to the hotel. (a cab is 180.00) its about an hour away from San Juan. When you and if you decide to book it, expect GREAT customer service at the front desk, everyone went out of their way to book us our catamaran and snorkeling tour, they called pizza places for specials for us (I'm not fluent in Spanish at all!) They seriously go out of their way to make sure you have a good time or at least understand whats going on. The beds are very comfortable, (ask for a couple more pillows tho) TV is a bit small BUT it has cartoon network, nick, usa, tbs, fox (spanish) and about 20 other channels. No refrigerator or microwave, there are washer and dryers tho, 1.50 each. Quiet neighborhood, for as bad as it looks around the Fajardo Inn, its a quiet neighborhood. Keep in mind PR has a 16.5% un employment rate and with such nice weather (82 during the day and 76 at night) I don't think I'd move much either, however...you can't be that lazy not to pick up trash and maybe make the town look nicer, A LOT nicer. A lot of factories have pulled steaks and moved on and left behind a LOT of trash! If you've ever been to Tijuana you're on the right track. The Fajardo Inn IS NICE, and about one of the nicest in town that I COULD AFFORD. Two good size pools, the smaller one is closer to the hotel. The larger one you'll see in the pics. They're NOT heated, but don't really need to be either. The larger one does have a swim up to bar but its not manned. (can't blame them though, after all they're not that busy during the week) Very clean hotel, Very friendly, GET A C A R!! No stores around, NO restaurants except the two with the hotel. The Mexican one down stairs is ok, GOOD customer service. Don't know about the upstairs restaurant... its open at limited times. GET A CAR!! Check out the bird Avery down by the 2nd pool. VERY NICE weight and cardio room. Miniature golf is there too and its FREE! Did I mention to get a car? If it wasn't for the customer service and good up keep of the Fajardo Inn I'd never go back to PR. BUT I'd go back to Fajardo Inn with NO reservations. However, I'd be more apt to go if it was in San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Highly worth the money!”
Reviews.Author: ElainefromChina2
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal on Expedia for this hotel, around $100 a night. The room is huge and comfortable. Their stuffs are very friendly and helpful. I even borrowed their business center freely for an hour video conference. Well, the wireless signal is very weak in the room so I have to do so, which was a bit disappointing at the beginning but happy that they worked out a way to help me resolve it. The hotel is peaceful and beautiful. Plenty of parking and hangout space. The location is not bad if you want to spend 1~2 days to explore the northeast Puerto Rico, which is definitely a very best experience. I also liked the hotel's Star Restaurant. Better than those we tried in San Juan and cost less with better service. We had two breakfast and dinner there. You pay $5.95 to get coffee, fresh juice, cheese sandwich or fruit plate or bagel. Highly valuable and delicious!

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite in Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: Team_Dean_11
Reviews.Content: We loved this place! It was filled, but we couldn't hear our neighbors or anyone in the hallways. The grounds, pools, rooms are kept very clean. The restaurants serve good food and make wonderful Pina Coladas! It's close to the ferry as well as Seven Seas beach (awesome). Best place to buy souvenirs is in downtown Fajardo, just watch out for the zombies. seriously.

Reviews.Title: “Strange/They don't care”
Reviews.Author: tshank
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Fajardo Inn for 3 nights, check in was a nightmare one couple in our party's reservation was cancelled, front desk staff was terrible in fixing the problem..why the 4pm check in? ridiculous, the place was deserted. Our room was plain, the floor was slimey, the beds and lines were worn, the lighting dim. No book with area services, not even a notepad and pen, not enough towels/wash clothes in the room, strange tiny tube tv. Our safe was broken, staff made a jerry rig type repair, Ate in the Starfish lounge, only one waiter in the whole place, food was very slow, waiter came out more than once to ell us they were out of food. Food was served, no forks etc had to wait food got cold. breakfast was even worse.. Seems the staff doesn't care if they have guests or not! The pool area was gorgeous...but the bar/grill not open, there was a $5 charge to use the gym. About the only thing they gor right was check out!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, well equipped hotel with beautiful pool area”
Reviews.Author: dmjm
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fajardo Inn for a couple nights before departing to Culebra. The rooms were clean and spacious and the kitchenettes in the rooms were great. The workout area was fantastic - also well equipped and very clean and open. The only downside was the requirement to pay to use the workout area if you stayed less than 3 nights. The hotel pool is like the rooms and workout area -- well equipped with lounge chairs and tables and also very clean and spacious. We would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good for one night stop-over”
Reviews.Author: whenshetravels
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for it's location to the local biobay and ferry to Culebra. The hotel provided us transportation to and from our biobay tour ($7 each way) and was a 15 minute walk to the ferry. Pros: Good customer service; nice views; good pools (though pool bar was not open); Blue Iguana restarant and bar had decent food & service; spacious rooms with balconies Cons: When we visited it was kind of empty (a plus for some?); beds weren't the most comfortable--seemed like disposable bedding; a little run down.

Reviews.Title: “Best Trip Ever”
Reviews.Author: bavana
Reviews.Content: I found that this hotel was a faboulous hotel. All the employees treated me wonderfully. They were always willing to help and were always respectful. I tremendously enjoyed the two pools. Especially the Bamboo beach pool. Every Saturday at the end of each month they have a great pool party which is called the Family Day event. All ages love coming and playing in the pool. They even open the bar down at the pool. If you'd like to explore the rest of the island, they have great transportation services. The drivers never have any trouble of where they are going and always keep good conversation. After a full day of either exploring or relaxing you can go to either of the two restaurant. My favourite restaurant is the StarFish Restaurant. The have exceptional food, and great service. I enjoyed my stay very much, and highly recommend other people who love being treated great, having fun, and being pampered with such great food!

Reviews.Title: “The best place for you and your family”
Reviews.Author: karendesy
Reviews.Content: The most wonderful experience! A very clean hotel with excellent service. A beautiful ocean view. We enjoy a trip to El Yunque, the best rain forest. Two expectacular restaurants: Blue Iguana and Star Fish!!

Reviews.Title: “ABSOLUTELY HORRIBLE!!”
Reviews.Author: KaCee88
Reviews.Content: We were in Fajardo over Presidentâ€™s day weekend, so we were very limited in our choice of hotels. Otherwise we would not have taken a chance on a hotel with so many really bad reviews. I should have listened to the reviews. This is the worst hotel that I have ever stayed in -- in the developed world. The beds were swaybacked, the bedspread was not clean, the linens were so worn that you could see through them,pillows flat, the walls were dingy. Fortunately the lighting was so inadequate that you might overlook some of these problems! There was one tiny window with bars and a dirty view of bare ground, weeds and a chain link fence. The only amenity was a 20â€� tube TV. The bathroom was mildewed and had a single (bluish) fluorescent light overhead. Internet access was limited to a room that remained locked all day. Surprisingly, the grounds were well maintained with nice gardens and pools. The restaurants served a variety of good foods at reasonable prices, but the service was unbelievably slow (45 min or more to be served breakfast). Finally, We had read that there were *some*ocean views and that the ferry was an easy walk. If you examine the map, you will see that the Fajardo Inn is 2+ miles from the marina through a run-down industrial area. There is no beach to speak of. (The town of Fajardo is, as far as we could see, not very nice at all.) Although we had prepaid for 4 days, we checked out early to return to San Juan where we were happy to pay LESS for something worthy of a vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Not a resort - just a place to crash”
Reviews.Author: Katsandcards_8
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Fajardo Inn for 1 night in order to do the Biobay kayak tour. Check in is at 4pm - we showed up at 1 and the hotel seemed deserted - but they have a limited cleaning staff so we sat around the "Coco's Water Park" for 3 hours (a deserted couple of swimming pools with a small kiddie waterslide - not a water park). The staff was polite and friendly, but even though we saw less than 10 people in the whole place - no room until 4. The hotel is like an old Ramada Inn - mostly clean - but rooms are bare bones - just a bed & chair & dresser & TV - 2 flat pillows - no wash cloths, no ice bucket, no coffee machine, no frills. Rate was $120 for what is really a $65 room. One plus was the mexican restaurant located in the hotel that stays open until 11pm - so we had food and margaritas after the kayak tour - which was nice. Try to get an internet deal if you need a place to crash - otherwise this is no "resort".

Reviews.Title: “AWFUL”
Reviews.Author: Grumblebea
Reviews.Content: Booked hotel for 4 night. First night we checked in, no view. King size bed with 2 flat pillows, called and asked for two more and they said they would bring more... they never did. The room smelled of a must odor. The decor was nothing fancey at all. In the morning, my toddler was kind enough to bring me a huge palmetto bug (very large cockroach), thankfully it was dead. Went to take a shower and the was NO hot water. That was our first and last night there. I called the site where I booked the hotel and told them that I wanted to cancel the rest of our stay and that we would not stay whether or not they refunded our money. Thankfully they gave us our money back and we stayed a beautiful hotel a few miles down the road for about $20 more a night and well worth it. It was BAD! I would give it 1/2 star.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place, conveniently located near beaches, islands and rainforest”
Reviews.Author: JohnElaine_11
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel on hilltop overlooking Fajardo and Coast! The staff was excellent, went out of their way to please. Comfortable room. lots of amenities-gym, 2 pools, 2 restaurants on site. computers with internet, close to port (ferries to Culebra + Vieques), beaches, and not too far from El Yunque (a must see) We got a great deal when we stayed 3 nights, and wanted to stay another, so they gave us another night at a reduced rate.

Reviews.Title: “NOTE: DID NOT STAY HERE BUT our experience with their staff was excellent...”
Reviews.Author: DandNinSTL
Reviews.Content: I should probably not be reviewing this hotel, since we did not actually stay there, but... We stopped to ask directions while in Fajardo, and the experience was so nice that I feel like I should put in a plug based on what we saw and experienced... We asked the woman at the front desk for simple directions to a restaurant in town (and told her we were not guests), and she was more than happy to take time out of what she was doing to offer us not only directions, but maps, recommendations, and any other assistance we might need (including the offer to call her on the phone if we got lost). We asked if we could look around, and she helpfully pointed us to various spots around the hotel grounds, which are huge. The hotel is at the top of a high hill, and the view is spectacular. The hotel grounds are spotless and nicely decorated. There are two pools, one of which is huge. From the few glimpses we had of rooms, they looked large and nicely furnished. The lobby area is large and well-maintained, there are two nice restaurants in the hotel, and there appeared to be a number of activities for guests (and families / kids). The guests we saw all seemed happy to be there. Again, please keep in mind that we DID NOT STAY at the Fajardo Inn, but from everything we saw (i.e. if the overall service is anything like what we found at the front desk), we certainly intend to give it a try on our next visit to Puerto Rico.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely family-friendly resort, close to amazing attractions”
Reviews.Author: cornish_traveller84
Reviews.Content: The resort has everything you might need - good restaurants, gym and 2 swimming pools - but is also very close (less that $5 taxi) to the ferries to Vieques and Culebra which are the most beautiful islands with great snorkelling; and Fajardo is also a relatively short drive from El Yunque rainforest. Ideal. The staff are really friendly and helpful too.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful grounds, okay room.”
Reviews.Author: Cristina423
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Fajardo Inn for one night so we could head out to Culebra the next day. It was right down the street from the Ferry terminal. There are signs clearly showing the way to get to the hotel from the highways, which was a bonus. We arrived before check in time, but they allowed us to handle all the paperwork and drop our bags off so we could head out to El Yunque. Once we got back from El Yunque we just picked up our key and bags and headed to the room. We walked in and was unimpressed. Very plain with an old tube tv. The bed was EXTREMELY hard, which made for a rough nights sleep. Even after being exhausted from hiking El Yunque and kiaking the bio bay! But I do have to say that the grounds were wonderful! It sits on a hill so that lends to wonderful panoramic views! The morning from the nice restaurant we were able to have a gorgeous view of the sunrise! I would stay here again, if they did some renovations to their rooms.

Reviews.Title: “everything was great!!!”
Reviews.Author: 60745Deb
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was a very nice pick i'm glad I ignored the negative adds. It's hard to pick a hotel that you've never even been to the island. We chose the farado inn to be close to the ferry to go to vequies. We spent 4 days there before our trip over and loved it we'de go back again. This place is very pretty,' The grounds are very lush, there are 2 pools one is really big. The rooms are very clean, the staff were also very friendly and acomidating. Either you rent a car or they can call you a taxi whenever you need one.The best part is we ate the best meals of our vacation in the two resturants at the farado inn than anywhere else in 14 days. Monserate is their new chef and boy did they get a great chef , His meals are out of this world, Thank you all. we had a wonderful stay. Deb and Wayne

Reviews.Title: “fabulous!!!!”
Reviews.Author: evesobadd
Reviews.Content: I had a beautiful time wit some friends I would deff go back again & again I even love the fact that I can tell u about my experience @ the inn <3 it!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A Fabulous Oasis!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: alyttle
Reviews.Content: We Love The Fajardo Inn!!!!!!!! Everyone who works there is competent and so very kind. We drove all around the island and definitely saved the "best for last". The Inn is a perfect location to ferry to Culebra and Viesques; visit El Yunques; drive to Old San Juan; go to numerous beaches; jounrney into the interior; and then return for one of the best dinners prepared by an incredible chef!!!!!!!!!!!! and delivered by our waiter Jose!!!! The Manager/Owner is a most wonderful delightful woman. We are so very grateful to her for arranging our 6 night stay in the Presidential Suite!!!! We woke to the sunrise, the sounds of birds, coquis, and then toasted the gorgeous sunset!!!!!! What beautiful views!!!!!!!! We recommend this "oasis"! We loved the fresh coconut milk thanks to the manager!!!!!!!!We will always remember our unbelievably wonderful stay from Feb.5-11 at the Fajardo Inn. Looking forward to our next visit!!!!!! Mucho Gracias!!!!!!! Sandy and Jim kiamesha lake, ny

Reviews.Title: “Adequate for an overnight stay.”
Reviews.Author: krokro
Reviews.Content: We chose the Fajardo Inn because we were planning a morning departure on the Vieques ferry and needed a place close to the terminal. The Inn is pleasantly situated on a little hill and is within walking distance(.7 of a mile) to the ferry. We chose the economy room because of the brief amount of time we would stay there. The buildings of the Inn have a kind of blocky, institutional feel about them and could use a few more plants and ornamental accents to warm things up a bit. Our room-which we note was the Economy" room-was a little plain and dreary, with a wall and tree blocking much of the light from the window. The inn has two pools, a plain, rectangular "quiet Pool" and a much more elaborate swimming complex a bit further down. It was a bit cold for swimming in the late afternoon but it looked like a fun place to spend a few hours if we had more time. There is also an on-site miniature golf course as well. I'm sure families with kids would make good use of this whole area. We chose not to dine at the two on-site restaurants: the "Blue Iguana Cantina" and the more upscale looking "Starfish. We had read about the La Estacion restaurant a few miles away(A great experience by the way..check my separate review) and decided to go there. My interactions with the pleasant, professional, Bi Lingual staff, both before and during our stay, were all first rate. They even offered for us to leave our rental car parked there for two days for free. A really nice touch. I would not want to stay here for more than a few nights, but as a reasonably priced place to spend the night before heading over to Vieques or Culebra, you won't do any better.

Reviews.Title: “Phenomenal service and food.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Executive chef, monsart (sp?), for the 2 restaurants (star fish and blue iguana) was beyond amazing. He accommodated our every need and request. The food at star fish is excellent! They opened the breakfast area for us beyond their regular hours, because we missed breakfast. They made us some really good stuff at noon. Talk about going the extra mile! The friendliest staff greeted us even after their shifts in the hallway. The resort is amazing and quaint. From miniature golf, to tennis, basketball and 2 pools with an amazing gym facility and lush views. We would have liked a hot tub during the nights. We'd have to remove one star because the mattress and bed was not to our standard. We thought they were pretty cheap with their towels, one day we got only one of two towels replaced; and the other time none were replaced. I'm sure if we asked we could've got towels, but we expected them with our daily room service. Not many dining options in the area, but the star fish in the inn is excellent and rated one of the best in the island. Overall, a great experience and we would come back again!

Reviews.Title: “Where do I begin?!”
Reviews.Author: Carigiet
Reviews.Content: First I would like to say the grounds of the hotel were very well kept and beautiful, as is most of Puerto Rico. It is very difficult to find, and not close to anything, so a rental care is recommended. The first night that we stayed, we ordered food from the Blue Iguana. Our first mistake was ordering Mexican food in PR. It was by far the most disgusting food we have attempted to eat, however that complaint was kept to ourselves. The bed was the most uncomfortable bed imaginable. We did not sleep our entire stay. The mattress was like an abyss, lumpy and saggy, but again we did not complain. We did not venture out for food our third and final night and decided to eat at the Starfish (the hotels second restuarant). We waited for an hour for our appetizer. We even cracked a joke to each other, that the chef must have left to take a break, after making the handful of other patrons food. A minute later we watched the chef walk in from outside somewhere. We decide to leave. Other diners told us on their way out that it took them 45 minutes for there food. I call the waitress over for our check for the two glasses of wine we ordered... 15 minutes later, we GOT UP to see what we owe for the wine so we can go elsewhere to eat, and the waitress cannot tell us the cost of the wine, that her manager was elsewhere and would be up shortly to cancel the transaction. Finally we told her that we were in room 208 and we could be found there for the cost of the wine. On our way out of the hotel, we decided that we had enough of the poor service we recieved and stopped by the front desk. The manager finally strolled in to tell us that our wine was taken care of. It was like everyone working at this hotel was out to lunch. If we are working to pay for service, and a bed to sleep in, that is the least that we expected and this hotel failed miserably. We strongly suggest hiring new management. She not only did not have a handle on her staff, she was insulting with her customer service skills.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful grounds, a nature lover's delight”
Reviews.Author: Mollysslave
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights during a birding trip. The grounds are beautifully landscaped and a haven for many different birds. There are also fruit trees to feed both human and avian guests. There are two different pool areas, with the lower one being the largest. The setting is lovely and the pools very clean and inviting. The rooms are large and very clean, with tile floors. The beds are very comfortable. The staff were friendly and helpful. The hotel is situated on a slope, and some rooms would be difficult to access for anyone with mobility issues, but I believe there would still be suitable accommodations available.

Reviews.Title: “Your best bet on the East Coast of Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: wkahn2
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 6 years ago and ther have been plenty of improvements. If you have a rental car this is a great place to stay. It is very clean, the staff is friendly and helpful, and the new pool is the best. The savings for us were the best. We were able to choose restaurants outside of the hotel and come and go as we pleased. At $105.00 per night we had ample space, a balcony, views of the Caribbean, and a small kitchen with microwave and fridge and a sink and service for two. The ferry to Vieques and Culebra are 4 minutes away, Gambling is 10 minutes. and two of the best restaurants we've ever been to are maybe 6 minutes. Pasion de fogon, and Ola-ola great tapas.

Reviews.Title: “Over rated.”
Reviews.Author: Intlpvti
Reviews.Content: Fajardo Inn/Room 313 We are here on Road Scholar birding trip. Three days ago I eMailed the Inn and requested an upgrade with a view. They say I have an upgrade which is in fact something of a dump. The view is of parking lot gone to seed. Likewise gone to seed is the room, reminding one of the style of an '80's Days Inn. A nice large closet contains four lonely plastic hangers along with an ironing board on the fond hope that someoneÂ would stay more than a day. The dim light in the shower reveals a single small piece of soap,shampoo and conditioner. There is a kitchen with microwave and a rusty refrigerator. Again, why anyone would stay more than one night remains a mystery. The balcony is about four feet wide with no table or chairs to be found. One wouldn't venture out there in any event unless you like a view of dilapidated old military vehicles, trash and roof tops.

Reviews.Title: “Not as advertised”
Reviews.Author: kshawly
Reviews.Content: We greatly enjoyed our time in Puerto Rico, but the hotel wasn't entirely as advertised. Things you should know: the hotel's location isn't walkable to much. The ferry terminal is indeed a 10 minute walk away, but the area is full of factories and stray dogs. Also, many of the rooms smelled funky, and a number of "ammenities" were closed or somewhat misleadingly described when we visited in December -- "business center" was a room of 2 old computers and unreliable internet, swim-up bar was closed, mini-golf was so poorly maintained that putting was difficult, hotel restaurants are lame and overpriced, and there are hardly any other nearby food options. Still, the hotel staff is good spirited. They helped where possible. Nearby beaches are beautiful. And the weather is great!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: David_Clark_2010
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to Puerto Rico and decided to visit Culebra. We arrived to Fajardo late at night and without reservation found the Fajardo Inn. What a windfall. Close to the ferry to Culebra, clean rooms, friendly service, cold air, two restaurants, and we could not beat the price at a 2 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful grounds, but need some practice..”
Reviews.Author: stoph
Reviews.Content: The grounds of this hotel are beautiful! The view from our balcony was very pretty, both out over the pool and to the sea. But...we had a couple of issues with the hotel itself. It was nearly impossible to get hand towels, and it *was* impossible to get washclothes. Each day our bed was made up with clean sheets, and each evening we found a couple dozen hairs in the sheets. I am sure the sheets were clean, but as I said, they could use a bit of practice. Lastly, there were some tiny ants running on the hard floor in the room. They did not bite and they weren't really a bother, and I do realize that it's the tropics...but we had bought some pastries at a local bakery, and the ants truly seemed to enjoy them. The moral here is just to put food into zippie bags. If you can, bring your own pillow. The mattress wasn't good, but wasn't too bad. But the pillows were terrible. There was free wi-fi service, but the connection out to the internet was down when we were there. Not a big deal - I only wanted it to check in for our flight, which I ended up doing on my phone. But if internet is a big deal, keep this in mind. There are two restaurants on site. The grill was pretty good, and the prices were great! The more formal restaurant was not so good, and was quite expensive. Hours here for the restaurants can be quite flexible ("closes at 10" can mean anything from 8 - 11). Again, just keep it in mind so you don't count on a late dinner and then find you have to go out. The Fajardo area was interesting. I loved the "local" feel...my wife would rather have had something a little more touristy. But the people in Fajardo were very nice, both in town and at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome weekend... Excellent Hotel, service and amenities.”
Reviews.Author: YolRodz
Reviews.Content: Since my arrival there the crew was very nice with me and a lot of concerns about my benefit. They want to make feel very comfortable at any time. All the people made their work to do my visit really special for me and my husband. At the start they got a confussion about my room but rapidly they resolve it and all gone good... so Great! the breakfasts were exquisites the taste perfect and the service really really good. The people was friendly and gave to us good faces at any time. Both restaurants are great. The " Iguana" Rest is mexican grill where we can enjoy a lot of mex meals with incredibles prices and taste. The other is the Star fish rest. There we can enjoy caribbean and international menu... I have to say the chef is an artist in flavors and decorations. The dinners is very pretty scene to break the art at the table. So it is fabulous the taste. Good meals good portions and good prices... the gratuity is done by each service guy, they work to that !!!!! Thanks... The best value to enjoy with the family and to rest one weekend. I have to tell my goal was surprise my hubby at his birthday and... done! He also surprise me at the final day of our stay when he told me..." I don't want to go home. I want to stay here one week more , at least". Thank you guys ... great job Fajardo Inn crew!!! We will see you soon!!! Thanks Fajardo Inn to give all puertoricans a place to be rest and enjoy with the family. Also Thanks to give us one place to recommend to the tourists of out there. People get to the Fajardo Inn! Never you will regret about stay there!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, awesome amenities, beautiful grounds”
Reviews.Author: deborahsuzanne
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a full week while learning scuba in Fajardo. With several pools, two restaurants, lovely grounds, and a gym, this place was quite superlative for a reasonable price. Also the room was quite large and comfortable to share with another person. Only accessible by car. I would stay again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Good for a night or two”
Reviews.Author: dilberti
Reviews.Content: I stayed for one night before visiting the rain forest. It was a convenient place to stay for my first night in PR. The drive from the airport was easy. Print the directions for the hotel website. The hardest part of the drive is going through the town of Fajardo. I also stopped at the Walmart in Fajardo on the way to pick up water, sodas and small ice chest for my road trip in PR. I went around to a few places then spent 3 nights in San Juan. Next time I would reverse that and spend a couple nights in San Juan first, then pick up the rental car and go outside of San Juan. The hotel room was pretty basic. The bed was a bit hard, the bathroom was nice and clean. In my room the phone cord was broken. Bring your own travel alarm. I paid extra for the balcony room, but the door to the balcony is not glass - it is normal, so the view is only through the window. The staff was nice and helped me book my next night in another part of PR - Rincon. If you need to book tours - you may want to call ahead first. They didn't offer or have any pamplets out anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “A NEAR MISS”
Reviews.Author: sherylg55
Reviews.Content: This could be an awesome hotel however it is in dire need of updating! The rooms are very rundown and smelled of mold and mildew. The room smelled so strongly, we had to go to a store and buy an air & Fabric deodorizer. Other guests also complained of the same problem. The reception office (check in) is very helpful and very friendly, esp Nancy Baez. She went out of her way to assist us and had great resource info. The location could be nice, but near impossible to find without a guide. Not in any GPS systems so, they are no help in this case. For some reason, the streets do not even exist and the GPS voice refer to them as â€œRoadâ€�. And, the address does not exist. The bathroom sink sits under cabinet and you have to turn from side to side in order to wash your face. And, donâ€™t lean on the sink while you do it or it might just fall over. The shower is large and roomy (no tub) but the shower head is straight out of the 60â€™s and sprays water in all directions. While the furniture is really nice, the mattress is too soft and sinks in middle, the pillows are under filled and almost not there at all. Donâ€™t spring for the balcony! Itâ€™s the size of a midrange gymâ€™s shower stall and there is no room for even one chair. There is a business center available for a cost and there is wireless for free if you are willing to relocate to the lobby area, none in the rooms. They have two pools. One is very large and well designed with a swim-up bar but, it was closed. Adjacent to the large pool is a putt-putt golf course that looked nice (we did not play). The other pool is next to the main lobby area and is standard lounge and cool off pool. They do have two restaurants on the property. The Star Fish (upstairs) was only open for breakfast and for that meal, the food was quite good. Downstairs there is a mediocre Mexican food restaurant that was overpriced and under serviced. The decor is just above a side street dive and should never be designated as the primary food source in a hotel environment for lunch and dinner. This hotel is WAY overpriced at $120.00 ++ (approx. $140.00.)

Reviews.Title: “Not for business traveler”
Reviews.Author: BWilson72
Reviews.Content: I suppose after traveling every week staying at major chains and reading the feedback of others , I decided not to stay at the Conquistador and stay at the Fajardo Inn. My experience with the FI started with me contacted them and asking them for suggestions on how to get from the airport to their hotel, the person at the front desk suggested I send them an e-mail to set up some type of cab service to get there (I was pleased that they had such a service!), however after I spent much time putting the data togethor and sending them the message, they responded that the timeline (of my arrival) was not good for them. When I arrived at the hotel, I was taken in by the way it looked from the outside, it looked very nice, however it was late in the evening and when I got in my room (after the customary long check in at a PR hotel) I received a call from the front desk telling me the a/c does not work in that room and if I come to the desk I can get another room (it is almost midnight when I receive this call). So, I go to the front desk to get a new key, go to my new room and get into the room, if you like Motel 6, or older Best Westerns, this is the hotel for you....tiny TV, A/C that I had to call down to ask someone how to use, hard tile floors, clock which had the wrong time, very old looking room and furniture. However, the bed was comfortable for me....I did ask for a wake-up call, it did not happen, lucky for me I keep my own alarm for travel... Note, I did try to purchase water when I came in but there was none left in their machine and the front desk suggested I take a 5 minute walk (at midnight) to the other machine, there may be water there, hah, hah.
