I read a review that someone else wrote that their food in the restaurant was expensive, I would not mind paying the outrageous rates if they had such things as skim milk or even low fat milk, but the choices that they carry is not what a business traveler is used to. Also, the internet signal in the room was not strong enough to use.... All in all, i will stay at the Conquistador the next time I visit Fajardo.

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay in Fajardo!”
Reviews.Author: Wanderlust_at_dawn
Reviews.Content: Excellent views of the sea and the mountains from my room. Very charming stroll through the grounds where there are many tropical fruit trees. Hotel staff was friendly and informative. Rooms were clean. Housekeeping mopped the halls about three times per day. It is within short distance to the ferry for the island excursions. I felt it was a value and would stay there again. I spent 5 nights here. Downside: only one washer and drier on site, no dry cleaning. Restaurant on site was overpriced but good. I saw others leave on 2 occasions after sitting to eat and seeing prices. Must ask staff for detergent which they serve in a foam cup. The main pool was used by noisy local high schoolers, but also added to the local charm--just a bit too crowded. I spent most of my time off premises.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CaraF_20
Reviews.Content: The room was clean and spacious, with a nice view. The bed was comfortable enough. We had a small balcony with a beautiful view of Fajardo, the rain forest, and the ocean. The bathroom was large. The area felt safe (especially compared to other areas of Fajardo). There was one restaurant with good food opened all the time, and a different restaurant opened in the morning. We had a great stay here, and wished we could come back when we ended up in a much worse hotel in San Juan. We also were surprised by Coco's park - there was a HUGE pool, miniature golf, and more to do. It seemed like a resort without the overly high prices. I had only two complaints: the air conditioner blew directly on the bed and we could hear everything through the closed windows. The people at the front desk were incredible helpful in recommending good restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “I LOVE THE POOL and ROOM”
Reviews.Author: albert407
Reviews.Content: I got a kind size bed and suite. This Place is amaizing, this is a real gem in the East side of Puerto Rico. I travel twice a week and I can not see so many birds and tropical (native) trees anywhere only at this beautyfull hotel. Very Clean and great size rooms. State of the art Gym (you need to include it on your website) and AMAZING POOL.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: Tiffany627
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Fajardo Inn from 5/31-6/2 and we were NOT impressed with anything about the hotel. There was a guy who worked in the office that was very nice and was very helpful in getting us to the hotel when we couldn't find it but other than that we did not like it. It is at the top of a hill and once you go down it you feel as if you are in the ghetto of PR. There isn't any security so anyone can wander into the hotel. The restaurants were closed most of the time so you had to wander into town just to get something to eat and when one of them (the Blue Iguana) was open the food was terrible. The electricity went off a few times while we were there and some of the workers were quite creepy. Now I'm not a diva and being born and raised in NY I am not easily frightened but I did not feel safe at this hotel and would NOT stay there ever again! On a positive note our room was very clean. It is definetly worth the extra $ to stay at El Conquistador or Rio Mar...at least it's nicer and you'd be safer there.

Reviews.Title: “b est decision of the trip”
Reviews.Author: micriollo
Reviews.Content: Fajardo Inn can be a little hard to find, but staying there is well worth the effort. Rooms were spacious and clean, and for the money you can't get a better deal. Sure, you could stay elsewhere for more luxury, but if you are looking for a clean room and a safe place to stay at the end of the day, Fajardo Inn is the place to stay. The restaurant is tops, and it is so conveninet if you plan to explore El Yunque.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great stay.”
Reviews.Author: Ginsu4u
Reviews.Content: Let me start off by saying this hotel has the friendliest staff I have ever encountered. We stayed for a week and had a great time. Close to the ferry and MANY beaches. Five minute drive to large grocery stores, Wal-Mart, and fast food chains. Simple bar and Mexican restaurant on premises was good. Didn't get to eat at the Starfish, maybe next time. Everything was spotlessly clean. The Juice bar was really great and there is even a nice small gift shop. I would not hesitate to go here again and would recommend to anyone looking for some quiet relaxation.

Reviews.Title: “Relax in Fajardo”
Reviews.Author: divinedecadence
Reviews.Content: The Fajardo Inn is a welcome oasis in a superb location. The room and bathroom were both huge and very comfortable. The staff members were extremely helpful in every way. The pools are gorgeous! The grounds are lush and well-maintained. It was great to have two restaurants on the premises. About the only "complaint" that I have is that the quality of the food in the restaurants was not the best, but it was adequate. If they offered a breakfast buffet, that would have been ideal. The room had a fridge, so we went to the supermarket and bought our own breakfast items. At this time there is no wi-fi in the rooms and the business center has internet, for a price.

Reviews.Title: “nice, but not for resort travelers”
Reviews.Author: fattyboob
Reviews.Content: nice hotel, great pools, but not for resort travelers...this is more of a family type hotel...small restaurants, good food, but if you are looking for a place to lie by the pool after sightseeing and read your book, this is it...

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all cost!”
Reviews.Author: jamarshall65
Reviews.Content: The last night I was eaten alive by something in the bed. I truely believe it was bed bugs. My legs are itching with little red sores and it has been 3 days now. I suspect that the sheets that were changed in my room were infested. The restuarant sucks! The service sucks! Go anywhere else! You have been warned.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and staff!!!”
Reviews.Author: smittenkitten_20
Reviews.Content: Fajardo Inn was a great choice all in all. My friend and I were staying there one evening and we regret that we didn't stay more. Sandra at the recption desk was great and ryan at the Blue iguana was a good bartender! The room was great for the cheap price.Our ac broke that night which wasn't great but we sucked it up and delt with it. The door came off of the hinge but matinance was up there fixing the room within minutes of calling. The property was beautiful. The pool was great a little dirty but when its underneath trees it can be difficult to keep it spotless. The location was a little difficult to find as Puerto Rico doesn't necesscarily believe in street signs but after a bit we found it.There's an incredible barbacue place down the road that the hotel reccomended. Make sure you get there! I would definetly stay here again given the chance.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stopover”
Reviews.Author: BillyKmd
Reviews.Content: The Fajardo Inn is very well maintained, spotlessly clean, comfortable, pretty, and reasonable. It is the perfect place to stop over on the way to somewhere else, as Fajardo is not much of a place. It is near the ferry dock for Vieques and Culebra, within reasonable distance of El Yuque Rainforest Preserve, and right off of Hwy 3 heading north or south. Only the mexican restaurant was open for dinner when we were there, and the food was good and resonable, and better than trying to find you way around Fajardo in the dark.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LilyStarInterlaken
Reviews.Content: This place was gorgeous. The grounds were beautifully kept. Two amazing swimming pools and the people on staff were the friendliest, most helpful people. They were eager to make our stay as pleasant as possible. The room was also very nice, spacious and clean. We ate in both restaurants and the food was was excellent in both of them. The hotel has everything the beachfront resorts have except the beach and I can't imagine why anyone would pay three times as much money to stay in one the beachfront resorts when the Fajardo Inn is available.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, peaceful, comfortable, very enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: debnrodky
Reviews.Content: We began our trip heading to a hotel we had read about online only to be sorely disappointed. We drove on down toward Luquillo Beach which we heard was beautiful, it was but very limited accomodations in the area. We spoke with a lovely lady at the Luquilla Sunrise Beach Inn who had no rooms available but called the Fajardo Inn for us and helped us to acquire a room there. We were so tired we didnt care and drove up there only to find this absolutely exquisite Inn! The people there are wonderful, service was wonderful! We enjoyed our stay so much we extended it a few days to enjoy all that surrounded us. This Inn is not advertised and praised the way many others are and we would have never guessed it would be as nice as it was based on information we got here on the internet. We can not express to you how wonderful this place was, we do intend to go back there again in the near future. The pools (there are 2) are lovely, the one on the lower level we really enjoyed. The views are spectacular, the food is wonderful and those that work there are just the best. We couldnt have been happier with Fajardo Inn...If you get the chance to go, make reservations ahead and be ready to relax and enjoy...We just thought it was the best!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Fantastic Staff!”
Reviews.Author: CVSTravel
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel, Fantastic Staff! As youâ€™ll soon learn hotel prices in Puerto Rico are astronomical for both pleasure and business trips however this should discourage you from a visit. Puerto Rico requires no passport for US citizens and most of the time youâ€™d swear you were in Florida but with a completely different flavor! While San Juan has hundreds of hotels to choose from other areas on the island are limited to just a few with Fajardo, PR a perfect example. Thereâ€™s the hugely expensive and family orientated El Conquistador Resort and the Fajardo Inn. Since this was a business trip and cost was a leading factor we booked the much cheaper Fajardo Inn and I must say Iâ€™m not a bit sorry we did. The staff, accommodations, the two restaurants and the location were fantastic. While the Fajardo Inn was a bit difficult to find and didnâ€™t appear on my GPS we had a wonderful stay. The staff was friendly and went out of their way to please us. While there are two restaurants on the property the Mexican style one became our favorite. Prices were low and the food home cook with the Chicken Fiestaâ€™s at the top of my list! Out room on the fourth floor looking south and afforded us a view of the ocean and mountain ranges from our balcony. The Inn also has two pools, a kidâ€™s area, spa/exercise room and an onsite laundry. Beaches are a few blocks away and a trip south along Hwy 3 to the south coast is a must. For the business traveler or even a family on a budget visiting the east side of Puerto Rico the Fajardo Inn wonâ€™t let you down. Enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “very good location”
Reviews.Author: LizLauzu88
Reviews.Content: spectacular view. close to El Conquistador Spa & resort. Fajardo is a great city to enjoy all-water sports, horse-riding, kayaking, nature, relax, etc. Recommended for class reunion. Birthdays and weddings are planned by staff. Very family-oriented and great pools. Great staff too.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location - Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Camille123
Reviews.Content: We were a bit concerned, reading some reviews, I have never reviewed before, but felt compelled to tell others what a great hotel this is! The location is perfect if you want to explore Loquillo, El Yunque, local beaches and the Bio Bay. You MUST have a car. The restuarants were pricey and service a bit slow, but you can easily drive a few miles route 987 - to many loocal options. The staff were helpful and the room was fine, not fancy, but certainly better than expected. The pools are wonderful, clay tennis courts, basketball court and miniature golf were great extras.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Place to stay...5 mins drive to island ferries and Biobay kayaking..”
Reviews.Author: SwapnaMurari
Reviews.Content: We were here for our anniversary for two days....it takes 60 mins to reach this place frm SJU....difficult to locate on GPS...could manage to get the directions with help of the locals they were very helpful(get onto 195 ... directions to Fajardo are clear)...our room was ready by the time we reached the resort..the receptionist received us well and gave all the info regarding the nearby beaches...ferry timings and made us the reservation for the biobay kayaking tour...room was spacious... jacuzzi was gud for 2...the noise frm the AC was bit irritating..but all together place was considerably good..the pool clean bit small though.. the restaurants served good food( starfish and mexican -don't remember the name..:( ) There was no WIFI in the rooms....we had to go near the lobby for internet access....the luquillo beach takes 15 mins of car drive...biobay kayaking tours was one of best experiences we had ...is few minutes away This place would be the best choice if planning to visit the Islands (Vieques and Culebra) and the rainforest

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother....”
Reviews.Author: Gemguy72
Reviews.Content: In spite of the photos you will not have even a decent view of the beach unless you are on the roof. They don't keep the main restaurant open unless they are very full. Otherwise it is open only on the mornings and Thursday through Sunday from about 6PM to 9PM. Since we arrived Sunday night and left Friday we were never able to see the inside of it. The lounge is not worth going to unless you like bad food and a couple of dirty pool tables. The rooms were clean though bugs came an went at will under the doors which had no weather guards at all and had a full half inch between the bottom of the floor and the ground. We had the "honeymoon suite" so I dread thinking what a regular room would be like. The beds were uncomfortable to say the least and frequently the maids would leave only a single washcloth for the two of us to share. The room while large, was very noisy, the steel doors make a lot of racket and have to be slammed to close them fully. We had to unplug the refrigerator due to the amount of noise it made. The jacuzzi was large enough for two people if they are not more than 4 feet tall. They also do not have internet access in the rooms and charge by the half hour for a slow connection in the business office. On the plus side the night desk clerk was a great deal of help when it came to directions and the grounds are beautiful with a mini golf course and very nice pools and exercise facility. If you went to Puerto Rico to hang around the hotel pool this might fit your style for anything else don't bother.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for a budget traveller”
Reviews.Author: uddemir
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Fajardo Inn last week for two nights and paid $90 USD per night. For Puerto Rican hotels this is a very good price in high season. As a budget traveller with a spouse, I was looking for an inexpensive, clean, safe hotel and Fajardo Inn is just the right place. We were given a room with fantastic view of the ocean and El Yunque mountains, which made our stay even more pleasurable. The hotel is NOT luxurious, it is not a resort. It is for people looking for a simple, clean place to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “Second Stay, Still Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Zephyr-TA
Reviews.Content: We were here three years ago same time, pre-Christmas. Had reserved balcony but when we saw how small it was, we asked if we could stay down stairs. They took prompt care of us and refunded the difference! Asked for frige, also provided. All was clean and comfortable. Desk was quite accommodating although we asked for little on this return trip. Grounds were beautiful. We returned to a small breakfast place down the street, was the "Golden Bagel" then but has been renovated for the better (I think now the "Golden Bakery") now offering a full American style breakfast, excellent eggs, ham, bacon, waffles, pan cakes, you name it! All orders are cooked individually so it it's busy, get your coffee and enjoy the ambiance. Good stuff for lunch too! And the prices (I hope no one tells the owner!) are... well quite reasonable! My first GOOD breakfast in 7 mornings! And two more to follow! Fajardo Inn is a good place to stay for taking the day trip ferries, driving over to El Yunque, going to Luquillo Beach, snorkel/boat trips and/or going to the EL C for an expensive dinner and casino. We did go over to Seven Seas Beach, paid our money, only to find yellow flag out... no swimming. That's kind of a bummer, they take your money without telling you no swimming. The beach was dirty and we said "Luquillo!" Luquillo was almost it's normal excellent, clean, sparsely attended (maybe 100 people at the busiest) but on a Saturday, the solitude was totally shattered by some kind of wave runner event being run from the far right hand of the beach. These are the big machines and the folks were racing them up and down the right margin of the beach. They appeared to be going back and forth to the kiosks on the extreme left for resupplies. I hope this does not become a standard fixture, appeared to be a one-time event. Kiosks on the beach were still quite excellent, good food and super Pina Coladas! Generally (12/12-14) most kiosks on the main road were still closed. We also found this to be true for many local beach restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great price for a pretty family resort that my teens loved.”
Reviews.Author: pedalmom
Reviews.Content: The Fajardo Inn was the nicest surprise of our recent trip to Puerto Rico. We had picked it because of its price and location convenient to the ferry to Vieques Island and to the El Yunque rainforest. But upon our arrival we discovered that it was a wonderful destination in and of itself. For our family of 5, with three teenagers, the triple double room was great, with an in-room refrigerator that I hadn't expected. After being at a noisy hotel on Vieques, the Fajardo Inn was super quiet. The full gym facilities were huge and beautiful, and great smoothies at the attached juice bar. The expansive pools with the pool-side bar were great and the service was friendly there and elsewhere. The exotic birds on-site were a fun treat. We enjoyed the on-site Mexican restaurant one night and went to a great local restaurant the other night after getting a recommendation from the front desk. We travel quite a bit, and especially for the price, this is one of the best places we've stayed. One note: you need a car -- be sure to reserve one if you are going at the holidays.

Reviews.Title: “It was no big deal.”
Reviews.Author: MercyNewJersey
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Fajardo Inn for 2 nights and the ambiance was dead. The rooms are nice but the 13 inch TVâ€™s donâ€™t go with the big fancy furniture they have. The food at the Starfish Restaurant was okay, but the service was horrible. There is no free breakfast, so you have to pay for it. There is nothing to do in Fajardo, unless you want to relax and sleep. To use the pool & pool towels, you have to register and get a wrist band (which we didnâ€™t get a good explanation as to why we needed a band) and donâ€™t forget to return the pool towels or else it will cost you $25. Our next stop was Rincon and we couldnâ€™t wait to leave Fajardo. Rincon was very nice & so was Old San Juan. Other than that, being in Puerto Rico is just like being in any other state.

Reviews.Title: “Fun, and thematic of the islands; relaxed atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: h2ogypsy
Reviews.Content: The Fajardo Inn is a very nice hotel for the price. It is not on the beach, but they make up for it with two nice swimming pools, put-put golf, and other fun things. The restaurant is very good and the staff at the Inn are very kind and helpful. I recommend this hotel to anyone riding the ferries, or scuba diving, or doing any other activities in Fajardo, PR

Reviews.Title: “Great hide away hotel far from traffic and noise”
Reviews.Author: MsDee8172
Reviews.Content: With no reservations, I walked in and the staff was soo helpful and courteous. I decided to stay another nite w/o a reservation and the staff was so glad that I decided to stay that I got an upgraded room with a HUGE discount. Felix, Nancy (BX girl) and the rest of the guys.. sorry forgot their names.. are soo nice and friendly. If you go midweek, rate is $90 with bkfst included.. NOT buffet but ala carte! Hotel is def away from everything but if you are looking for a nice cheap hideaway.. this is definitely your place. Rooms were EXTREMELY clean. staff is constantly cleaning the hallways. pool, gym, minature golf.. all included. Definitely will stay again and again and again!!

Reviews.Title: “Great value, nice room and pool - free breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Derek_L20
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my gf for 2 nights, and paid only 90/night including taxes and fees. The room was great with a tv and remote control fan. The room and bathroom was also clean. The staff was very helpful, and there was free breakfast in the morning. The weather was amazing, and it is really close to the ferry, only 2 min drive. I definitely recommend this place!

Reviews.Title: “It's all good... but the food”
Reviews.Author: n_zu
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Fajardo Inn as a romantic getaway. The place is very nice, clean and the staff is very friendly. We had a great time. We got there around 2:00pm; we were lucky to check in at that time because our room was available and ready but not without kindly reminders that check in were suppose to be after 4:00pm. The room was spacious and clean, the bed mattress was; I guess one of those memory foam mattresses, if you're familiar with those and like it, then good, but is not my cup of tea; although, we did sleep in nicely. The layout of the premises is odd and need time to figure it out, but is really nice to walk around exploring the place; they do give you a map of the place. The main pool, Palmettoâ€™s Pool is nice but Coco's Park is the place to go (pools, mini golf and more). During our stay the Blue Iguana Restaurant was closed, not really sure why, no explanations given just a sign posted outside the restaurant door. Our stay included continental breakfast serve at the Starfish Restaurant, (only rest. on site that was open) your choice of either toast or pastries, juice and coffee, beware of this offer is ridiculous, one morning no pastries just toast, the other morning they had both but you could only have either a toast, or a bagel or a muffin, most people ended ordering from the menu, but almost $9 for some eggs is a joke plus coffee is really bad, just go to any bakery nearby, way better food and coffee for less money, in fact eat all your meals outside, try La Estacion and Pasion por el Fogon, really, really good, yummy food, also for a more local experience go to La Estrella del Norte (it was closed during our trip much to my despair, I was really looking forward to those arepas and pastelillos de chapin) Aside from food issues, the place is really nice, we found it easy to get there, there are public beaches nearby (Seven Seas, Luquillo), also to El Yunque Rainforest, there is a lot to do nearby during the day and at night just go ask the staff, but you will need a car or transportation arrangements.

Reviews.Title: “worst restaurant service ever...”
Reviews.Author: Dra.Gonzalez
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel with a group of friends and family, including three kids. The location and price are excellent, however the service in the restaurant was not. We went to the restaurant and had to wait over an hour to get our food. The order was not complete, they didn't know what we ordered, kids food was the last one to be served (it was a hot dog and fries and had to wait 1:10 hrs for that). The next day I went to had breakfast that was included with the package, I also wanted to have scramble eggs that I was going to pay, but the waitress told me that it can not be done like that because it was not in the menu. Theres was only one waitress for the whole restaurant. It has a great price, but I would not recomend it for more than 2 days.

Reviews.Title: “Fajardo Inn out of the way but in a good way”
Reviews.Author: draked419
Reviews.Content: Stayed @ the Inn from 5/31-6/05 I really enjoyed this place out of the way on the east side of the island away from the crowds of Old San Juan but not to far that you couldn't visit. Close beaches Seven Seas, and Lequillo good for the family. My mother, my 3 Kids and my girlfriend and I all stayed in one of there 3 bed Room. It had 3 beds seperated by walls (pratically room) 2 dresses, a fridge, TV w/ cable, 2 Bathrooms, and the master bedroom had a door and is own bath room. The pools were as billed in the pictures large with a great island feel . It was close to all your state side staples ie..(Mcd's, Wal-mart, Walgreens and even a Cold Stone. The staff was Extremly friendly providing maps, directions, and advise of local attractions even setting up a Bio-bay tour @ La Granda Reserve for my girlfriend and I BTW this was a must C while on the Island. All and All a wonderful trip made more so a The Fajardo Inn. the only reason I didn't give them 5 stars was because of the Restaraunts @ the Hotel The Quality was just okay and they were Very Priceeeee! I would suggest the Golden Sweet bakery just down the road from the hotel Very good and high value

Reviews.Title: “Clean comfortable with all needed amenities”
Reviews.Author: Iheartraveling
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fajardo Inn twice while in Puerto Rico. My boyfriend who is much pickier than I loved it. The hotel is bland as far as personality but it is rich in amenities and great for the price. We paid $130 a night which included breakfast (and not just some continental thing, but any breakfast from the regular menu that we would like). The rooms were basic but very spacious and clean with TV and AC. There were several restaurants and late night entertainment on the premises as well as a pool. Also is a gym with tons of equipment for I think a $5 or $10 charge. The staff are totally helpful and gave us all sorts of information about the different activities in the area. We stayed here one night because we took the ferry to Culebra the next day and then again on the way back because we did the biobay tour. I highly recommend both visiting Culebra which had the most gorgeous beach I have ever been to (Flamenco). And if you do check out the bioluminescence bay I would recommend the company with the glass bottom kayaks. I've seen this phenomena in Vietnam, but the intensity was so much cooler in Puerto Rico. As for Fajardo Inn. I would definitely stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “OK Place to Spend a Night - Nothing Special”
Reviews.Author: elbarbado
Reviews.Content: Spent one night in late April, 2009, on the way to San Juan from the southeast of the island. The place seemed almost deserted; parking lot was practically empty, one table occupied in the restaurant and no bar open. Room was OK; large, but not very well appointed. I can't imagine staying here for more than one night; maybe to be near the ferry to Vieques or Culebra, but there's not much more to recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent lodging”
Reviews.Author: rtpaynetx
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed at the Fajardo Inn between trips to Culebra and Vieques islands. The hotel is excellent in all respects; modern, clean, great amenities, friendly and helpful staff, adequate parking, and a good location from the ferries to the islands. The Blue Iguana Grill served delicious food from a great menu. The restaurant staff was very friendly, efficient and helpful. You can't go wrong staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Decent Location”
Reviews.Author: metamer6
Reviews.Content: Our room was clean and huge. We had a refrigerator. We had a balcony with a view to the parking lot (oh, boy). The room was nice, the bed was gigantic and comfortable. The pools here were very nice as well. We ate at one of the hotels restaurants both nights, the Blue Iguana. My wife and I really liked it, and it was cheap. The service was poor, but so is it everywhere in Puerto Rico, so deal with it. It's very close to the ferry to Culebra and to the Bio Bay tours. The actual location of the Hotel compound is in what seems to be an industrial area, so be prepared to stay at the hotel or drive somewhere else. You're not going to walk out of the Hotel gates and find anything to do. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A solid value”
Reviews.Author: rayo80
Reviews.Content: Two adults check-in March, 2009. Hotel would be very difficult to find in you are driving and is situated on a hill overlooking the bay and surrounding valleys on the eastern end of the island. A easy downhill walk to the bahia and Ferry terminal to Vieques/Culebra. Dont look for trendy shops. Our room on the second floor was not ready when we arrived. The day of the week of Monday and our arrival was around noon. This is an early check-in but considering there was no one else in the hotel and the guest was a VIP in Fajardo, the room should have been ready. Day two there was no hot water in the shower. The shower needs grab bars and mats for security. Air conditioner did the job and TV was good. The much publicized Coco's pool and playground was closed. Housekeeping was attentive, friendly and bilingual. Male office staff seemed huffy and the office itself was cold with a pungent aroma of fine island cigars. So, whats for dinner? A big sign opposite the office says MESONES but the name of the resturant is Star Fish. Confusing. The Star Fish is clean, breakfast at six, service is attentive but slow, on our last night we had an excellent skirt steak with Chimichanga sauce. Downstairs is the Blue Iguana for Mexican style food. Pool tables need maintenance. Clean, good food. This place is a good value for tourists and locals. At night you can go up to the five star El Conquistador Hotel, (if you can find it, if not, the FI has a shuttle for a small fee) play some Roulette in the Casino, and eat Italian, Chinese, or the Long Horn steak house if you are craving some beef. Other big attractions in the area are Luquillo Beach and maybe Croabas Natural Reserve, El Faro, etc. I went to Luquillo and ate some good frituras de Bacalao, fried tortilla with cod (very small) inside with the local Medalla beer. . Also at night, do not miss the sonorous sounds of the Coqui, unique in Puerto Rico.

Reviews.Title: “Get MORE than you pay for, hidden mini-resort”
Reviews.Author: ogmeggie
Reviews.Content: We loved the Inn. The rooms were clean and spacious, nothing fancy but had what we needed--TV, fridge, Wifi in the lobby, good bathroom. Surprisingly, the two restaurants and one bar on site were great--also the hotel gave each of us a free drink for each night we were there. The pool is really cool, having a little lagoon and slide for kids, plus they have a hidden birdcage full of macaws. Fajardo itself is a little hairy to navigate, but if you want to be close to the fun of the East Coast I'd recommend staying there. Staff is very friendly too. Will recommend it to our friends and family!!

Reviews.Title: “Tropical Paradise at the Fajardo Inn”
Reviews.Author: SnowbirdsColorado
Reviews.Content: We spent nearly 6 WEEKS at the Fajardo Inn on our first snowbirding experience away from the cold weather in Colorado. Our plan had been to stay at the Fajardo Inn for 3 days, but a suite was available with kitchen facilities and our 3 days became 6 weeks. It was truly a tropical paradise with exceptionally beautiful landscaping, an abundance of beautiful palm trees, an ocean view, rainforest view, a large veranda off our room, mini-golf, and beautiful swimming pools. The hotel staff were extremely accommodating and they went above and beyond in providing exceptional service for us. The restaurants were moderately priced with excellent quality food and service. The atmosphere is very family friendly providing fun activities for the younger generation. The location is very accessible to the ocean, marinas, beaches, the ferries to the islands, to the rain forest, and to San Juan. Whether it's for a weekend escape or for an extended stay like ours, we enthusiastically recommend the Fajardo Inn.

Reviews.Title: “pretty isolated”
Reviews.Author: lookingforculture
Reviews.Content: It took awhile to find this place! You need a car for sure. We felt too isolated so left a day early. Nice big room, the balcony was worth the extra cost. The staff was very helpful, nice big pool area. There was a nice bar area at the pool that was deserted, no drink service or music. Very slow food service in the restaurants. Essentially a great place to stay amongst locals if you are looking for peace and a get away from everything.

Reviews.Title: “This is an extremely nice facility at a very reasonable price.”
Reviews.Author: strange
Reviews.Content: The Fajardo Inn is located near the ferry to Culebra but it has no beach. But it has a large resort atmosphere for a reasonable price. The food is very good in both restaurants. It is difficult to find but well worth the search.

Reviews.Title: “Fajardo Inn whre Ants don't bite”
Reviews.Author: DavidLee01
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Fajardo Inn after reading the reviews from others. But when I discovered many ants in my room, I was disgusted by the place. To make the matter worse was the manager's response that these ants don't bite. I was also very concerned about my luggage and clothes since I had them in the room. When I explained my concern, the manager simply ignored it. I don't know if I was more disgusted by her attitude and indifference towards her customer or the "ants room" itself. Needless to say, I checked out Fajardo Inn even though it was 10:30pm at night, trying to get away from this nightmare as far away as I can.

Reviews.Title: “Good Service”
Reviews.Author: latosca
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night on the way to Culebra. Nicer hotel, landscaped nicely. I would suggest staying here if you have children because they have a pool area with mini golf etc. We didn't use any of that because we arrived after 5:00 and the pool shuts down. Room has tiled floors, TV, AC no internet. No breakfast in the morning. Paid extra for a balcony, but really no point because the balconies are on the side of the hotel and you can only see a sliver of water if you look to the left. Not worth it. The windows were big enough to look out and captured the same view (mountains). Ate at the Blue Iguana bar and grill at/in the restaurant. Do NOT order a margarita there...it was very nasty and pricy. (could just be the person who made it that day though...younger guy and it was more of the off-season). It tasted like water. Food was good though. Front desk called a taxi for us in the morning. very helpful and friendly. Spoke great English as well as Spanish.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: coqui08
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Fajardo Inn for 1 night on our way to Culebra. Our room was nice, clean and spacious. We had a wonderful dinner at the seafood restaurant and slept well. The bakery down the road from the hotel - Golden Sweet Bakery - is great for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “best place on the east”
Reviews.Author: papo55
Reviews.Content: had a very good time it was more then we expected. very clean. will go back anytime.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: vvheart
Reviews.Content: Room is clean but basic, staff helpful. No complimentary breakfast, internet not available in room. An okay choice if you need to catch a morning flight to culebra.

Reviews.Title: “OK place, but didn't clean my room the first day”
Reviews.Author: doctorpanda
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good location because it is close to the bioluminescent bay and close to good beaches. It was kind of hard to find because their address did not come up on the GPS, and they did not have directions on their website. We stayed in room 214. It was fine, although the first day we noticed ants on the floor. We stayed three nights. On the first day we were gone all day and came back and our room had not been cleaned. Just after 4pm when we arrived back, a housekeeper came by and asked if we wanted the room cleaned. we had been hiking all day and just wanted to nap, so I sent her away, but it was pretty annoying that the room was not cleaned before 4pm when we returned. The room was cleaned on the 2nd day. They gym is great! We tried to get towels to use to pool but they were out, so we had to go spend $30 at Walgreens on beach towels. Neither the pool nor the front desk had clean towels for us to use. The Mexican restaurant on site was ok. The guidebooks say it's great and that locals come from nearby to eat there, but it was kind of bland and definitely not authentic Mexican. The margaritas were very sugary. We also attempted to try the seafood restaurant on site. We were seated around 8pm and wait for about 20 minutes for someone to take our order. In addition, our order was taken AFTER a couple that arrived AFTER us. We both wanted the sancocho, but they were out of that. My husband wanted one of their pork entrees, but they were also out of that. At that point we decided to leave. We did drive two minutes down the road to Rosa's Seafood, which was AWESOME. We had a great waitress and the food was great and we were taken care of right away. If you stay at Fajardo Inn, you should definitely venture our and go to Rosa's, and NOT eat at the onsite restaurants. There is also a chain restaurant in Fajardo called Pollo Tropical which is very good. Fajardo also has lots of grocery stores which we found to be helpful for cutting costs. We bought breakfast food and ate in our rooms instead of eating out and bought wine/alcohol there to further cut costs. The beach at Luquillo is a must. We spent the day and rented two lounge chairs and an umbrella for $20. There are seafood kiosks and drinks nearby and they are inexpensive. The parking was $3 and a bracelet to use the bathroom all day was $1 per person. We had an awesome day there.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable and Pleasant for a Brief Stay”
Reviews.Author: BlueRidgeBadger
Reviews.Content: We spent one night at this hotel between a day trip to El Yunque and a flight to Vieques (we didn't realize when we booked the room that flights were about to move to Ceiba instead of leaving from Fajardo; no problem, though, since it's an easy 10-minute drive). We had no complaints--this more than met our needs for a lazy late afternoon after a long day and before an early morning--but I probably wouldn't plan an extended stay here. Our room was pleasant, and the balcony offered a nice view, but as other reviewers have noted, it's small (maybe 3'x5'?) with no furniture--the kind of place you can stand with one or at most two other people, check out the weather or enjoy the view for 3 or 4 minutes, and return inside. Our king-sized bed was like those in all the other Puerto Rican hotels we stayed at that weren't part of major chains--it wasn't uncomfortable, but it was too soft by most US standards, so while I slept well, I woke up with a stiff back. The room was cheerful, not huge but larger than I expected, with a nice bathroom and spacious shower with adequate water pressure. If you don't usually travel with shampoo, be forewarned that the toiletries included within our room were just soap, bodywash, and body lotion. The staff at the main office was very friendly and helpful. Check-in is at 4pm, but we arrived in town around 2pm and stopped by, hoping we'd be able to at least drop off our luggage before driving around town or heading to the beach. Not only did they allow us to drop off our luggage and do all the check-in except actually get the room key, but we were welcomed to use the facilities: two pools (a smallish one, frequented by adults; and a very large one with a large slide, water games, an area that looked like a 25m-or-close-to-it pool, suitable for laps, as well as what looked like a pool restaurant-bar, though it was unstaffed and unstocked when we were there); a minigolf course; tennis and basketball courts; a large gym with quite a bit of nautilus/weight/exercise equipment; a juice bar; a hair salon; and 2 restaurants (though neither were open in the middle of the day, I don't think). We could stop in and give our names even before we had a room number to give and pick up pool/beach towels, and the pools and gym were free; minigolf was $2/person; I'm not sure about the tennis and basketball. Overall, the room, the grounds and the facilities were much nicer than I had anticipated. We ate dinner and breakfast at Starfish. The dinner menu included several Caribbean options as well as some salmon and other non-local dishes; the breakfast menu was very American. Both meals were pretty good. There's also a Mexican restaurant at the hotel. Hotel negatives: our AC worked, but just barely. It wasn't so hot that we felt like calling maintenance, but if it had been just 5 degrees warmer, this would have been an annoyance. No breakfast included with stay, though the Starfish restaurant on site serves breakfast (eggs or pancakes or french toast plus coffee, juice, bacon or sausage, was about $9; there were cheaper options available). No internet access in the rooms; there's a "business center" with one computer and a sign instructing you to contact the front desk for internet access--we didn't bother, but I'm assuming it's not free or cheap. Location negatives: This place sort of has the feeling of an aspiring all-inclusive resort, except it most obviously doesn't include the beach. The view if you look out toward the ocean is nice, but if you look straight down at the neighborhood you've passed through on your way to the hotel that sits atop a little hill a few miles inland, there are some industrial buildings and working class neighborhoods and a not particularly picturesque commercial district. The beach is at least a 5-minute drive away, maybe a bit more (we didn't drive directly). Perhaps families with young children would find this resort largely adequate to entertain them for a short vacation, and it would definitely be more affordable than most resorts, but most visitors would probably want to leave and head out elsewhere--the beaches, parks, biobays, etc., which means you'd probably want to rent a car, and you'd need to make arrangements for biobay tours and do other stuff that would be taken care of for you at the larger resorts this place mimics. I'd recommend this place for people spending one or two nights in Fajardo before or after taking the ferry or flight to Vieques or Culebra or for others stopping briefly in the area. I think it would be an easy place to entertain young children, too. But if you're looking for a home base for a week at the beaches in the region, you'd probably prefer a hotel that's actually nearer the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: gatesnyc
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 4 nights. The hotel and grounds where very clean and attractive, they have many fruit trees and nicely landscaped grounds. We did not use the pools but relaxed by them one evening and it was great. I recommend this hotel to families with young kids as the pool seems like a great place for them, there were a couple of families using the pools. As we where a bit tired the first night we went to the more expensive restaurant in the hotel grounds, it was ok, but you can find better food for the same price or less outside (Pasion por el Fogon, Calizo, and a restaurant by the Bioluminescent Bay, etc) I also stayed in Passion Fruit bed and breakfast. Passion Fruit was great as well and the service and attention was better and more intimate than Fajardo Inn. Breakfast was very good and the place was very clean. Passion Fruit was a bit nosier in terms of people coming in/out of rooms and all the AC units running created a lot of noise. These are two distinct logging options so comparing them is a bit unfair and it depends if you like a Bed and Breakfast vs. Hotel/Resort accommodations. I will probably not go back to Passion Fruit, depends on the price, etc. I only saved a few dollars in Fajardo Inn vs Passion Fruit, so I think Fajardo Inn is a better bang for the buck. On Fajardo Inn - Negative - 1. We stayed in the 1st floor room and the window overlooks a large common terrace, so not much privacy unless you close the curtains. 2. The AC drip caused noise on night #1, as it was hitting the exterior of our room AC. We complained and told them to put a towel out to absorb the noise and the problem was resolved. Positive - 1. Quiet and clean 2. Attractive room and grounds, lotâ€™s of trees and plants. 3. Very good for the price we paid 4. Super close to the Culebra/Vieques ferry 5. Many bakeries around, for good break fast.

Reviews.Title: “Fajardo Inn - Sometimes overly eager wait staff”
Reviews.Author: missingrr
Reviews.Content: Missing Rest and Relaxation only because there is so much to do in the area, the hotel is conveniently located. The hotel was pleasant and clean... and the price was excellent. The wait staff was hmmm... I'll try to explain. Single men are attended to VERY well by a long haired, usually pony tailed waitress/bartender who is above and beyond flirtatious with the men, this I did witness first hand over a period of a week. Single men traveling there will do quite well, no waiting for drinks as another reviewer had mentioned earlier, no rudeness to the men from the long haired waitress. The rest of the staff was very good. Food service was slow during breakfast but no fault of the wait staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great pool”
Reviews.Author: Veivalina
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very big, is a complex, you even need a map! It has a pretty complete gym, mini golf, two restaurants at least on place, and a great big pool with bar. I don't give it 5 stars just because the rooms feel cold: very big, but with lack of decoration ( I like cozzy environments). The mexican restaurant was pretty good and not too expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Service oriented and pleasant staff”
Reviews.Author: rrzzll
Reviews.Content: Nancy B. at the Fajardo Inn worked wonders for us and made our trip a delight. In my opinion Fajardo is a must see destination when visiting Puerto Rico. The reserve at Los Cabezas de San Juan which includes the Fajardo Lighthouse has the most spectacular views in all the island. However, you must make reservations to join the tour and this is where the difficulty comes in. Their reservations # will bring you around in voicemail circles with no way out. Nancy personally made our reservations for us. She also arranged a last minute tour of the Nearby Bio Bay after calling around (no simple thing as these tours are limited and usually sold out on the weekends in high season). The Inn itself is a bit funky and oddly furnished, but very reasonable and clean. Thank you Nancy!

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price”
Reviews.Author: keenanite
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for one night prior to traveling to Culebra and Vieques off the east coast of Puerto Rico. We were there during the off season, so the hotel was very quiet, but we felt it was kept-up very nicely and has a lot of nice amenities for you as a traveler (nice pool area, restaurants, and a great-looking gym...though it costs $5 to use). The staff was very attentive and helpful and the rooms were very nice, roomy, and clean. Had no issues with the hotel and would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, great customer service, but don't expect luxury.”
Reviews.Author: quivondra
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving in Fajardo, I was simply not impressed with the immediate surroundings. It seems this town is a launching pad to see the rainforest and to visit viecques or culebra. My first impression was that the customer service was impeccable. The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful. When I called for towels or pillows, I received them in a timely manner. The honeymoon suite was ok. We had some problems with the door key, but someone came by to fix this issue. The floors are tile and the bathroom is dark with a large tub. It's not hugely luxurious, but clean and sufficient. The kitchen area was a huge plus, since we didn't want to eat out in Fajardo (options were limited) and we certainly didn't want to rely on eating at the on-site restaurants 3x a day. The living area was also decent, however don't expect luxury linens. The grounds were kept up, but there is a lot of construction going on. Also, note that the pool area with mini-golf and tennis courts is open to the public. I did have a good time there for a few days, but as I was on my babymoon, it simply wasn't romantic enough. We checked out a day early when a full bus of local teenagers showed up at the open pool and they started blasting reggaeton. We went to the reception area and booked a room at el convento in old san juan and handed in our keys. All in all, this is a wonderful place in a not-so-amazing area IF you have kids with you. I really wouldn't recommend staying here for romance. After years of trips to mexico, the local beaches just don't compare. I'm sure the surrounding islands are great, but we stood in line for an hour in the morning to get on a ferry. A half hour before departure, they said the tickets had been all sold... and the line had never even moved. I'm a very DIY person and like to rent a car and travel around locally... but in this case, I regret not paying the extra cash to stay in San Juan or elsewhere and just taking proper tours to the islands for snorkeling.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: Jeannie1717
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night on our jaunt through Puerto Rico. The complex is very nice, but a bit hard to find. It is not on the beach and is a little drive to anything else. The rooms were clean, well appointed, but a very small TV for the size of the room. No problems with service or maintenance. The pool area was beautiful, but we weren't here long enough to enjoy it. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for relatively inexpensive, clean accommodations in Fajardo. We did take the East Wind bioluminesence tour in the evening that was 109.00 per person. It was well worth the money as it included a catamaran boat ride to Vieques (with rum drinks included), a van ride to dinner (included in price), at a very unique little restaurant, another bus ride (old school bus) to the middle of nowhere- a little scary for some! Then a pontoon boat ride to the bay where you can see and swim with the marvels of nature. Many folks in our group jumped right in and swam with the creatures that make this an ultra unique gift from nature. You can get more info on this at biobay.com Well worth the money. All in all the Fajardo Inn was fine for us. I am a stickler when it comes to cleanliness and this hotel met my demands.

Reviews.Title: “Fajardo Inn is a good deal”
Reviews.Author: pwny
Reviews.Content: Hotel is a very good value. Huge room for our family of 5. Staff is very gracious and helpful. Will make reservations for local diving or kayaking companies and give directions to local attractions. Great hotel for a family. Pool is nice and very clean. Nice views of El Yunque. Hotel is a short drive to local beaches and El Yunque. Did not have a good experience at the Stafish restaurant at hotel. Service was very slow. The bar and Mexican Restaurant on site is fun. Food is good and kids enjoyed the pool tables.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, quiet hotel.”
Reviews.Author: BoricuaGirlie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel 7/19/08-7/26/08. It was quite a change from the Embassy Suites in San Juan. This hotel is so quiet and calm. No loud music and no kids running around. We stayed with our 3 small children and had no problems. Everyone was friendly. There are a few hidden charges, though. The miniature golf costs $4 and they charge $10 extra per day to use the pool if you have more than 4 people in the room. They don't tell you this up front. We weren't charged the $10 per day because I booked the room for just 2 people but I called later to tell them we had 3 small children (but officially we were booked as 2 adults only). Also, if you want to do laundry you have to get the change for the machines AND the laundry soap AT THE FRONT DESK! Ask for it all there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: pvcar
Reviews.Content: My wife and I enjoyed our stay at the Fajardo Inn this past memorial weekend. Its a economical alternative to El Conquistador â€“ a resort. This hotel (do not confuse it with a inn) has a family friendly atmosphere and locals on vacation. We found the rooms were clean and well maintained. My only negative comment will concern the in house restaurant called The Star Fish. Be prepared to wait for food during the breakfast service since it appears that food would leave the kitchen slowly. The wait is very long. We also heard many other family's complain of the slow service. This happened on both days. An honorable mention should go to Lasaira who was very professional and pleasant while she served. She was hardworking despite the fact she handled a large portion of the restaurant. While the co server seemed concerned for only his small section by small I mean, 2 Tables. Yes two tables with 2 people each one. I know that those 4 people did not have any complaints about service. While, Lasaira had to take care of the other side of the restaurant with about 8 tables. Two of these tables had big family to serve. She literally was running back and forth, from the kitchen to the dinning area. If there were more staff like Lasaira the Starfish would have a better rating in service. The manger needs to enforce the idea of team work. Overall, we recommend the Fajardo Inn. This hotel would look more prestige if the staff had a uniform,simple polo shirt with the hotel logo and khaki pants especially at the front desk. Overall, it was a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: swansrus2
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights wonderful at Fajardo Inn, a charming hill-top hotel that offers spectacular views and exceptional service. The hotel design and landscaping is top-notch and the entire staff is very professional and pleasant. They will provide maps and directions to anywhere you wish to go. Fajardo Inn offers two large heated pools, one of which features a waterfall, slide and jacuzzi, miniature golf, playground and tennis courts,as well as several terraces scattered throughout for lounging. The hotel also provides towels for use at the pools, laundry facilities and internet. The hotel lobby is rather grand and our room was very nicely decorated, offering refrigerator, coffee maker, hairdryer, cable TV and ocean view balcony. The hotel grounds and buildings were immaculate throughout. There are two dining rooms and the food and service in each is great. Fajardo Inn is perfectly located for a trip to Luquillo Beach, El Yunque and the islands of Culebra and Vieques. Spending a few night at Fajardo Inn is a wonderful vacation in itself and is definitely one of the nicest, friendliest and most enjoyable hotels in Puerto Rico. We wish we could have stayed longer.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: krissybunny77
Reviews.Content: While we were only there one night, and did not use the pool, our room was lovely, and clean. The price was right!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with many nice surprises”
Reviews.Author: travelinfamily0f4
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at Fajardo Inn. The room and bathroom were lovely and VERY spacious for our family of 4. While we were traveling people kept asking if we were staying at the Conquistador (which we had looked at, but was out of our price range). People had not even heard of the Fajardo Inn. We were worried, but unnecessarily so!! It was really a pleasant experience from start to finish. The pool was excellent. The shallow depth was perfect for our young children. The front desk staff was always very helpful in giving directions. We stayed in Culebra for 2 nights and the Fajardo Inn for 4. We took day trips to El Yunque and Old San Juan If we had it to do over again we would either stay at the Fajardo Inn the entire time (and day trip to Culebra) or spend our last night in Old San Juan to make the day trip and return to the airport slightly more convenient. Fajardo is really a nice location to do day trips from. Our only complaint was the overpriced food that was unimpressive. That really has more to do with Fajardo though, not the hotel. We did eat at the Blue Iguana - it was fine, but overpriced. The gym was really nice too - it does cost extra. The laundry facilities were a plus (they also cost extra) as we went through more clothes than planned - it was over 100degrees every day.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel, Unfriendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Gars129
Reviews.Content: We are a local family of 3 and just returned from the Fajardo Inn and stayed there for 3 nights. We had a little trouble at check in and our reservation. We where going to have a double room and they claimed we were canceled. The hotel gave us a suite at the same price. The staff was not the friendliest. Rather than that, everything was okay. The hotel was very pretty and the rooms were comfortable and very clean, and have cable tv with movie channels, whic was nice. The pool was nice but had too much clorox when we came, and irritated our eyes. We ate outside the hotel. There is a bakery called Golden Sweet nearby. Do check out Metropol, a cuban and puertorrican restaurant located next to the cinemas, the food and service are great. You have to pay extra for mini golf and gym. There is a buisness center but you have to pay.There is free Wi-Fi so bring your laptop instead. We could return to the hotel though I personally don't like to go to the same hotel twice.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it !!!”
Reviews.Author: dianaprince4
Reviews.Content: Was here for 2 nights on June 18 and 19. This was a family vacation ..... i had booked two rooms. The room my husband and i booked was the Honeymoon suite ........... awesome! Very clean......... had a small balcony. Our two older teen children had a room in the mainhotel..... .... also very, very clean and nice. Front desk staff very helpful with giving directions and asking questions. The pool is incredible ............. and i really liked that they didn't close early like some other places i've stayed. We ate one night at Starfish ........this is probably the only thing i did not like here ........ the food was very overpriced for the quality. The Blue Iguana however had delicious food at reasonable prices. Hotel is centrally located so you can go elsewhere to eat if you want .......... very short drive to Burger King and Sizzler. There is also a bakery right around the corner called Golden Sweet that had really good empanadas.

Reviews.Title: “Okay stay”
Reviews.Author: caraheartstravel
Reviews.Content: If I could give the hotel 3.5 stars, I would, but I'll err on the side of caution. I paid about $125/night after taxes for room 132, all the way in the back of the hotel on the first floor. Pros: Very professional and helpful staff (had maps printed for each desination that I inquired about) with a 24 hour desk, nice property, nice, clean pools, large enough grounds to not feel crowded even when the hotel is full. The hotel restaurant (Blue Iguana?) got some flack in previous reviews -- while I would not call it authentic, the prices were decent and the food always filling, not to mention the convenience of having a place to get some quick food right in the hotel. Good-sized room, well-kept property. Convenient to Seven Seas beach and highway 3 to get to El Yunque/any points south. Cons: I'm generally not a picky hotel customer, but for the price, there were several small problems that I might have ignored had the hotel been cheaper. Doors to the outside were left open at all hours of the day, and cleaning staff left the room doors open while cleaning -- this resulted in an army of mosquitos in the room each night, and fresh bites each morning. Bathroom had a slight smell, maybe mold. The door/lock was smaller than the frame, which led to a banging sound all night long as the door rattled with the breeze -- to accompany the knocking sound in the a/c. Two days into the trip our cards randomly did not work for the room, although the desk was quick to replace them. In an effort to tidy up the room, the housekeeping staff occasionally stuck things in random drawers/out of sight, which meant some hunting around to find things. All in all, as a bargain traveler, I might look for a cheaper hotel next time instead of paying for the nice facilities, which we rarely used (there's too much else to do!). If you're looking for a more relaxed vacation where you plan to spend a bulk of your time at the hotel, or for an extended business stay, this is probably a suitable place.

Reviews.Title: “Beware!!”
Reviews.Author: TampaJay
Reviews.Content: Nice looking hotel, the front desk staff were very nice, I did encounter a real problem with the Mexican restaurant/Bar downstairs, I had to wait 20 min to have someone get me a table..even though the place was empty...another 20 to get the waitress to get my order. (no exageration) Then to top it off the food was horrible, So when I said I want my money back, they got a rude, So I ask for the manager and explained the situation, she was not so pleasant herself. I am not really a picky person, but this was the worst restaurant service I have ever encoutered...Another tip...be careful if getting to this Hotel at night time if you miss the Blue Hotel sign to turn into the hotel you will end up in the Ghetto that it is right next to the Hotel..

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value!”
Reviews.Author: notaholidayToronto
Reviews.Content: When we arrived in the Fajardo area, we went past the small sign that said "Inn." The Inn is in a great location once you realize it is on the hill. We only stayed the night, however, the check in service was great. The staff over extended themselves in order to ensure we were comfortable. They even checked my flight for me, to see if it was leaving on time. We were there on a Saturday, when we arrived we had the front desk book a tour for us at the bioluminous Bay. We went kayaking at night. Try to pre book; we got the last two spots. The area where you kayak has several little "shack" like restaurants. Lively music was playing every where. It was quite the experience to kayak through the canals into the bay. The trip was $40.00 approx. The restaurant at the Fajardo Inn was having a rough time Sunday morning, half their staff didn't show up. Needless to say I drank several cups of coffee and no breaky! We didnt' get a chance to get to the beach around there, however, we went for a quick dip in the pool. Amazing, they had a few different pools, one I had to myself to do laps. Their gym facilities had very updated equipment. Things to consider: -there is no elevator and it is very steep; not appropriate for seniors or disabled unless you get ground level -rooms were adequate; mattress too soft -clean -several families there; obviously a popular place for the locals to holiday as well. ***Rented from Charlie Car rental excellent value and great service.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to find but well worth it”
Reviews.Author: Travelguy1125
Reviews.Content: The fajardo inn is perfect for those who are just looking for a decent priced room with amenities on the property. Finding the fajardo inn is not the easiest of tasks but once you do it is worth it. All the rooms seem to be very up to date. Internet access available as well as 2 restaurants that are reasonably prices. The bar scene on fri nights is great. Hotel staff was wonderful. Beats the prices of the other main hotel the El Conquistador. Also the pools are top notch however when i was there it seemed as though i was the only one there. maybe just the time of year i traveled.

Reviews.Title: “We Love Fajardo Inn”
Reviews.Author: henrizepp
Reviews.Content: A beautiful property, located conveniently to El Yunque rainforest and the ferry to Culebra and Vieques. Staff are exceedingly friendly, attentive, and helpful. Two onsite restaurants offer inexpensive delicious food in large portions. The two pools and grounds are lovely. Rooms are well appointed, many with a view of the Atlantic Ocean. We loved everything about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fajardo Inn, Awesome Choice !!!”
Reviews.Author: LA_BOYs13
Reviews.Content: My buddy and I stayed at the Fajardoo Inn for 2 nights during our week long stay in Puerto Rico. We travelled during the second week in April 2008. We didn't plan our trip in advanace, so finding the Fajardo Inn was absolute gem ! First, the rooms were extremely clean; sheets, towels, and bedding were changed every day. We shared a huge two bedroom suite and the balcony view was absolutely amazing. Beds were very comfortable, our room had satellite t.v, air conditioning, and full shower/bathroom. Second, the newly rennovated pool/bar was perfect for lounging and sun bathing. Good place to relax after a long day hiking in the El Yunque Rainforest. Third, we made good use of the gym and new fitness equipment. Also, Protein Smoothies/Drinks are available at the Juice Bar : Highly Recommended! Finally, the staff was amazing, everyone from maids to servers were very nice and very friendly. The staff was extremely helpful in showing us nearby tourist attractions. The prices are also fairly resonable about $130/night, I have paid more for a hotel with half of the amentities the Fajardo Inn has. I would highly recommend the Farjado Inn to anyone visiting Puerto Rico. Cheers !!!

Reviews.Title: “I am forever spoiled.....”
Reviews.Author: ladyk724
Reviews.Content: Fabulous Inn- exceeded expectations in every way. I am a former airline employee and have travelled extensively. The Fajardo Inn was honestly the cleanest place I have ever stayed- and I have stayed in far more expensive places. Linen was changed every day; floor in room washed every day; - new towels brought down after morning shower. Personnel always had time to answer questions, make suggestions, and always treated each guest like they were there just to insure a good vacation. The grounds are beautiful, well-maintained, and the pool area 5 star. Lots for kids and adults to do and yet very relaxing. Mexican restaurant on premises delicious and very reasonable. Service great- gentleman brought my food to the pool so I didn't have to miss even minutes of a beautiful day. My only complaint? I was spoiled! Will I ever again stay in a hotel with these high standards at such a reasonable price? The bar has been raised and the Fajardo Inn will be a tough act to follow.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED the Fajardo Inn!”
Reviews.Author: motown47
Reviews.Content: I am shocked to read the previous review. If it is from a recent visit, (first weekend in April) I might have been there at the same time. Doesn't even seem like the same place! First of all, the staff was amazing. Everyone did everything possible to make this a great stay. From providing maps, directions, food tips, etc. I found each and every staff member to be top of the line. The manager...I think her name was MarieLynn or something like that-- was particularly kind to my family. I was with my elderly mother and sister and she came and sat and talked with us all about Fajardo and gave us some interesting details of life in Puerto Rico. Cleanliness: top notch. We had a triple room-three double beds-which is a first for us. The room was immaculate. The floor was stone tiles and and the housekeeper mopped the floors every day. The hallways were also mopped daily. I was particularly surprised one night to leave the room around 9 PM and a housekeeper was quietly polishing all of the furniture in the parlor. Sheets were changed daily which has not been the case in many hotels I have visited recently. Food: okay, the Starfish restaurant on the premises was not that great. My mother had fried shrimp which was entirely overcooked. BUT....when we told the waiter he not only brought her a new order, he did not charge for the wine my sister and I were enjoying. The Mexican restaurant on site was really good. And once again, I must disagree with a previous reviewer. We found the prices to be extremely reasonable. Large chicken nacho platter WITH two sodas came to about $7.00. I have paid double that for the platter alone. There are several small places on the road to the Inn which are quite good. The pools are beautiful. Very quiet. If you want the cabana guys and pina coladas delivered poolside, this is not the place. It's the place to read a book. We didn't even see "Coco's park" until the second day. What a place for kids! Miniature golf, basketball, and incredible pools. We swam and sunbathed in the quiet pool right outside our room. (use lots of sunscreen..that sun is pretty intense). Anyway, our visit to the Fajardo Inn was a huge success. Again, I must issue one caveat. If you want action, noise, music, etc. this is not the place. It is a place to relax in a beautiful environment. I would not hesistate to recommend this place!

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel ever!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: kellyrVermont
Reviews.Content: Our stay in this hotel was ruined when I went to get into bed and as I pulled the covers back I was hit with the stench of urine. A previous occupant had wet the bed and the cleaning staff ignored it completely. This was at 9pm and my 18mos old son was fast asleep and we were faced with moving rooms. This is only the beginning...the front desk clerk fou an hour to find us another room and had us move all of our stuuf across the parking lot to another section of the hotel. They refused to refund our money and offered us a free continental breakfast instead. The next morning I realized I had left a few of my sons things in our first room and asked the front desk to retrieve them. After waiting over an hour to hear from them I went to the front desk where I was told that the cleaning people had not found anything in our first room. I then asked if I could look myself which the woman agreed to. When walked into the room there was a pile of our things in the middle of the non-urine soaked mattress. THe woman did not apologize and when I asked her for the General Manager she only said that they were not here and she could not do anything for us. THis was the WORST hotel I have ever stayed at with absolutely NO customer service to speak of.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we were looking for!”
Reviews.Author: mcl9699
Reviews.Content: I was a little hesitant after reading such varied reviews and also that the hotel wasn't on the beach, but we tried it anyway. We were very pleasantly rewarded! We found the hotel very easy to find - followed the directions on the hotel website and got there on the first try! It was a great drive from the San Juan airport - very scenic. Our check in went smoothly and we were in our room in no time. The room was beautiful - tile floors, a wooden sleigh bed, beautiful tv console... The balcony was a little small, but easy for two to stand outside and gaze at the ocean in the distance. We had the door open alot in the daytime to let fresh air in. There were screens in the windows, so we had them open all the time, too. We wanted to get as much warm air as possible, coming from winter in PA! The in room safe was big enough for my husband's laptop (and still had more room). The bedding was comfy, and there was a coffeemaker and a refrigerator, so we bought our own water bottles and drinks... The bathroom was fantastic. There was no mold or mildew and everything was very updated and modern. The soaps even smelled awesome! The tiled shower was HUGE - no bathtub, though. Housekeeping kept the room very clean. The pool was amazing - all tile and looked like it was recently remodeled. Never anyone there during our stay. There was a section for laps, a section with a basketball hoop, a slide, and the zero entry point. A GREAT pool for all ages - lots of shallow water yet lots for adults too. Didn't do the mini golf but it looked nice - $2 extra to try it. Pool was open 8am to 9pm, and a smaller pool was open from 9am to 10pm. This smaller pool was closer to the hotel rooms and was also very beautiful. lots of changing rooms - we checked out then hung out by the pool because of our later flight. Staff was extremely nice and accomodating. Requests for extra towels were taken care of immediately. Hotel grounds were beautiful and very clean and well taken care of. Playground looked nice and aviary was cool, too. The only bad was the restaurants. We only ate at the mexican one and it was nothing special... beef was very chewy...overpriced... Don't waste your time eating there... breakfast and lunch? go the the Golden Bakery right down the street - less than half a mile before the hotel - great food!!! and cheap! and for a beach - go to seven seas beach about 10 minutes drive from the hotel. we went there three times and were always the only ones there. The water was clear and calm - nicer than the other beaches we went to like Luquillo. Go to Culebra and rent a jeep for $130 for the day and beach hop there!!! We went to Zoni - nice, but Flamenco was gorgeous! This hotel was great because of it's location - we always stay on the beach previously so it was a gamble for me, but i loved being close to the ferry - we were late one morning and drove there and parked and got on the ferry in 5 minutes! We were there for 5 nights and it was quiet the whole time - we seldom saw any other guests! Only good food we found was the Kiosk - was it 2 or 12? in Luquillo - go through the dumpy front part and there's a great section on the beach in the back.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: DCChiq
Reviews.Content: Duration of stay: one night This is the about the best you'll get for something in the $130/night range. I like that location was situated right in the middle of town. It never felt unsafe and it was easy to get around (via taxi). Staff service was good. They were quick to jump on whatever we needed. It did feel a little dead which I thought was strange for March but then again, we stayed Sunday to Monday and Sunday is typically a very slow night in Puerto Rico. THINGS WE LOVED: *Great location *Very spacious, never crowded *Rooms were spotless *Several pools *The "inn" had a really nice humble and sincere vibe to it *Prompt service by the staff. Example: We asked for a cab, they called him immediately, he knew most of the staff on site so we felt comfortable with him taking us wherever, he took us to the restaurant and then returned to pick us up and bring us back (and didn't charge us until the cab back home), and gave us a small tour of the town on the way back. *A lot to do on the grounds *State of the art gym with top quality equipment *Great place to order smoothies by the gym *Good quality samples in the bathroom (shampoo, conditioner, lotion) *Coffee maker in room; good coffee to go with it *Great views from the balcony THINGS THAT COULD'VE BEEN BETTER: *The on site food restaurants. They were average at best. Venture out - much better in the area. NOTE: if you ask the staff, make sure you ask specifically for what you want in your dining experience. For example, we said we wanted great authentic quality food and we were sent to a restaurant in a sketchier part of town (Rosa's which was EXCELLENT) where you had to be buzzed in. Don't get me wrong - the food was great and we would go there again since we can adjust to anything and we didn't mind at all about the location, however, what we had in mind was more of a place for good scenery where we could lounge outdoors by the ocean, etc. *The pool bar was abandoned. What a waste of revenue opportunity! This place has so much potential. The pool bar was built in with a grill and NO ONE was working it. It was just abandoned and run down. How can the owner let something like that go to waste on a such gorgeous piece of land?! Alcohol & food are a huge source of revenue -and you'd think this would be OPEN and upkept. My first thought was, maybe their fridge or something is open - but then I thought, they should bring down a cooler and make some money or at least have a waiter/waitress from the bar nearby take drink/food orders. I couldn't understand how this was just let go and not cared for. Overall, it's a good bang for your dollar. I recommend this "inn" for a shorter stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond expectation”
Reviews.Author: ANOrtiz
Reviews.Content: Hotel was great and cozy modern rooms beautiful gyn and pool facilities restaurants were nice. Took day trip to Culebra island and shrt ride to regional airport and ferry. I ve been to other island hotels and this one is #1 in my book. Service was beyond expectation. One negative had to pay seperately for gym and you will need a car to get about.

Reviews.Title: “Fun but no beach”
Reviews.Author: Meredy
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very clean and the property has alot to offer. Put-Put golf, two pools -one standard and the other with a river, slide, basketball and jacuzzi, a playground, a large aviary, two restaurants and a very nice work-out room. To get to the beach, you have to drive about 5 minutes, which we did. We also went to the Conquistador resort nearby for lunch. Our room with a small balcony was $140 for two. It would be a good place to stay with kids for a day or two before catching the Fajardo ferry to Culebra or Vieques.

Reviews.Title: “A Bit Sad . . .”
Reviews.Author: cyasukot
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two days while exploring El Yunke before going off to Vieques. The Hotel is serviceable, but it seems like it's seen better days. The restaurant fare is microwaved and dinner at the Starfish (the onsite restaurant) had terrible service and food and ambiance reminiscent of a airport lounge late at night. Everything you want comes at an extra price (exercise room, internet) and there are draconian rules in effect at the pool, whose swim up bar featured in their brochure no longer exists (the seats are still there, and a half torn down tiki hut sits sadly on the cement, but it is not functional and no staff are around the pool to help with any requests). There is no collection of brochures for local dining or attractions, so you're on your own. We got lost at night in a slightly alarming neighborhood foraging for food. We finally found the Metropol restaurant the next day and had a good meal there - wish this type of local dining had been available at the hotel.
