Front desk staff was helpful when asked, but seemed more oriented towards checking people in and out. Room was a bit musty and strangely, the shower has no ledge for your bathing products even though it was gargantuan in size.

Reviews.Title: “The Inn good, the setting bad...”
Reviews.Author: IndyMary41
Reviews.Content: Pros: Beautiful, well maintained, scenic facilities, Friendly and helpful staff, Clean rooms. Cons: Location and surrounding streets and neighborhood, security questions, overcharged based on menu prices at restaurants, fees for use of the fitness facility. The Inn was a very nice place. I want to begin this review with the major issues we had, however. Our priorities were safety and ease of getting around since the Inn is tucked away from other tourist-type destinations. Please read on, though, to the positives of the Inn, if my stated concerns are not high on your personal priority list. I agree with previous reviews that state it is not in a good location. It sits near industrial sites and a run-down community. Traffic problems and poverty abound in the vicinity. Of course, this is not the inn's fault, but travelers should beware if these are the issues that concern them: First-Although we experienced no direct threats to our security, the grounds of Fajardo Inn are not gated and we saw no evidence of on-site security....? Secondary entrance doors were left standing open during the day. Second-Driving to and from the Inn was treacherous! Streets near the Inn were very rough, with large potholes and traffic was very congested at times. If you plan to drive around Fajardo and Puerto Rico at all, note that the driving of locals is very unpredictable and wreckless by U.S. standards. Rules at stop lights are disregarded (stopping seems to be more of a suggestion), drivers cut others off on the thoroughfares and at corners. They are impatient, regularly laying on the horn and waving their hands in the air at other drivers! On Sunday of our visit, there were many people riding horseback on the streets (during the day and in the dark), blocking traffic, darting across in front of automobiles (at one location, with the horses tied up, the people sat in the roadways in the dark. This made even the safest driving hazardous). At the major intersection nearest the Inn, a local was approaching the car and panhandling daily. The Inn itself is not a bad place, however. The facility itself was beautiful, with breath-taking views. The rooms were very clean and supplied daily (complimentary coffee,soaps, shampoo, conditioner, and lotion). The staff was friendly and accommodating. The pools were clean and inviting. The food at the Blue Iguana was good, while the Star Fish was fair. Service in both restaurants was average. *Beware, however, that we were consistently overcharged on meals, drinks, etc. When we pointed this out, the response was that the menu prices need updating. (This seemed to be a trend, as the same thing happened at the highly recommended Rosa's). We found that the local restaurants in general were overrated, lacking high quality service and/or pleasant "fine" dining atmosphere as ratings suggest. We came to believe that ratings were likely based on comparisions with other local establishments. We did not utilize the fitness facility, due to the fact there was an $5 fee for each session. On a final note, I read another reviewer's comment that plumbing was not functioning properly. We experienced that also.

Reviews.Title: “Cordial receptionist, Clean rooms, Great Flora on Property”
Reviews.Author: underwayatlast
Reviews.Content: I want to thank the people who work in the reception area for their cordial welcome and assistance. It was a pleasure to meet you. I had a problem at a condo, bed rock beds, so I came to this hotel to finally get some sleep, and all was fine. Thanks. Lunches were fantastic at their facility. Unfortunately, evening dinners were the opposite. My pene macaroni plate with shrimp was about room temperature when served after waiting over 40 minutes. I think the temperature at seating was 45F, maybe they might need to turn the AC up? The waitress was pleasant, the delay wasn't her fault. Breakfast: A buffett was on the menu, but their wasn't one. I picked french toast, and three egg whites on the side. All tasted great but I was charged $8 for the egg whites on top of $8 for the french toast. I like that profit margin! The next day we ate dinner at Rosa's seafood, located near the ferry dock area. The red snapper was something to photograph, I felt bad wanting to eat it until I took my first bite. It was a skelton in about 20 minutes, fantastic. I wanted to hire the cook and take him home. Sorry I got off the subject, but that's the place to eat if you like seafood. Back to ' the inn'. In summary: The pros: clean rooms, good beds, wonderful receptionists, great variety of flora. Great lunches . The cons: food service in the evening was poor.Waitresses were very nice and cordial. Breakfast: was great with a few surprises.

Reviews.Title: “Has much potential, but needs to work on details”
Reviews.Author: ElGringoViajero
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Fajardo Inn for the last two nights of a trip to Puerto Rico. The hotel is in the coastal city of Fajardo. The best way to summarize this hotel is that it is nice, but needs to work on some details. The directions I was given were not that great and it was hard to find. The hotel is just off Route 195. Once you get off of Route 3 at the 195 exit, Route 195 breaks up after a short distance and the signage is not great in terms of helping you find where it picks up again. The hotel does look quite attractive from the outside. The parking at the hotel is a bit of a challenge since the road is narrow and part of it is on gravel. The hotel staff members at the registration desk were pleasant and gave me an electronic card key for my room. The elevator was out of service so I carried my bags upstairs. I later noticed a sign saying that baggage assistance was available, but the sign had been partially blocked by a plant. I left the hotel the next day at 8am. When I returned at 4:30pm, my room had not been made up. Ten minutes later, I heard a knock at the door and the maid wanted to make up my room. I asked why she hadn't serviced the room earlier and she said she had 30 rooms to cover. I declined the service since I didn't want to leave my room again. By the way, there is no peep hole in the door which is a security risk. In terms of the room, the bed was quite comfortable and the furnishings were nice. The lamps in the room had 3-way switches but the bulbs were the newer energy-efficient bulbs that didn't work well with the 3-way switches. The bathroom had some oddities. There is no hair dryer. Ordinarily I wouldn't care, but hair dryers were an advertised feature. Also, there is strangely no place to put your soap or shampoo when you are in the shower. I kept looking for a soap dish but could not find one. There were two bath towels, but only one washcloth. In terms of the hotel features, I wanted to use the pool but for some reason it closes at 7pm. This is way too early for a pool to close. The room did have an electronic safe - a nice addition if you are using a laptop. I would be willing to stay there again. This hotel has so much potential if it could just work on some of the details.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice To Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: emperorprince
Reviews.Content: From the moment I arrived at the Fajardo Inn, everyone was extremely welcoming and very nice and accomodating. The hotel was spotless and they had an adorable christmas tree and village setup in the main staircase. I loved it. My room was perfectly clean and the bed was amazingly comfortable. When I stepped out on to my balcony, I had a 180 degree view from the beautiful beach of Fajardo all the way around to El Yunque rainforest. The facilities of the hotel were great, as well. The pool was beautiful every single day and I watched so many families out playing miniature golf. I was able to continue my workouts in their great gym. The staff was always very courteous and polite and my room was spotless every single day. Out in the front waiting area, there were always people just hanging out and laughing with their coffee...just having a good time. The surroundings of the hotel were beautiful. Great landscaping and wild iguanas to lay with you by the pool! At night, the coquis virtually surround the hotel and you can hear them for miles! They almost sing you to sleep. The only thing was the construction going on in a small area in the parking lot, but that is unavoidable. I absolutely loved this place and if I am in Puerto Rico again will DEFINITELY choose the Fajardo Inn. Thank you so much for a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Nice”
Reviews.Author: BroncoBill
Reviews.Content: This hotel is quite nice. The rooms are large, and beds comfortable. They also have laundry facilities on site, which makes it very nice if you're changing hotels every day. The downside is that there are no elevators, however they do have a sign up that if you need help with your bags----ask. Getting morning coffee means walking downstairs and waiting in the restaurant. I tried the Mexican restaurant on site--The Blue Iguana, and found their food excellent, and very reasonably priced. (Under 10.00) The front desk staff was exceptional, and very helpful. I will go back, but will bring a coffeemaker.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we needed!”
Reviews.Author: SteveBrenda
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were both in need of a relaxing and stressless vacation this year. With her starting back to school and with my stressful job, we both needed a week off of doing nothing but relaxing and enjoying whatever we decided to do for the day. This was our second stay at the Fajardo Inn. We were very pleased with our room and with the service we received during our vacation. The food in both resturants was excellent and service was very prompt and attentive at both. We have come to love Puerto Rican cuisine and enjoyed what ever we tried. The large pool area is one of the best we have ever used at a hotel. The addition of the gym was a greast suprise this year. It was well furnished with modern weight machines(more than we could use) and spin cycles so we could keep up with our workouts. We find the Inn to be the perfect spot on the island for us to stay. It is far enough from the hustle of San Juan, but close enough to just about everything to make it a get destination. If you want a great place to stay in PR, I highly recommend the Fajardo Inn. "Less Stress, More Life!"

Reviews.Title: “End of our Summer Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Tury
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel at the end of our summer vacation. We really didnt know what to expect, since we read so many different reviews, but their prices were perfect for us. My family and I were very impressed with what we saw. The hotel has amazing facilities: two pool, mini golf, basketball, tennis. All of them were included. The only thing was that the swim up bar was closed. But no problem we went up and had a few drinks in one of their restaurants. Food was good and the service too. The rooms are very well kept, is like a tropical atmosphere all over the hotel. During our stay we saw roosters in the parking, some homing birds. And a lot of tropical fruits around the property. We try some of them and they were very tasty. Thank you for making our last days of our vacation a memorable one. See you soon...

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Fajardo Inn”
Reviews.Author: NA0
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews at TripAdvisor, I had second thoughts of my two night reservation at the inn. After arriving at the Fajardo Inn, I was delightfully surprised to find a very attractive inn, tastefully decorated with clean bedrooms and bathroom. Although there were no elevators, we did not mind walking up the beautiful staircase to our room on the second floor. The restaurant prices were average and the food was good. I would definitely stay at the inn again.

Reviews.Title: “Fajardo's Sin”
Reviews.Author: toonjie
Reviews.Content: I was hoping the Fajardo Inn would be a wonderful, lesser known gem that would save big bucks over the Westin and El Conquistador- It did save money, but the savings wasn't worth it! I read a review here that stated the Fajardo Inn is a 2 star hotel with a 5 star pool and that is just about right, only the 5 star pool has some major defects. Let's start with the pool. First, the whole property is very hilly and I wouldn't recommend it for anyone handicapped or who can't walk up steep inclines. The main pool is at the bottom of the hill, so a good walk from most rooms. Most of the pool is only 2 feet deep so you have to walk around 50 feet into the pool before you can actually swim. The swim up bar was not in service while we were there except to feed the 75-100 screaming camp kids that were there using the pool. There was also extrememly loud music blaring the whole time we were there. We had a so-called honeymoon suite, which was a slightly bigger room with a bigger bath with a jaquzzi, only, (major sin), the jaquzzi only holds 1 person-come on, in a honeymoon suite!!!??? Rooms are recently remodeled, but the workmanship is lousy. You could pass an envelope between the seems of the window in our bathroom out to the stairway- no caulk, no wonder so many complain about ants, although we didn't have any. Service throughout was poor, especially for a small hotel and workers simply went through the motions and weren't very friendly. The landscaping is lovely and the property could be a very good one, but the aforementioned "sins" of a small inn make dropping the big bucks on the Westin the best option in this area for a relaxing luxury stay. The Fajardo Inn is also a good 20 minute drive to the rain forest. In summary these are the cardinal sins- the best feature, the pool has glaring design defects and they have sold out to summer camps to make money, totally ruining the atmosphere for guests, service is poor and unfriendly, which is the chief sin for a small inn in my book. Landscaping is nice but it is very hilly and not for people who can't walk well. Rooms are remoldeled with poor craftsmanship and decor is well, let's say 4 dogs playing poker class of art, etc. Inn is too far from Rain forest and best beach (Loquillo) and in a dumpy neighborhood. Oh, and as mentioned in many reviews, signage is horrific getting to the hotel. We all wished we had spent more money and gone to the Westin.

Reviews.Title: “Let's just say... bring some benadryl and anti-itch cream”
Reviews.Author: IamJen08
Reviews.Content: Would definitely not go back. We stayed for a week and the entire time I woke up with new bites on my arms, legs and torso. If you stay here, check for bed bugs before you sleep in the room and be sure to bring some anti-itch cream just in case and some benadryl to help sleep at night. It took a week before I actually got rid of these bites too. On the plus side, the hotel was incredibly quiet (as there were very few people there) and the pool was large. Great views from the hotel and conveniently located near the ferry.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: LaBoricuaCubana
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights at the Fajardo Inn and had a great time. The pools were excellent and we had a nice meal at the Star Fish restaurant. The staff was excellent and we didn't have any issues with them at all. As far as previous reviews mentioning the safety and quality of the neighborhood where the hotel is located...who cares?? You can not see the neighborhood from your room and you can't see it from the restaurant either. It isn't a slum either from what they make it seem. The reality is that there are poor neighborhoods everywhere and the hotel shouldn't be punished for investing in the area. If you want to live in a bubble and not be made aware of social issues then don't leave your home.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Poor Managment - Terrible experience”
Reviews.Author: PuertoRicoCrazy
Reviews.Content: I am a local and have stayed at this hotel many times in the past years and up until 2007 this was a great hotel to stay in. I will start with the bad. During this year I have stayed at this hotel twice and both of the times I have had a very unpleasent experience due to the hotel Manager and new hotel policies. The first time I stayed there were no double rooms available so we book a single for me and my family. When we went to use the pool only 2 people were allowed to use the pool and the additoinal person my 3 year would have to pay 21 dollars per day in order to use the facilities (mini golf, pool, ect) or I would have to book an additonal room and spend the night away from my family. So if you arrive let say at 6:00PM and the pool closes at 8:00PM you still have to pay 21 dollars for the use of the pool... $21 dollars for 2 hours is quite expensive plus $21 for every additonal day. As a consumer these rules are ridiculous. When talking to the hotel Manager the first words out of her mouth were NO you may not use the pool unless you pay the aditional fee weather its 2 hours or the full day you still have to pay for the 3rd person. In my opinion no minor child should have to pay an additonal $21 fee to use the pool especially a daily fee - one of the reasons for choosing this hotel was becaus our son loves the pool. On our second stay we stayed from Sat thru Mon. Sat and Sunday we went out on our boat so we did no use the ameneties. On monday we planed to spend the afternoon at the pool. Check out was at 11:00AM... so we Had breakfest at there restaurant and check out and planed to use the pool for the remaining of the afternoon because well we promised our 3 year old that we would take him to the pool. When we went to pool again we were told we could use the pool not because of the $21 fee but becuase you are no longer alowed to use the pool or any of the hotel amenities once you have check out or before you have checked in. Again we talked with the hotel Manager (VERY RUDE and UNPROFESIONAL LADY)... Her very first words were NO - NO you may not use the pool if you have check out of the hotel. My son bursted in tears... so did my wife becuase she would have to brake her promise to my son . We asked the hotel manager if she would make an exception for that day since we had promised our son we would take him to the pool. She saw him in tears and said absoultly not check out is at 11:00 AM and the use of our amenities after that time are stickly prohibited. Bare in mind, if you stay for one night and you plan to use the pool and lets say you arrive and 4:00PM (Check in Time) you may use the pool and hotel amenities from 4:00PM to 8:00AM on the arrival day and from 8:00AM to 11:00Am on the following day. Dont plan to stay the full day because they will literally kick you out of the hotel / pool and any other amenities they offer. It was very disapointing experience for me and my familiy and i will never use this hotel again unless these new policies are revised. Also, the hotel manager needs some people skills. The word NO should be in there vocabulary. Instead they should always try to find a way to please the customer. It's a shame becuase the hotel is quite cozy and has an execellent pool but the hotel management and new policies and rules can make your stay a very regretfull experience. A Mayor Bayamon, PR

Reviews.Title: “good for the value”
Reviews.Author: adventure36
Reviews.Content: I live here in puerto rico and i went to fajardo for my sons graduation.I would recomend this hotel to families and couples i'll start with the bad: When we got to the room there were ants on the air condition (minor problem)we just ignored it and they went away after the 2nd day.Lets go to the good things:the maids and staff are very nice,the pool is perfect,its clean,big,and has a bar that even serves sodas for kids! The restaurants on the hotel are good but not alot of selection but not to worry there are plenty of places to dine.I went to wendys and walmart at a plaza near by!I hope this review helps you decide to come to this wonderful hotel

Reviews.Title: “Hated It!”
Reviews.Author: SnCollins
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are in our late 20â€™s/early 30â€™s and planned on spending a week on Vieques. Because our flight got into San Juan too late to make the last ferry of the day, we decided to spend Friday night at The Fajardo Inn and head to Vieques the next morning. What a mistake. If youâ€™re considering this, might I suggest you fly from either SJU, the smaller airport in San Juan (Isla Grande maybe?), or the airport in Fajardo and get to Vieques early! Between the hotel cost for the night and the taxi fare to Fajardo, you will end up spending about the same amount. The taxi cost us $60 to Fajardo and the flight to Vieques from Fajardo is $23 a person. Flights leave all the time. Regarding the hotel, I was really surprised after reading the reviews that it was as â€œlow-budgetâ€� as it was. This hotel is not nice. I have stayed in hotel rooms for $50 that were nicer. The room was clean, however, the sheets and blankets were incredibly scratchy and thin and the bed was uncomfortable. They had placed a tiny television in a huge armoire. There were plastic slotted bars on the windows and they did not open. The air conditioner cover fell off. The bathroom reminded me very much of a hospital room bath, although not as nice. There was a metal door that led to a small balcony with no chairs. Our view, the only plus, was very nice. Please note, as other reviewers have said, there are no elevators in this hotel and the â€˜complexâ€™ is built up a steep hill, so thereâ€™s no easy access for handicapped or seniors. The facilities at the hotel are horrible. The putt-putt course was completely torn up and unusable. We played the first two holes and quit, even though we had paid to play. The holes were not marked with numbers or pars and they did not even have score cards. There were kids running everywhere playing on all the holes. The bugs were the worst part. They were absolutely awful, despite bug spray. After golf we made our way to the pool, which could be very nice if it werenâ€™t for the bugs (we did not have this problem anywhere else in Puerto Rico-San Juan or Vieques). We stopped at the pool bar on our way to the pool and were surprised to see four employees talking at the bar, which we (rudely) found had no drinks or food. I wondered why they needed four people to staff it. When asked where we could get drinks, we were told to go up the hill to the other bar. When we arrived, it was also closed. An employee told us they only open it during the summer. At this point we were tired, hungry, and thirsty. We decided to head back to our room to change and go to the restaurant. They have an average Mexican restaurant on site that opens at 6:00, along with the other restaurant, which I believe is Creole (we didnâ€™t visit). Our food was okay at the Mexican restaurant, although service was a bit more â€˜laid backâ€™ than we were used to. From what we could tell this hotel caters to mostly locals and is not anywhere nearly as average as it looks online. This is a wonderful example of a hotel with great potential that just does not measure up. Regarding the area around the hotel, I remember reading reviews that said there were restaurants close to the hotel. We saw nothing other than those on-site and would not have felt overly safe walking to anything outside the hotel anyway. In my opinion both Fajardo and the Fajardo Inn could have easily been skipped and our vacation would have been much better. I absolutely would not stay in this hotel again, nor would I recommend it even to those looking for a hotel just for the night. Save yourself hassle and money and fly directly to Culebra or Vieques.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice but....”
Reviews.Author: marysolc
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nice and for the price a good stepping stone between Vieques and Culebra Island. The hotel is pretty, clean and the pool is great!!! The beds are reallyyyyyy comfortable and the rooms are big. The only bad thing that happen was that somebody stole my professional blower and my hair iron. When I got home I stated to look for then and they where not in the suitcase,I call the hotel manager right away They told me They would call back and I never receive their call back. Is a shame that such a beautiful hotel employs people that do this kind of stuff to the clients. The hotels try to charge you for everything that you do, but but when is all the way around they are not responsables. ??????

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and extremely clean resort for the money”
Reviews.Author: Lasher_mass
Reviews.Content: PROS.... Hotel is extremely clean and it's grounds beaufifully landscaped with all variety of flowers and tropical plants. The room with a balcony is a most, great view of the ocean and the surroundings. The personnel was friendly and helpful. The bartenders at the Iguana Grill mexican restaurant are the best and the food was great and inexpensive. The big pool is an amazing work of art with the miniature gold and Tennis court. CONS....Directions to the hotel are horrible and very hard to find especially if you can't speak spanish and never been to PR. Way too many locals around the grounds of the hotel and the swimming pool which made me kind of nervous. The upstairs restaurant was always empty, very expensive for what they offer. They do not offer continental breakfast, you have to pay for it at the restaurant . we went there once and it was expensive for what they offered so we ended up at Mac donalds. That tells you something. I asked if there was a gym and they said yes. I went down the hill to work out one morning and it turned out that it was a paid gym. they forgot to mention that. They also forgot to mention that you have to pay for the miniature golf as well. OVERALL..... If you're looking for a nice relaxing vacation at an affordable hotel, this is the place to stay. I will definitely consider it next time I visit the island...

Reviews.Title: “My family was happy”
Reviews.Author: drmtwr
Reviews.Content: The grounds were nice, the location is good. I can't believe that you can get the same price for the Conquistador, which is what the previous review stated. I did a lot of research, thanks tripadvisor! The room was not great: we reserved a room with 3 queen sized beds. After we got there we were told that all of these types of rooms do not have a view. I would have like to know that when I made the reservation, so I am giving the hotel a lower rating. The room was a bit dark and musty, but it was clearn and the beds were comfortable. We did not spend much time in the rooms anyway. They have a nice lobby with wifi. The kids loved the pools. We went to Rosa's seafood, the Golden Bagel, Pallo Tropicals, Metropols, Richs, and had some very nice meals. The surrounding area was not great, as reported from a previous review, but I don't think it was squalor. I was thinking that my family would also be turned off by the area, but they were not, and I am proud of them for that. Many areas are poor, but the people are all very friendly. I found the experience very genuine. Its not a resort where you are walled out from the undesirables; you are part of the crowd, not an outsider, and I liked that. When I made the reservations I specifically asked about a room with a view. They should have informed me then that the rooms with 3 beds do not have views. Besides this annoyance the hotel was pretty good.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: Etoile983
Reviews.Content: This hotel is OK for the price. But, I would recommend staying at the El Conquistador, which is only a little bit more expensive (depending on the season). The staff isn't exactly helpful, and the location is only so-so. If you visit Fajardo, definitely invest in a trip to the Biobay. I recommend Capitan Suarez, who does a boat tour. If you kayak into the biobay, the kayaking takes up more of your trip than spending time in the biobay. If you go in via boat, you get to spend much more time swimming in the water, which is a very special and unique experience. Plus, Capitan Suarez talks about the area and the creatures that you encounter during the tour, things you might not notice on your own. Fajardo is fabulous, and is well worth the trip, no matter where you stay.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Cachalot
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Farjardo Inn for 5 nights beginning 4/15. First the O.K. stuff: The hotel had some plusses: landscaping, 2 nice pools, and if youâ€™re lucky a good enough room with a good enough view. (Iâ€™ll explain more later--but in the meantime donâ€™t stay in Rm. #208.) Most of the staff were friendly, polite and responsive about requests. The food was O.K. in the Starfish Restaurant. As a whole we found the Puerto Rican people to be very nice. Now the unfortunate minuses. For the life of us we cannot understand why there has been no mention that this hotel, while very nice from the look of it despite itâ€™s hilly terrain, hammering and sawing noises from a construction project on the property, inconsistencies with pool and restaurant hours, internet use and access problems, hotel amenities not available, a lack of knowledge about reputable and decent resources available to visit the sights, stray dogs and cats in the most pathetic condition about the premises--it has not been mentioned that the location of this hotel is among impoverished and dilapidated neighborhoods and from the looks of what serves as â€œhomesâ€� with jail bars or cages around them, some serious crime issues. Although we did not encounter any conflicts in the day during our travels, we guessed that it might have been a different issue at night. The towns are dirty with many boarded-up store fronts and many indigent people idling about the streets or in bars. The Kiosks are disgusting. We canâ€™t believe why anyone would take a chance at these places. When we asked for a restaurant recommendation, we were told to try Rosaâ€™s Seafood. As with most everywhere else we drove to, you had to drive through some of the worst poverty stricken neighborhoods we have ever seen. With this place, though, the restaurant was right in the slum with a stripped down car across the street as an added visual treat. How can you enjoy yourself and supposedly enjoy eating a good meal, when you see all the poverty surrounding you? People and animals living in the same squalid conditions just outside as you are stuffing yourself. Are the people at the hotel oblivious or does everyone just accept the terrible conditions of their neighbors? There seems to be no humane services for man or beast. Before entering a Carvel on Rt. 3, we had to be buzzed in. The same for a Radio Shak store. No doubt others. In the parking lots of strip malls, there often is a guard in an elevated tower. If you go to Seven Seas Beach, one side of the road is a beach and the other side a slum again. This is typical of the whole area. If you have to stay in this section of Puerto Rico for some reason, the Fajardo Inn will do, but we found it difficult to enjoy what beauty there is when you have seen the poverty that is between you and some of the beautiful views.

Reviews.Title: “Nice for the money”
Reviews.Author: mehiphop
Reviews.Content: We (Husband & 3 kids) stayed at the Fajardo in for 6 days in February. For the price we thought it was great. The pools were awesome for the kids & very clean. Although noone was working at the swim up bar the pool was very nice overall. There is also a very nice gym. The locker rooms were very clean as well. The beach towels yiou get at the pool are VERY nice to have. We actually took them to our rooms & used them either for shower & beach too but make sure you returm them, they will try to charge you for them. We ate at the Mexican restaurant several nights for convienience which I thought was very good & the prices were not bad, however the service is slow. We did end up leaving one night because we waited to long & with hungry kids we couldnt wait any longer. There are pool tables in the Blue Iguana too. The room was very nice & clean but I didnt not like the shower. There was nowhere to put my soap & there are no shelves to put toiletries. The staff was nice along with housekeeping. My husband is from Puerto Rico so we had no problem getting around but if you are not from there I can see how you may get a little lost. There is a very convienient shopping center nearby with Wal-mart, Walgreens etc... The beaches nearby are very nice. We visted Seven Seas, Luquillo & Culebra which was our favorite. Culebra is beautiful. The water was crystal clear & the beach has white sand. The ferry ride there is a pain. Make sure you get tickets in advance & sit inside. The diesel fuel really smells. We ate at roadside vendors in Culebra & the main island which was cheap for us & good. We also went to a beach in Vega Baja which was really nice for little ones. It has a shallow area & several hut's where you can buy food & drinks. El Yunque is very nice. Although we only drove through it was beautiful. Old San Juan is very nice too. I love the shops & cobblestone streets. Overall the hotel was great for the price. If you are looking for all inclusive, room service & 5 star treatment this isnt for you but you like to do your own thing & are laid back Farjardo Inn is a definate must.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good expierence”
Reviews.Author: sonnyjr
Reviews.Content: We stayed at 4 different hotels on our visit to Puerto Rico and were sadly disappointed with the Fajardo Inn. There were no elevators in the resort and we had to lug baggage for 4 people up to the second floor. When we got to our room, there was a foul odor which filled the room for our 1 night stay. The ceilings in the room were acoustical tile ceilings which never allowed the room to cool down enough to remove the odor or the dampness which filled the room. The shower was dirty and there was no counter room in the bathroom to set any of our toiletries. The Hotel offered no ammenities at all. No inn room coffee makers, no coffee in the lobby in the AM etc.. the ice maker was broke, the business center that had access to internet was also out of working order. Which by the way is not free. It cost $ 5.35 to use the computer for 1/2 hr - when it is in service. The restaurant charged 9.00 for scrambled eggs, hardly a bargin for such a lowly rated resort. The room furnishings were okay, however they had a large resort vanity, but when we opened it there was a small 19" TV inside it. We all thought this was quite odd looking. But at least they had a TV. The bedding, although damp, appeared clean. The comforter on one of the beds had what appeared to be a large burn hole in it, but they still used it. On a positive note, the pools were beautiful. However you had to climb a number of steep hills when you walked the grounds. I would not recommend the resort to older clients. We love the Island and will return next year, but will not be back to the Fajardo Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel and Grounds”
Reviews.Author: tonymMinneapolis
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the Fajardo Inn from April 2 to 6, 2007. We had an excellent time exploring the surrounding area, and the Fajardo Inn was a nice place to stay in the area. It is economical and although it is not on the ocean, it has excellent clean swimming pools for the kids. We enjoyed a short drive to nearby beaches, Luquillo and Playa Azul in particular. The Fajardo Inn was clean, spacious and the staff was helpful. The 2 restaurants on site were nothing to brag about, but they were ok and provided a convenient meal when needed. The food was acceptable. If you are looking for the all-inclusive, on the ocean style resort, the Fajardo is not for you. But, if you want to save a lot of money and still stay at a nice, clean place that is conveniently located and that offers good swimming pools for the kids, I would recommend the Fajardo Inn. We would definitely go back, if we return to Puerto Rico.

Reviews.Title: “Review of the Fajardo Inn”
Reviews.Author: tkfelts
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fajardo Inn March 31-April 3, 2007. We had come from a week on the island of Vieques, which is quite rustic and rural. Staying at the Fajardo Inn was a nice change from the island. This hotel is not fancy, but absolutely adequate and comfortable. It is mostly a full-service hotel in that it has restaurants, two pools, putt-putt, playground, tennis courts and gym, etc. The rooms are actually nicer than the website photos depict. They have newer furniture and linens. There's a nice table and chairs in each room also. We stayed in a room with two queen sized beds and a fridge. Apparently not all the rooms have fridges, but if you request one, they can generally accomodate at no extra charge. The rooms were plenty spacious. We ate all our breakfasts in the room since we had bought cereal and milk and various other breakfast staples to store in our fridge. There are two restaurants: a mexican bar/grill and a fancier seafood-type restaurant that also serves breakfasts. We ate once in the hotel at the mexican bar/grill. The food was really not good. I had read previous reviews indicating this was the case but thought we would give it a try ourselves. The reviews were right. We never gave the fancier restaurant a try. There are plenty of places near the hotel to eat that are cheaper and tastier, from regular American fast food to locally owned restaurants. The bathrooms seemed to be the most basic part of the accomodations. There was no tub, only a full-size tiled shower. They did not provide any of the typical toiletries you normally get at a full-service hotel. You got a cheap little bar of soap each day and a shower gel dispenser in the shower. Bath towels were provided but no wash cloths...that was strange! Our room was in the original building, so the sink, shower, and fixtures seemed a bit dated. But there are two newer buildings with rooms I did not see that I bet have more updated facilities. There are two pools: the original rectangular pool right outside the main building and a much larger kid-friendly free-form pool a short distance down the hill on the property. The traditional rectangular pool was beautifully tiled and was set in a lovely area. Many adults hung out there who didn't want to be around a lot of kids. You could get a drink from the bar/grill restaurant at this pool also. The larger free-form pool down the way was outstanding. It was beautifully landscaped with palms and tropical plants. It had a "beach" entrance for toddlers in one area, a wonderful waterslide, a lap pool area, and a giant hot tub. The lounge chairs were exceptionally nice also. It was heaven to lollygag around the pool overlooking the hills and enjoy the constant tropical breeze. Just a few complaints: the hot tub was not being heated for whatever reason when we were there and the fantastic looking swim-up bar with built in stools in the water was not in operation. When we inquired about when the pool bar would be open, they said it is only open in the summer and during the x-mas season. We were there during spring break and it seemed a good time to have it open! It seemed a big waste. Also, you have to pay to play putt-putt and use the gym facilities and probably also to play tennis or basketball. These services are not included in your nightly rate. We played putt-putt one night. The course is enjoyable for kids, but nothing fancy for adults. Overall, we really enjoyed our stay at the Fajardo Inn. I cannot say enough about the wonderful pool area there. It really made our stay. One note about the local beaches: there are two within 15 minutes of the hotel...Luquillo Beach and Seven Seas beach. We did not go to Seven Seas. We spent about 10 minutes at Luquillo Beach and realized it was not worth our time. The pool back at the hotel was much nicer. Luquillo beach is extremely crowded with locals and tourists. The sand (what there is of it) literally looks like a construction site. It was practially mud. A child could hardly make a sand castle it was so hard and dirty. The water was murky and not pretty. I would tell you to stay far away from this beach. It costs $3 to go there and it's a disaster. Since we had just come from Vieques where we enjoyed some of the most beautfiul beaches in the world, we didn't feel the need to try to seek out another beach. We just enjoyed the hotel pool instead. My husband did pull a drive-by of Seven Seas beach and he said it didn't look like anything worth going to either. I've attached some pictures of the pool area at the hotel. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Lots of Basics Missing at Fajardo Inn”
Reviews.Author: chickiewv
Reviews.Content: My best friend and I, both seasoned travelers, stayed at the Fajardo Inn for three nights on our first trip to Puerto Rico last week. We knew it was not on the beach, so that wasn't a disappointment. The rates were good, and it seemed to be a good base of operations for us. The first impression was positive: The front desk staff was quite friendly, and our room was clean, quiet, spacious and comfortable, with nice heavy wood furniture. But it's a pain to lug heavy bags up the staircase; there is no elevator. And after a few hours, you start to notice that a lot of very basic things are missing. The bathrooms, for example, have no towel hooks or racks to hang wet towels, and there is only one tiny shelf on which to place toiletries. We also asked the front desk for a hair dryer but were told "they are all out." Nor was there any sort of clock in our room. Another strange thing: We asked housekeeping for extra towels and washcloths, since we were two active women with many outings a day. We got the towels, but for the duration of our stay, the staff would only provide one single washcloth. I was forced to try to wash with a hand towel. That was ridiculous. To my mind, any decent property manager would spend the $30 or $40 per room to add these items, all of which should be considered even for a two-star property. If I were a manager and someone needed a hair dryer, I'd send them down to the nearest Walgreen's (a few minutes away) to buy one for $10. Failing to supply washcloths, clocks and the like is just lazy. (Speaking of Walgreen's ... this is THE place to go for cheap beach towels, bamboo beach mats, souvenir T-shirts and a good selection of post cards.) I agree with another reviewer who found the property oddly vacant. There seemed to be very few employees working, except for the overworked few at the front desk. The pool bar was never staffed, and the restaurants opened very late in the day. We didn't eat at either, partly for that reason. Also strangely empty were the ice machines and all of the vending machines. There was no bottled water, soda or snacks anywhere in sight. Again, these seems fairly basic. Why have machines if you aren't going to fill them? And ice?!? Come on. We weren't asking for a lot -- just the basics. We had a lot of questions for the front desk, such as directions to restaurants and how to arrange tours of the bioluminescent bay, and everyone who helped us there was knowledgeable and super-friendly. This staff is one of the best things about the hotel. But we found ourselves wondering why they didn't write up little sheets on the most common questions or post the information on their Web site. It would be a nice service for travelers and take some of the load off the overburdened desk staff. A few recommendations about the area: _The bioluminescent bay, accessible by tours that depart from Las Croabas, 15 mins from Fajardo, is a MUST-DO. Seeing the phytoplankton glow in the dark is absolutely amazing. But be warned: DO NOT ATTEMPT THIS UNLESS YOU ARE AN EXPERIENCED KAYAKER. Fighting the incoming tide and maneuvering in pitch-black darkness through a narrow channel lined with mangrove roots is very scary and challenging. It's not a tour for small children, first-time paddlers or those who frighten easily. However, there are only five places in the world you can see this rare spectacle, and it's worth the $45 to try. _The Caribbean National Forest at El Yunque is also a must-do. We hiked the moderately challenging Big Tree Trail for about 40 minutes to reach La Mina waterfall and had a wonderful afternoon. The falls were crowded, but the water was lovely and worth the walk. The hike back was easier, with less climbing. _The Golden Bagel, just down the hill and maybe a half-mile from the hotel lobby, is the best deal in town for breakfast. Killer bagels, French toast and coffee for rock-bottom prices. _If you are thinking of taking the ferry to Vieques or Culebra, BUY YOUR TICKETS IN ADVANCE. We didn't know this was an option or we would have done it. We planned to go to Culebra and arrived at the ferry terminal more than 90 minutes before the departure time to buy tickets. We stood in a line that never moved for more than an hour. Seriously. The same guy stood at the front of the line the entire time and never got sold a ticket. As it became apparent there was a problem, I went to the front of the line and discovered that the ferry was boarding all the people who had bought tickets in advance first. Then, if there was room, they would sell more tickets. We decided to jump out of line and buy tickets to Vieques instead, where we spent a nice quiet afternoon on the beach. You might also consider taking a 10-minute flight to either of these islands, which we were told will cost about $100 apiece but spare you the 60- or 90-minute ferry ride and the long waits to get aboard. Finally, if you go to Old San Juan, we strongly recommend you try Aguaviva Restaurant, where the food is to-die-for fresh. We loved the mahi and mango ceviche, the medium-rare tuna steak and the halibut. Do not miss the watermelon sangria. It's one of the best drinks we've ever had. HAPPY TRAVELING!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A bit of Blah...”
Reviews.Author: musicmaker
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Fajardo Inn for a 2 night stay with hubbie and 2 kids 7 & 4. It was clean and appreared nice but really lacked a lot of the little extras that make a hotel a home for a few days. Let's start with the room - no folder in the room giving us info a on the hotel, called front desk but never received it. No clock in the room, 13" TV in big armoire, not enough towels. The pool areas - the large pool in Coco's world was great for kids, lots of shallow 3 ft areas with seating in pool for adults, nice slide, everything looked very new. Actually gave out beach towels , thick and fluffy! The downside... swim up bar with no one working it, no food or drinks available, the hot tub needed to be turned on by the guy at the top of the hill in Coco's hut and it never got hot. The pool is a fair distance away from the main hotel, so you are sort of in limbo land .... what I would have given for a pina colada! The restaurant Starfish was okay . Pasta for the kids, fairly laid back service, slow bar service. Good but again just lacking something that would make it stand out. Oh, no elevator ...pack light. All and all just an average place to stay, if you can't find anywhere else to stay, at least it was clean and not too expensive. I would probably not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Trying Too Hard”
Reviews.Author: SN1752
Reviews.Content: A 2-day stay at the Fajardo Inn capped an 8-day circumnavigation of Puerto Rico. The property just feels like it's trying too hard to be something it cannot be. Its location on a hill keeps it from being a sprawling resort & its location in the country keeps it from being a prime destination. Not that it doesn't try to impress you with a large pool complex... it just seemed out of place, though. It would be like a Vermont country inn adding a high-tech cinema. It's not a bad property; it's just not comfortable. The property's web site indicates that the restaurant is a certified "Meson Gastronomico" but that must be outdated because there is no listing of it on the PRTC website that certifies the restaurants. The restaurant is pedestrian and overpriced, though they mix a good drink. This would be a passable property for a long weekend with a couple of kids, but that's about it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice short stay”
Reviews.Author: marpet07
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during February vacation week and it was not crowded. The location is not near the beach so a one night stay was fine. We went out and explored the area, visited the rainforest and ate in a small restaurant by the bay. The room was large, with a balcony overlooking the area. The ac was strong. The water for the jacuzzi took at least 10 minutes to get hot so don't give up. We had only a snack and drink at the bar, our waitress was very friendly. One pool was closed but the larger one was delightful. Check in was not until 4:00 and they made us wait until then even though the inn was mostly empty. By that time towels were not avaiable at the pool so bring your own from the room. Construction on site is a nuisance but that is unavoidable.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Attitude”
Reviews.Author: Maximum_Mary
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights March 3 & 4 2007. They did tell us that they were very full and only had a suite to accomodate us. This included a fridge, coffee maker and some utensils. The room, although clean, was very basic. No face cloths, no dish soap, no dish cloths, coffee for only 1 night, and minimal dishes. Lots of construction around the grounds - we overlooked an adjacent roof. The worst was their attitude - they really didn't care if we stayed there or not. We felt very unwelcome! We heard that this was common even if you were Puerto Rican. The food was not very good at the "Blue? Iguana" - they microwaved it. The music was very load - but we were told that it was the way the "guys" liked it.The price was good compared to other places and it was clean. Would stay again if we were in the main building - people liked it who stayed there. They just need to work on their customer service - " yes we like our tourists - atitude". This seemed to be an issue for Fajardo in general.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Clean!”
Reviews.Author: mrobinbird
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Fajardo Inn for our last night in Puerto Rico. It was very clean and the staff were very efficient. The food at the Mexican restaurant there is good. I think we stayed in the newer part of the Inn, we had a nice big room

Reviews.Title: “A great destination in itself!”
Reviews.Author: CouleeCat
Reviews.Content: The only challenge we had at this hotel was actually figuring out how to get to it. Once we did though, we were not dissapointed. We had booked one of the honeymoon suites ($135 per night) and it had a very nice view of the city, hills surrounding it and a bit of the water from our private balcony. The room was spacious, very nicely appointed, and the bed was firm and wonderful - the best we've slept in anywhere. It had a jacuzzi tub in the bathroom, which we never did use, wetbar, refrigerator and microwave. There were two pools and we spent quite a bit of time at the larger one. A little warning to those of you, like me, that seems to attract every biting insect within 20 miles, use a bug spray because I came home with over two dozen very itchy bites from the no-see-ums that hang around the pool. The water slide looked fun and I would've loved to go down it even though I'm a 50-something. We were surprised to find that the whirlpool was not a heated, but liked how it water-falled into the larger pool. The first night we had dinner at the Starfish. What a delight. We ordered the Puerto Rican sampler appetizer and enjoyed every one of the little deep-fried treats-the sauce that they served with it was the best we'd had in PR yet. My husband and I shared a Caeser salad with chicken and each ordered one of the pasta dishes and a side of rice and beans. Everything was prepared exceptionally well. We ordered chocolate cake to take back to the room for later and it was very decadent. Was that why I gained 8 lbs. in one week?! The next night we ate at the Blue Iguana at the hotel. Again, the meal was wonderful and priced reasonably. We loved the little "gatos" that roamed the property, especially the friendly little kitten that hangs around the lobby area looking for someone to play with (of course, many people happily obliged her). From our balcony, the sound of the coqui were a treat to listen to at night. This can be a very romantic place to stay but it is also great for families with children. Everything, including the very helpful front desk staff is first rate.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay to check out rainforest, biobay, or Vieques/Culebra”
Reviews.Author: MyAdvice
Reviews.Content: I would rate this place almost a three diamond hotel; there are certain aspects of the rooms that make this place two diamond, but there are many aspects of this place that exceed what is found in a two diamond hotel. The Room: We stayed in the main building; in the main building the rooms with the odd numbers overlook the town area. The rooms with the even numbers have the views of the ocean. Our room itself, which was had two queen beds was huge; it was about 15x20. I can say that it was quite nice to stay at a place that you actually had more than 6â€� between the side of the bed and the wall. The room had an in-room safe, a small refrigerator, a table suitable for eating on or working. One thing that was missing in the room was a microwave. The furniture was nice and modern, the beds were mushy soft and the bedspreads were a little worn. The TV was fairly small at 17â€�. The bathroom was a little dated, and had a shower stall instead of a tub. Overall, the room was acceptable and a little better than what I had expected. One more thing; do not turn on the AC and then leave the room for several hours. The AC is powerful and our room was quite cold when we came back. Since there was no heat in our room, we had to open up the windows to let the heat in! The Hotel: The hotel had a small business center and wireless access. Unfortunately, wireless could not be reached from the room; one had to go onto the front porch or lobby to have access. Fortunately, there were several tables/chairs on the front porch, so one could work there. The hotel staff was very friendly. Be sure to ask them for a copy of â€œQue Pasaâ€� and â€œPlaces to Goâ€�. While I did not eat at the seafood restaurant at the hotel, it was a Mesones restaurant. Mesones is kind of like a seal of approval for restaurants serving authentic Puerto Rico Cuisine. The Mexican restaurant at the hotel was fairly inexpensive, but nothing to write home about. The hotel had two pools; the one by the hotel is a typical pool; the one over the hill (Cocoâ€™s) is the one that you would expect to see at a resort. You need to check in at Cocoâ€™s guest house to visit Cocoâ€™s pool. They will give you towels at the guest house for use in the pool area. Be warned that there are confusing signs about the pool hours. Iâ€™m not sure when the pool was actually closed. There were signs at the pools that said the pool was open till 6:00pm; others that said 7:00 pm and the note on the door in the hotel room said 8:00pm. There is also a nice gym (with free weights) on site as well as a place to play mini-golf, tennis, and basketball. Also, as others have noted the hotel is very easy to miss. If you go to the one-way loop by the docks, you went too far. There is a sign that says hotel as other posters noted, however it is about a 12â€�x18â€� blue sign and very easy to miss. In case you miss the turn, the sign in the other direction was partially obscured by vegetation. The road that the hotel is on is a fairly wide road. I would guess that it is about 30-40 feet wide. Where to Eat/Shop: There are several American fast food and family style chain restaurants on route 3 between route 194, including McDonalds, Wendyâ€™s, Ponderosa and Sizzler. There is also a Wal-Mart, a few grocery stores, and a Walgreens in this area. Except for the Golden bagel and the restaurants at the hotel, there is very little commercial activity near the hotel, so I recommend renting a car to get around the area. Nearby Activities: If you drive down to the docks to take a ferry to Vieques of Culebra, there are gated lots that charge a parking fee of $3-5/day. The ferry docks are to the north. You can get the ferry for $2 per adult one-way. Purchase tickets across the street from the ferry dock. You do not want to take the ferry to these islands if there is a storm coming or if there are high winds as the water will be very choppy. Do not pick outside seats on the ferry unless you want to smell diesel exhaust for the one hour trip. The nearest beach to the hotel is the Seven Seas beach; it is quite easy to get to. There is also a bioluminescent bay in Fajardo near the Seven Seas beach.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: tanchaser
Reviews.Content: Jan. 26th, 2007. We rented four rooms for one night and wish we could have stayed longer. As a group, we were unanimous in being impressed with the facility. It was clean, well layed out, and the view is great. I will return someday for a longer stay. I do wish the pool bar, lower level was open and the hours extended at least for adults. I do feel the Starfish restaurant is over priced but the Blue Iguana restaurant is priced very well. This was a post cruise stay and we were happy with the Fajardo Inn.

Reviews.Title: “We love it. Fantastic pool, nice clean rooms.”
Reviews.Author: prOakland
Reviews.Content: The hotel is on a hill, so its a tough walk up to the lobby and down to the pool, especially if you have to drag luggage. However, if you have a car, you can park it right outside your door. We only stayed here to go on the East Winds snorkel tour to Cuelebra. They pick you up at this hotel for $14 per person so you don't need a car. This hotel is supposed to be only 1.5 blocks from the ferry, but it's staight uphill and the locals told us to take a taxi. The Taxi cost $20 for only a 3 minute drive, so I felt cheated. After the bad reviews about the food being bad and expensive, I was relieved that the food was pretty good and not that expensive. The average dinner at both restaurants was $7-$15. There's a refrigerator in the room so you can take leftovers back, but take a plastic fork to eat it with later. There is no microwave. If you need a taxi from here back to San Juan, I recommend Angel and Mary. They live in Fajardo, speak English, and are very punctual and reliable. I Reserved the taxi 1 day in advance. and cost $60 for 3 of us with luggage. I wished I could have stayed longer, just to relax by the beautiful pool. It had a water slide, waterfall, and crystal clear water that didn't smell of chlorine. Do not bring any valuables to the pool. There were 2 young, kids, around 9 and 14 years old, not guests, walking around and around the pool very slowly, looking at all the chairs as if waiting for you to get up and leave your things unguarded. If you wanted to swim after you checked out, there are showers and lockers by the pool. But you need your own padlock and the lockers are not big enough to hold your luggage. The mini golf was $2 per person per round. They give you really large, thick beach towels, but charge you $20 if you lose it. They have an internet room in the lobby. I think it was about $5 for 30 minutes. But if you have your own laptop, its free.

Reviews.Title: “Okay for one night stay”
Reviews.Author: pickatty
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night, on Dec. 27. This was just a stopping point on our way to Vieques, and since our plane arrived in Puerto Rico after 9pm, we weren't here too long. However, it was very convenient to the ferry that takes you to both Vieques and Culebra. Our room was a regular room with 2 queen beds and tiled floor. Very average, but clean. Not much view, so I wouldn't want to be there for a whole week. We paid about $140 for the night, which was not cheap. Check-in was incredibly smooth, as was check-out. The few staff we interacted with were very pleasant and helpful, and spoke great English. We only had a short time in the morning to enjoy the amenities, and spent that in the new pool. There is a small pool near the main part of the hotel, and a larger newer one on a lower level. The newer pool was very nice. Although we traveled at high season, there seemed to hardly be anyone else at the hotel. Made it nice. Free parking for our rental car was much appreciated! This seemed like a decent place to stay, but certainly no five star resort.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good minus the ants”
Reviews.Author: midgetmama
Reviews.Content: I paid $134.52 for a standard room with a balcony for my mother and I on 12/20. I think the price of the hotel is a bit high compared to others I could get in Puerto Rico for the same price. We spent a lot of time looking for this place, mainly due to bad directions we got from someone in San Juan. When we finally found it, it was very simple and easy to get to and from the hotel. There are a LOT of stairs here. If you're disabled, forget about it. They did have a few ramps going up, and I guess you could stay downstairs, but it would still be a very complicated journey to get to the front door. My mom and I are pretty active and packed light, so this wasn't a problem for us. There is no elevator, but the staff does offer help with your bags if you need it. The hotel had some lovely Christmas decorations, and the grounds are pretty nice. The girl working the front desk was not especially friendly, but she was efficient enough. The room itself was very plain, and when I went to turn on the air conditioner I found it surrounded by ants. I've never had bugs in any room I've ever stayed in (except the Penny Sleeper in Anaheim, which we left immediately), so that was a surprise and made me a little paranoid about climbing into bed that night when I returned and found them gone. There was also some kind of bug in the shower that never moved. We did have a great view of the water and El Yunque and listened to the coqui the whole night. We took the bio-bay tour with Yokahu Kayaks, and when we returned the Starfish restaurant had already closed, but we had planned to go to Blue Iguana anyway, which is open until 11. You have to pay for chips and salsa, which we did. They were good but not spectacular. I got the chicken taco combo, and my mom got quesadillas. Everything was delicious, but the beans were a little too Tex-Mex for my liking. For all this and free refills on the soda, it only cost $19, making this our cheapest meal after the Luquillo beach kiosks. Check-out was easy, and there turned out to not be any bugs in my bed. For the most part, I really did like the hotel, but I think certain staff members could use a little improvement, and the bug problem wasn't pleasant. The whole bathroom also just seemed a little grungy. It's a good and convenient place to stay but slightly overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Just what I needed”
Reviews.Author: Becky55
Reviews.Content: I rented a car at the San Juan airport and headed to Fajardo so that I could swim the bio-bay. It was late in the day and almost dark and I couldnt find any place in the tour books so i stopped at a Guest House that was a dump. I passed the Fajardo Inn but since the do not have signs on the main road I didnt find it until the next day. I wish I had looked harder. I stayed at the Fajardo Inn the second night and it was a delight for the money. They had two sections, the main hotel and a separate building with a different name and cheaper rates. I stayed at the cheaper and used the main pool. Very nice!

Reviews.Title: “Not what we had expected”
Reviews.Author: LAKaren
Reviews.Content: We stayed during the Christmas holiday after spending a wonderful week on Isla de Vieques. The hotel was pleasant enough at first, but then things got pretty bad. We had a room with 2 full size beds. After the first night, my husband was getting bitten by some sort of bug. I don't believe they were bed bugs. We spoke to housekeeping, and they said they would change the bedding & bedspread. This did not help. My husband asked to change rooms, and they wouldn't comply. They said they would change the mattress. This didn't happen. So after the 2nd night of being bitten up, we asked to change rooms again. The people at the front desk said they couldn't do this. It was only after we mentioned "Trip Advisor", they finally agreed to change our room. After that the bug bites stopped. The hotel is pleasant enough for the price but be advised there is alot of walking to be done. There are no elevators but is is only a 2 floor hotel. We were traveling with our young children, so if you forgot something in your room, it's up the steps. It's also a distance to the washer & dryer, and if you use the larger pool with the slide next to the mini golf course, it's another LONG walk and a full flight of stairs down to the pool.So if you have a problem with stairs or traveling with small children, you may want to think twice! The staff was very pleasant but we started off on the wrong foot. We ate breakfast out at several different bakeries. Most served some sort of egg sandwhich or french toast (for the kids). It was cheaper than eating in the hotel restaurant. For dinner, try heading down to the seaport where there is a road lined with many restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great Find and Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: Longwood Traveler
Reviews.Content: I booked two standard suites at the Fajardo Inn for my son and his wife and myself and my partner. I was very happy with the choice of this hotel not just because of the price (which was very reasonable) but because the service and the amenities were just right. No this is not a luxury property but it is clean (sheets are changed every day - you don't even get that at the Marriott), the people are helpful and friendly, the pool (only one was open at the time) was huge and entertaining and the restaurants and bar were well priced and appetizing. The drinks are more than fairly priced and they aren't stingy with the liquor but they do caution about overindulging. Our two suites cost less than $150 per night and were located in a separate casita so it was like we had our own separate hideaway. The king-sized bed was comfortable but don't expect to see a lot of furniture in the room. It had a full kitchen and the bath was okay. The only problem we had was with ants (not unusual in the Caribbean and since we live in Florida something we are unfortunately used to). When I mentioned it to the front desk on the way back from breakfast to my room, she said she would have housekeeping get on it right away. She wasn't kidding - the housekeeping staff got to the room before I did and sprayed the place. Since my son had the upper room in the building and didn't have any ant problems I would recommend staying out of the lower level rooms if this is a problem. The Starfish restaurant was very nice and we ventured out to a few of the local places such as the Anchor Inn and the Conquista and had nice meals at both places. The hotel is very convenient to El Yunque and Luquillo Beach and if you forget something there is a Walmart in town. We also used the Internet service and that worked fine for a quick check of e-mails. Overall a great place for the money. We'd go back there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all”
Reviews.Author: csjobert
Reviews.Content: This place was surprisingly good for the value. It's not on the beach but is a short ride away from the beach. There are two pools one in the main section and one by the new section with slides into the pool overlooking a beautiful landscape. It even has a swim up bar and dining areas. The restaurant does include two restaurants and bar. I would not recommend this place for the elderly or the handicapped because the hotel is located on a hillside and you have to walk quite a bit just to get to the rooms and some going up hill or downhill. There are no elevators. Every thing is located on various levels (bars, restaurants, pools etc.) The rooms are pretty roomy and very clean and include a small refrigerator. The staff was very kind and helpful. If you can't stay at the big resorts nearby, this is your next best bet with a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place”
Reviews.Author: cezzah
Reviews.Content: Had a lovely stay there earlier in the year. Lovely pool complex, staff were all nice and friendly and great grub in the restaurant. Marvellous.

Reviews.Title: “Strongly disliked the place”
Reviews.Author: happycook
Reviews.Content: I can't give the Farjardo a "terrible" rating because it wasn't an evil nightmare, it just made me profoundly relieved we had only booked one night and I had great sympathy for the staff - they couldn't just flee like we could! Ironically, the place looks rather impressive in a fancy schmancy way, then your soul is slowly sucked out by the surreally dreary, impersonal rooms, the counter-productive attempt to limit pool time (guests nervously edging around the early evening "pool closed" sign as if fearing they might be yelled at) and the ghastly "Mexican" microwave food at the cheaper hotel restaurant. We timidly asked if we could buy tennis balls (like, to use on the tennis court?) and might as well have been demanding to purchase ski boots! It's by no means a nasty place, the sun shone, the pools were lovely - when open - but thank goodness it was only a stop-gap stay. You creep away with a lighter wallet and no special memories whatsoever.

Reviews.Title: “Best Thing in Fajardo”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fajardo Inn on the 5th. & 6th. of July of this year. It is a Beautiful Place on a hilltop in Fajardo. The Staff are Welcoming, Professional, & will go the extra mile to answer your questions, address concerns, give directions, etc. The room we stayed in was spacious, very nicely decorated & clean. WE ate once at the Inn at the Starfish; which is typical Caribbean Cuisine and the food and service were excellent. The next evening we drove to La Banda Waterfront restaurant in Ceiba about 15 mins. away...also excellent. If...If ...you're planning to Ferry to Culebra or Vieques..purchase your tickets IN ADVANCE; and do not beleive the tour Books....one hour before departure doesn't cut it. You would not beleive the scene at the terminal. Trust me. Have a Good Time

Reviews.Title: “Fajardo Inn”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Fajardo Inn was a great place.! It was a little tricky to find at first but it was well worth it! The views were unbelievable. The pools were great, even though the bigger one down below closed around 7pm. There was even a bar down by the pool, it was great. The earlier you go to the pool the better chance you have on getting towels and having the pool all to yourself. Past the pool, by the kids playground iguanas run wild! The staff were kind and friendly. I had many questions and they answered them with no problems. We ate once at the restaurant on the premise, 2 breakfast plates, came out to be 18 dollars, kind of pricey for eggs bacon and toast, but after that we ate at local restaurants. The rooms were clean, all tile, and the beds were comfortable. All in all it was a great experience. I will definately come back.

Reviews.Title: “A bargain”
Reviews.Author: Pastiche
Reviews.Content: The beautiful gardens and Spanish-style architecture of the inn make it a pleasant place to stay. The rooms have attractive, newer furniture, though the bathrooms are a bit dated (but clean). Advantages include: iron & ironing board in the room, convenient cubbyholes in the closet, extra pillows, dorm-size fridge in the room, great ocean views from the patio up top, laundry facilities, and Internet-access computers for guests (at $5 per half-hour). There's no elevator, but you can ask the staff for assistance with baggage. The lower pool appears to be open to non-guests who pay for day privileges, and while we were there it was quite crowded. The upper pool is quieter. We ate onsite at both the Blue Iguana (Mexican food, sports bar atmosphere) and the other, more traditional restaurant. Food at the Blue Iguana was very good, with most lunch items priced at just $5, including a large soft drink. Portions were large. Outstanding chips and salsa! The other restaurant was nothing to write home about; the service was poor, selections were limited, quality of the food was not the best, and it wasn't inexpensive. For the price, the Fajardo Inn is a true bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: MomDadandBlueberry
Reviews.Content: A very nice place to stay. We travelled with our 2Â½ year old and the hotel pool is beautiful and a huge hit. The playground and minature golf (small extra charge) was very nice. Our room was a brand new suite (with a microwave, refrigerator and coffee maker), but only one king sized bed. A suggestion to the hotel would be to supply little things like paper towels, a sponge and coffee filters and possibly a roll away bed for children as the room was very large. The front desk clerk "Sandra" was exceedingly nice. She showed us two rooms and gave me a full run down on all the things nearby and available at the resort. She was extremely pleasant and welcoming. (We have stayed at many hotels over the years and she really went above and beyond as a welcoming hostess. ) the location was very nice. The only problem are the grounds are very spread out. We only ate one meal at the restaurant which was nice but somewhat expensive for a family.

Reviews.Title: “small rooms”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: the room was clean and cheap. we had an upgraded room, but it was very, very small and the bed was uncomfortable. i would not stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Best Bargain In Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This has to be the best bargain in all of Puerto Rico, in fact, it is probably the best bargain in all of the Caribbean. We stayed at this resort with two other couples April 1st - 4th prior to taking a cruise. I will say that this hotel is very much hidden and a little tricky to find, but worth the extra effort to track them down. Our rooms were wonderful, clean and quiet. The pool is fantastic and even though they had limited hours (6PM) we were never asked to leave after 6PM and in fact one evening we stayed till nearly 8PM with no problems. We did utilize our own BYOB at the pool and were never hassled even though the sign reads no food or drink; however we were discrete about this. The Mexican restaurant was not bad..the pricing was good. The upstairs restaurant was VERY good and the staff was outstanding and very accommodating. Breakfast was pricey and so after the first day we went down the street to a typical local restaurant, the food was fabulous and the prices were very inexpensive. I will have to say that the staff at this hotel was very friendly from the moment they assisted us through directions to the hotel on our cell phone to the day we left, they were fantastic. If you go to the front desk you can get full size beach towels and only need to sign for them, they never asked for a deposit. The beach towels were clean and of good quality, in fact we took them with us on a snorkeling trip. The front desk staff was helpful with giving us numbers to local tour groups and was very good at giving directions to local beaches. The hotel had a few problems, but the price of this hotel was so good I won't even mention them. One of the best things about this hotel is that you are only about four miles from a huge mega-resort the El Conquistador were our husbands had a great day golfing and we spent one evening having dinner and enjoying the casino. Just as an example the El Conquistador was at least $250 more per night than the Fajardo Inn. I recommend staying at the Fajardo Inn and enjoying a quiet, clean hotel with a mega-resort pool and a Holiday Inn price!! We can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Good value and family location”
Reviews.Author: tlcall01
Reviews.Content: Can't afford a luxury hotel, but want ample pools, dining, and activites for the kids? Then Fajardo Inn is for you. Very affordable and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and relaxed at the Fajardo Inn”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A wonderful and reasonable option to the mega resorts in Puerto Rico. The rooms are big, comfortable and clean. Our kids loved the pool and play area in Coco's park. The Inn had many of the good amenities of a bigger, pricer resort at a comfortable value. Traveling with 3 small children, we truly appreciated the warm and family oriented staff. We felt at home.

Reviews.Title: “Empty, weird but Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Likes2GoGoGo
Reviews.Content: What a neat place to stay! We stayed four nights with my husband and two-year-old in one of the nicer rooms with a big king bed and a jacuzzi. So here's what's wonderful: Yes-- the POOLS. One has a great big shallow area for little guys, plus a bridge to wander under to a waterfall from the jacuzzi. It also has a second waterfall and a big concrete slide with water spilling down it for a QUICK ride! The second pool is a standard rectangle, but surrounded by palm trees where you can hear the coqui frogs singing at night. Very pretty. My instinct is the kids can use the big pool while adults use the little one. There's also a playground and mini-golf course, also both new. They looked top notch, but we didn't actually use them. It also appeard that they were building a basketball court. The restaurant on the top floor was nice enough, the waitresses are VERY friendly. We didn't try the mexican restaurant on the bottom floor because it was way too loud for my little guy. But there is a big screen tv and a pool table in there, along with a traditional bar. The room was nice. The bed very comfortable. To my standard, everything seemed quite clean. Now here's the weird: This place-- for its size-- seemed as empty as empty gets. A massive pool had only us in it most of the times we used it. On the occasions when other people were in it, it seemed like they were day groups-- they had on wrist bands. Also, even though we got a "deluxe" room, we got a $1.85 view. The layout of the place must be expanding because the deluxe room's balcony overlooked a parking lot and the top of their big convention hall. Ugly. To be fair, the view of the ocean and Vieques was just beyond the big convention hall, but you can tell they built first and thought about the layout later. It wouldn't have taken much to put the parking lot and convention hall behind the hotel building with the balconies. (Tip: If you're shooting for a view, get a room in-- I think-- the 300 series. The "original" building has wonderful views where you can't see the parking lot and rooftop.) Another weird thing? Owing to the emptiness, the bar at the center of the big pool was NEVER staffed. Seriously. My husband, son and I were the only people down there. Once there were some ladies from Georgia sunning themselves. They adopted a BYOB policy, even though there's a sign saying "No outside food or drink." But what are you supposed to do if the bar isn't open?
