And yeah, the big pool hours suck. 10am to 6pm when we were there. You are supposed to check in at a little building and get towels before you go down, but again, the whole time we were there, the little building was only open twice. So we got towels and hung onto them and gave them back at the front desk when we left. Also regarding pool hours-- one night I really needed a break, so I called the front desk on a hunch and asked what time the small pool was open till. They said 10pm. I think the sign says 8pm. Anyway, it's worth asking if you want a peaceful evening swim. As for the big jacuzzi, odd again, it was beautiful, but not warm. In fact it was actually cooler than the rest of the pool. Lastly, there was a lot of construction/activity, but we didn't notice any particular noisiness. There's a new building going up, they're paving the basketball court and there was constantly new furniture being delivered to all the rooms. Considering how much work has happening, it was very inobtrusive. All in all, I think the place is great. It's like a hotel on the verge of being a resort but they just haven't hit it yet. My husband called it "a ruin in progress." If they ever staff all their bars and facilities, word will get out and the prices will go up. Until then, you have the place all to yourself!! Last tip-- just past the restaurant on the second floor, there's a stairway leading up to an open-air dining/bar area. Again, never staffed and mostly empty. GORGEOUS views. Sunset!! BYOB or get some carryout one night and knock yourself out.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: gastup
Reviews.Content: As a family of four, we spent three nights at the Fajardo Inn. We occupied the "family room", a room with three double beds. The room was huge! There was large walk in closet that doubled as a changing room for our teenage son or daughter when the bathroom was occupied. The pool is awesome but the pool hours are way too short. It would have been nice to go for an evening swim. The grounds are very resort-like and well maintained. The floors throughout the establishment are ceramic tile and therefore easy to keep clean. The staff seemed to be constantly buffing and polishing. Our only disappointment was the Blue Iguana restaurant which serves Mexican food. It was just OK. We found a great spot for breakfast a couple blocks away (the Golden Bagel). Their coffee, fresh squeezed OJ and baked goods were out of this world. I had tears in my eyes on the last morning when we had to say goodbye. It's a special place.

Reviews.Title: “We had a good time!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fajardo Inn for one night. The rooms are plain but they served their purpose. The grounds are well maintained. The cleanliness of the room was so-so but I wasn't skeeved like I was at some of the other places we stayed in Puerto Rico, such as The Great Escape Inn in Vieques and The Howard Johnson in Isla Verde. The pool was awesome. It is huge and has this huge hottub and swim up bar. The pool hours are from 9am-7pm. It closed way too early. And we went to the restaurant right near the desk with the big boat in the front and the bar as soon as you walk in. I forget the name of it but I told the waitress I was a vegetarian and she brought out fettucini alfredo made with chicken broth. How disgusting!! Who would put chicken broth in alfredo sauce? She didn't listen to me when I ordered. Would I stay there again? Maybe. Compared to the other hotels I stayed at on my trip, this one was paradise. Incidentally, while we were in Fajardo, we went to the airport and flew on Vieques Air Link to Culebra. The flight was 15 minutes late but it was amazing. You can see all of Fajardo, Palominos Keys, and Culebra from the air. The flight was an unforgettable part of our trip. We didn't have any of the transportation problems on Culebra that we did on Vieques. We called Kiko's Transportation Services and he took us to Flamenco Beach. He was wonderful. I highly recommend his services! And Flamenco beach is the most beautiful beach I have ever been on in my entire life. My fiance' is 6 feet, 3 inches tall, and I took a picture of him standing in the water up to his shoulders. You can see his feet in the picture. That's how clear the water is. And my fiance loved the pinchos (BBQ chicken on a stick served with a roll) that they sell on Flamenco Beach. I loved the Pina Coladas. They were orgasmic. If I went to Puerto Rico again, I would stay on Culebra.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 stayed at the Farjado Inn for 5 nights. It is beautiful. The staff are excellent. The rooms are comfortable and food good. The pools are outstanding. The location to everything perfect. And the price was great. The entire time we were there it was like a postcard dream. I highly recommend the Farjado Inn and would certainly stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Jury's still our on this place”
Reviews.Author: baianamomma
Reviews.Content: we spent two nights at the scenic inn before heading out to culebra and then one night at the Fajardo Inn when we came back. The Scenic Inn was a good deal. The floors are linoleum and kind of gross, never walked barefoot. There was no remote and there are lots of roosters on the property but still a great deal. The fajardo inn was not worth the price. For twice the price we got the same accomodations except for this time we got a remote, no roosters, and the room was bigger. Still gross floors. The restaurants on premise are not worth mentioning. The really neat pool closes at 7pm. No one is hanging out at the hotel at 7pm! The staff was okay, Budget travellers, stay at the Scenic Inn. If you want nice, the Conquistador is to die for and starts at $70 more per night than the Fajardo Inn. Definitely worth it.

Reviews.Title: “not the place to go for peace and quiet”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights here in March. The Farjado Inn is physically very nice-beautiful views, inviting lobby, polite staff. That being said, the longer I stayed the more I could not wait to leave. The huge beautiful pool has ridiculously short hours. when we did find time to lay by the pool one afternoon we walked away with our ears ringing--from 10am to noon they were pressure washing the pool (very loud!). When that finally stopped it was replaced by the soothing sound of dump trucks, cranes, construction and the very loud stereo of the construction crew directly behind us. Yes, the huge pool is adjacent to a huge construction site. I would have retired to my room for a bit of peace and quiet, however directly oustide of our room was a large table saw. They seemed to be building closet doors and doing miscellaneuos carpentry the whole length of our hallway for the duration of our stay. For days after we left everything in our suitcases smelled like mold (the general aroma of our room). The food also left a lot to be desired. There was absoletuly no consistency, and there is only one restaraunt open for lunch which is entirely mexican food. never did find the jacuzzis. when i called to ask the front desk where they were they replied that the jacuzzis were not currently open and that they are never open unless the hotel is at maximum capacity.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Farjardo Inn for 2 night in March 2006. The staff were friendly and the room was clean. I would recommend to anyone going to the west side of Puerto Rico

Reviews.Title: “Best Vacation We Ever Had”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: PERFECT PERFECT PERFECT - I have to tell you all, this was the perfect vacation for my kids and I. The location was great it was up on the mountain but only about 5 minutes from the Seven Sea beach and only 15 minutes from Luquillo Beach. People on the property were magnificent. (Especially Juan) The Employees were very friendly and pleasant to us and also very helpful, if I may add especially (Juan) the maintenance guy. He was great to us especially with the kids. They have different tropical fruits, everywhere on the properties. The pool was breath taking. Like a dream come true for the kids. I mean they have a beach ramp, which is great for small children. Then thereâ€™s the slide that goes into the 5ft. for older kids and adults. I have included pictures of us. Hope you enjoy your next vacation. I highly recommend that you go to the Fajardo Inn. www.fajardoinn.com

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Santovic
Reviews.Content: The Fajardo Inn, is a beautiful hotel, with all the caribean flavor. It sit's on a mountain side, in Fajardo, just a couple of miles from the Conquistador Hotel Resort. We stayed at a villa, for $110.00 a day that just can't be beat. The villa is spaciaus, with balcony, nice furniture, you can really make yourself at home. The hotel has 2 restaurants, 2 pools, a mini golf course, a computer room, wi-fi hot spot, great outdoor lobby seating area, banquet hall, a nearby by mall, the works. And a very friendly staff, that made our stayed a very pleasent one!! We will visit this hotel, anytime were on that Island. I was very impressed, it could prove a little hard to find at first, but I recommend looking it up.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful, Clean, Such a Deal!”
Reviews.Author: dunewalker
Reviews.Content: The Fajardo Inn was as clean and sweet as the Puerto Rico country air and a true escape from the touristy beat. Having stayed in upscale hotels in San Juan and Dorado on previous visits to PR, we had decided to sample a simpler style of lodging. Puerto Rico really has enchanted us (married couple in 50s), and we felt that we should see if the magic held up without the four-star safety net. Our 3-day, 2-night stay in the Fajardo Inn in early February was definitely not long enough and we are eager to return. In fact, staying at the Caribe Hilton in San Juan for the next six nights, we drove to the Fajardo vicinity two more times! (That can take more than an hour each way.) Driving in from the airport, we had no problem finding the highway turn-off for the Inn and once we knew where it was, it was equally easy to find it at night. From previous reviews, we were a bit leery about reports of steep stairs and sparse rooms. But we unloaded the trunk of the rental car in the driveway, and by the time my husband returned from parking, the manager had carried our luggage up to our room via the beautiful sweeping staircase. And so it went. They knew us and looked out for us cheerfully. Service was impeccable, without the sometimes too-closeness of a B&B. THE ROOM. We stayed in a â€œStandard room w/balconyâ€� in the main building. There was a tiled floor, small refrigerator, phone, cable TV with stations from the States, a cafe table and two chairs, dresser drawers, two night tables, your regular sliding-door size closet and a roomy queen bed that allowed us to sleep like babies. The bathroom had a huge shower w/soap and shampoo supplied, and since we donâ€™t expect Egyptian cotton bath sheets at those prices, we were satisfied with what we got. The air conditioner was just fine. I would have liked at least one upholstered chair to sit in. My husband didnâ€™t care. The small BALCONY immediately overlooked some parking spots, another low-rise Inn building and a variety of evergreens and palm trees. In the distance was a view of green hills and the town of Fajardo with El Yunque looming behind it. In the other direction was the not-so-far-off Atlantic with a view of Culebra Island and smaller cays. Not bad for $95/night. THE POOL AND GROUNDS. As a pool aficionado, I was pleased. Yes, the pictures of the larger pool complex look like a computer-drawing on their web site, but it really does look that way in person! The pool bar wasnâ€™t open on weekday afternoons, but the wonderful layout of the large pools, the beautiful landscaping, green hills and violet skies, and various birds, iguanas and some wandering, friendly cats and roosters kept us relaxed and entertained. The original pool â€“ a nice-sized, deep rectangle in a courtyard aside the hotel â€“ also was surrounded by all kinds of palms and evergreens, and by extremely friendly guests, many of whom were return visitors. The pool towels, which you get from the front desk, were top of the line! Itâ€™s not hard to see why the Inn has received environmental awards because itâ€™s so creatively landscaped. In the public areas and hallways, youâ€™ll pass a lot of original art, some folky, some not original, but all nicely and imaginatively framed. The colonial island architecture of the main building was welcoming. Everything was designed with an extra, caring touch. OTHER SERVICES. The service staff was terrific and there was always someone cleaning the public areas. When we called for extra towels and TP, room service came immediately. I couldnâ€™t get a dial-up Internet connection for my laptop in the room. When I finally went to the front desk they said they only connect the phone if so requested, and when I complained that I had wasted precious time, they gave me a free (usually $5) half-hour stint in the two-computer high-speed Internet room. There is a laundry room for the guests. RESTAURANTS. For breakfast and dinner, the Star Fish restaurant was good but not memorable (our full-breakfast selections were about $8 each; dinner main courses, mid-teens). The Blue Iguana bar and grill (w/pool tables and a large screen TV for viewing sports) was generous for lunch and dinner with a wide variety of home-made Mexican food that hit the mark for about $7 and up. Wine and liquor was fairly priced. You could eat entirely on the ground for several days and be neither bored nor broke. ENVIRONS. Youâ€™ll do best to get a rental car at the airport, because you will want to explore the surrounding area, including the nearby rainforest, sweeping Luquillo Beach, the bioluminescent waters, etc. Staying entirely on the Innâ€™s premises, despite their two affordable and pleasant restaurants, might be just a bit too quiet for more than a few days. Since the Inn is NOT on the beach, youâ€™ll have to drive there. Itâ€™s fun to explore the unpretentious restaurants down by the marina and along the main road to the Inn. At the turn-off from Highway 3 are several shopping centers, with fast food chains and a large Walgreens offering any drinks, snacks and sundries you might need. For some reason, I couldn't transmit photos w/this review, so just know that the Inn's website photos don't do it justice. If the Fajardo Inn were any smaller, I wouldnâ€™t have shared how good it is, since I want to have a room available when we return!

Reviews.Title: “A little piece of paradise...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just an hourâ€™s drive from the airport, the Fajardo Inn is a peaceful East Coast respite from the hub-bub of the metro San Juan area. We have been vacationing at the Inn for over a decade and with the recent completion of the enormous pool area with its water slide, swim up inpool bar and whirlpool area, kiddie playground, miniature golf and banquet facilities, the Inn has truly evolved into a comprehensive destination for family fun. For sports enthusiasts-- tennis and basketball courts, and a fully equipped gym are near completion. Canâ€™t live without your computer --- take it with you for free WiFi access in hotelâ€™s lobby or use the Innâ€™s computers for a nominal fee. The guest rooms have been refurbished with new mattresses, linens, furniture and paint. Great care has been taken to maximize functionality, as well as to assure that each room is aesthetically pleasing. The bi-lingual staff is competent, dedicated and well-versed in area attractions and will assist you in making arrangements for excursions â€“ scuba, snorkeling,Yunque Forest tour, etc. With the lush plantings strategically located on the property, guests feel like they truly are on a tropical oasis. Golf courses are a short driving distance if you enjoy the game. Access to the Culebra/Vieques Ferry is minutes from the Inn. The trip to these out islands with their beautiful white sand beaches is a must for any visitor interested in a quiet, unspoiled setting. (Best time: weekdays). Although the two on-premise restaurants are adequate, there are many off-site eateries that also offer excellent meals at reasonable prices. We consider our five weeks spent at the Inn most enjoyable. Spending days in each of the Innâ€™s two pools working on our tans, exploring the area, golfing, snorkeling, kayaking, walking and watching the sun rise over Culebra and set over Yunque provide a powerful reminder of natureâ€™s wonders here in Puerto Rico. Until next yearâ€¦â€¦â€¦

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: candu
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked a one week vacation at the five star hotel in Fajardo. We accidentally saw the Fajardo Inn on our second day and decided to move there. We had a great vacation for about 35% of the cost of the other place. The Fajardo Inn has nice pools, restaurants and minature golf. Service is good, views are great and there are many things to do in the area. Now that we can afford two vacations per year, we will be back at the Fajardo Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Fleas and other Insects”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Don't sleep a night here, is a dump. Fleas in the bed and others insects. Stay away of the restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Nice quiet hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stay at this beautiful hotel. For those who enjoy nature like us this place is great. The sorroundings are amazing, you feel conected with nature. The rooms are very nice and comfortable. We stay in one of the suites and the furniture was not basic at all. It is a great value for what you pay $130.00 a night. The two restaurants are very tasty. One with excellent fajitas (the best I have try), the other one really good caribbean flavors (mango, coconut) The pool is incredible, it is like a resort. We will definetly come back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Base of Operations & Value”
Reviews.Author: Chavodel8
Reviews.Content: The Fajardo Inn is a nice place to return to as you explore the beautiful & exciting northeast of la Isla del Encanto. It seems like some of the complaints about the hotel come from people who expect a fully self-contained resort destination â€“ thatâ€™s a lot to ask for $100 a night. We stayed about a week and really enjoyed our stay, especially daytime activities, but youâ€™ll need a car to reach attractions or if you want any nightlife (see our post under â€œFajardoâ€�) for stuff to do. The rooms are clean, comfortable and spacious, if pretty spare (absolutely no shelf space in the bathroom), with AC & small TVs. We didnâ€™t see any benefit to the Ocean View over the Mountain View. The pool area is very nice for a hotel this size, and really uncrowded â€“ good for a few afternoonsâ€™ relaxation. However, the towel service is sometimes unattended, and the swim-up bar is not up yet â€“ youâ€™ll have to hike up to the restaurant for water. The two restaurants are good, although youâ€™ll get tired of them if you donâ€™t eat anywhere else. It looks like they are adding many units, so the hotel may get more crowded in the future. Overall, a nice stay and a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK...”
Reviews.Author: BQ74
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fajardo Inn for 4 nights. The good parts about the hotel are the price (reasonable for the area), the family-friendly pool area, both restaurants have good food at reasonable prices, the staff is friendly, there are nice views of the ocean and the mountains, it is very close to the ferry for Culebra and Vieques, and they help coordinate excursions including bioluminescent bay kayak trips (which are also close by). There were a few bad things that would make me reluctant to recommend this hotel. The rooms are very sparse and dismal (not even an alarm clock, with tile floor and fluorescent lights). I did not feel comfortable relaxing there in the evening. The bed was uncomfortable with bed-bugs. I woke up several times during each night itching and in the morning saw many new bites--not from mosquitoes or sand fleas, definitely from some insects living in the bed. The staff did not communicate very well with the excursion companies. I suggest arranging tours yourself and calling to confirm the status of the tour the night before or day of, in the case of the night bioluminescent bay tour (so cool!) instead of relying on hotel staff. Overall, this hotel seems on-par for Puerto Rico and for the price you pay per night.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, comfortable hotel, value for money”
Reviews.Author: cooltraveller
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 3 nights at Fajardo Inn and the overall experiance was very nice. We had booked an ocean-view room that had a tiny balcony looking out to the sea in the distance - we sat here every morning with our cup of coffee watching the water sparkle in the sunlight. The rest of the room was nice, with comfortable beds, chairs and a shower-only bathroom. The inn has 2 pools - the bigger one with the swim-up bar is really nice and we spent a lot of time here. The bar and food at the Blue Iguana (one of the hotel's restaurants) was really good. The hotel does not provide complimentary breakfast, and we had to spend $7.50 for a very ordinary breakfast everyday, that most other hotels offer for free. You will need a car to visit places while staying at Fajardo Inn. We made trips to El Yunque, Luquillo Beach and Seven Seas Beach. The best trip we had was with Las Tortugas Tours - a dusk thru' night kayaking trip through mangove canals and into the Biobay Lagoon. We didn't want to goto Vieques, so we toured the biobay just off Fajardo, which is reportedly almost as nice. We really enjoyed our stay at the Fajardo Inn - away from the crowds at San Juan, while being close to many attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Jeez...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Please do yourself a favor and stay away from this dump. "Inn" is the last thing a reasonable person would call this place. It is a 1960's hotel with 1960's furniture and the hardest beds on the planet. There is nothing to do and no where to go after dark. I guess there are few choices in the area but either stay anywhere else or go to another town. This post is the best thing I can do for fellow travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Comfortable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bjboat
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Fajardo Inn after two nights at The EL Conquistador is something of a letdown but the difference in cost sort of evens things out. The Fajardo Inn is spotlessly clean with a large pool and nice facilities. The room was large and comfortable with TV, phone and air conditioner that worked well except I had to unplug it to turn it off. There are nice views of Fajardo from the upper bar terrace and the place is undergoing major renovations and additions. Aside from El Yunque Rainforest and the Ferrys to Vieques and Culebra there does not seem to be much to do in Fajardo. I didn't need a car at the Wyndham resort but you need one at the Fajardo Inn if you plan to do any exploring. I used the Inn to see the Rainforest and as a jumping off point to Vieques. The Mexican resturant on the lower level was good and reasonable. I had breakfast at the main resturant and it too was good. Staff were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: salmoncake
Reviews.Content: There are only a handful of hotels in Fajardo and this is probably the best non-resort hotel. The rooms are decent and clean. The hotel is on a hill and has a big pool and two restaurants. The Blue Iguana has the best fajitas I have ever had. We did the bioluminiscent tour by kayaks (amazing!) with Eco Tours who dropped us off at the hotel. Initially we had a room booked at the Scenic Inn, which is maintained by Fajardo Inn on the same site. The room was disgusting with dim lighting and coakroaches. We asked to be moved to the main inn and they gave us a suite which was of a good standard. Fajardo has only one taxi service which is extortionate on Sundays so hire a car beforehand to get around.

Reviews.Title: “Ou home away from home”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just booked our third stay at the Fajardo Inn in the last year. We found it to be very comfortable and the employees go out of their way to help . We are "house hunting" for a retirement home in th Fajardo area and this location is great. The Blue Iguana restaurant has the best fajitias.

Reviews.Title: “Left sooner than planned”
Reviews.Author: stitcheroo1
Reviews.Content: When we found this hotel on the Internet, it looked wonderful. When we got there, it was not much like the photos at all. We thought we had booked a room with a view: instead we had a view of a dirt parking lot and construction. Our room looked and felt sparse, empty and unwelcoming. The mattress was so uncomfortable that my lower back ached. Something about the room made us so ill at ease and gave us such insomnia that we checked out in the very early morning hours, two days into our booked four-day stay. The food in the upstairs restaurant is simple and good, not expensively priced. The landscaping is very pretty. The new pool looks nice but the water was warmer than a bathtub. That being said, the hotel was booked solid during our stay, the majority of the guests Puerto Rican families with children who looked very happy there. It just wasn't a good "fit" for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After a 4 night stay in Isabella, we spent the last two nights in Pureto Rico in the Fajardo Inn. Our only regret was that we did not stay there all six nights. This Inn is great. The rates are very reasonable and the accomidations are excellent. The meals in the two different reataurants were great. They have a bar and pool room with several Televisions. The service was above par. Everyone was very helpful and friendly. Oh, and the seaview bar has an excllent view of the Farjardo Bay. Tours to Culebra and a trip to "EL Yunque" are also in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Diamond in the Rough”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Fajardo Inn is a baby in Hotel years, but its not suffering from growing pains. The hotel has beautiful architecture with even more beautiful interiors. The hallways that lead to the rooms on the main building are elegance at its finest, they're decorated with beautiful paintings and are accentuated with soft lighting, not something I expected from a little hotel such as this. We stayed on the second floor and all those people aching from the "no elevator" complaint are just nitpicking, frankly there's about 20 stairs and if that takes the wind out of you, perhaps you should work out. We had no trouble getting our luggage up the stairs due to the fact that we asked for assistance just like the sign by the stairs indicated. The staff was more than happy to assist. The two restaurants, Starfish and The Blue Iguana, while small, are just what the hotel needs. Frankly we've stayed at larger hotels which only had one restaurant and we were amazed when we found out this one had two. (Note: While there we inquired about the Sea View Bar and were told that it was currently under renovations and would open in June) The food at the two restaurants was better than expected. One minor complaint about the Blue Iguana is that they have all these TVs but their volumes are always on mute. What's the point? The only one that had sound was the big screen located behind the bar. There were no activites to peform while we stayed there, but then again they never claimed to have any in the first place so its not a surprise. The location was close enough to all the tourist attractions we went to so it wasn't a chore to go to them. I suggest doing the bioluminescent bay at night, its truly a marvel. Overall, it was beyond our expectations and most of the complaints we read here prior to our visit were unfounded. I wouldn't allow isolated incidents to spoil a visit to this diamond in the rough.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: BostonIndian
Reviews.Content: We stayed there on 3/31 - our first of four nights (see reviews for Trade Winds in Vieques, El Buen Cafe in Hatillo and Marriott Resort in San Juan) The place is pretty easy to find if you follow the directions on the website. The only place it gets confusing is the left turn a few blocks before the hotel (we missed it and ended up at the ferry harbor/port). Had to get directions at the Post office! The hotel - It's a sprawling complex. We had the honeymoon suite. The room was nice and clean, with a refrigerator and A/c. Nice views from the balcony - the ocean on one side and El Yunque on the other. The Blue Iguana had good food... good drinks too. The breakfast buffet was really well priced $7.50 for the quality of food there (everything from fresh fruit to yogurt, danishes, bread, juices, bagels etc) The bulk of the construction seems to be done, so it was not noisy during the entire stay. The new pool at the lower level was amazing in it's landscaping, but was still not open. The upper level pool was refreshing and clean. The staff is helpful. They knew the area. Parking was not a problem either. We actually left our car there since we were making a trip to Vieques and would not have returned till the next morning, and I was not comfortable leaving the car in public parking spots. The ferry is a 15 minute walk from the hotel. Make sure you give yourself ENOUGH time - at least 90 minutes before your scheduled ferry departure if you have not gotten tickets yet (actually I don't even know if you can buy advance tickets). I had to wait 45 minutes at #2 position in line just because all tickets were sold and the ticketing agent was waiting for confirmation on a block of tickets that could be released (hence leading to my assumption that you probably could reserve blocks of tickets) The airport is about 10 minute ($10 for the two of us) ride too. (we took the ferry to vieques and the flight back to fajardo... in case you are wondering :) The bad stuff - we did not have hot water (we had barely tepid/warm) till late in the evening. That was a let down since I had reserved the room because of the jacuzzi. My girlfriend accidentally discovered that hot water's on around 6 PM. So, it was not a total disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Fajardo Inn - a happy surprise”
Reviews.Author: believeyoume
Reviews.Content: The Fajardo Inn is roomy and clean. Above average for the price. When we went, the pool area and grounds were very well kept. Pretty nice view. The hotel can be somewhat difficult to find so you will want to obtain good directions.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location (..AND GREAT MARGARITAS!!)”
Reviews.Author: Luv-2-Cruise
Reviews.Content: Frankly, the hotel room itself is not what you come to this hotel for. There are, however, many many other assests that make it worth staying at while in Fajardo. #1. The location is unbeatable if you are around town to visit El Yunque, Luquillo's beaches, or are going to Vieques/Culebra for a day or a weekend visit (it is minutes from the ferrY and the hotel provides a van for $3/person to take you there, so you don't have to mess with the taxis). #2. The rooms are large and the A.C. is great! There is also a small fridge in the room to keep your water cools, which is a nice plus. #3. The views from the Ocean View rooms w/ small balconies are very nice, particularly when you can turn your head to one side an see the blue/green ocean and turn your head the other and see the tremendous peaks of El Yunque's rainforest with clouds nesteled at the top. and.... #4. Last, but certainly not least, is the GREAT AND INCREDIBLE AND RATHER UNBELIEVABLE Margaritas at the Blue Iguana Restaurant on the property. My boyfriend and I are from Texas, so we've had some great margaritas in our lives.... but, let me tell you, these rival any I've had in Texas or Mexico, for that matter. The food (Crown Nachos w/ chicken and the Tortilla Soup) was great... but what truly stole the show was the Margaritas (and the Medalla beer- the local Puerto Rican beer- is also worth mentioning). All in all, the Fajardo Inn gets 2 thumbs up from us!! We truly enjoyed our stay!

Reviews.Title: “a good base for the area”
Reviews.Author: SZ
Reviews.Content: I thought the Inn was a very good value, having paid the same for a lot less in other areas of Puerto Rico. I stayed there primarily to go to Luquillo Beach, to kayak through the mangove at night to the bioluminescent Laguna, to visit El Yunque and to eat at the seafood restaurants in the Las Croabas vicinity. We ate one breakfast and one dinner at the Starfish Restaurant which were good, but not exceptional. You can't compare it to the nearby resorts because it is a modest operation and you pay accordingly. The grounds are beautifully landscaped and tended. We did see two cats while there but were not bothered by them. And the bedsheets did pop off of the mattress. The room was very large and we turned off the airconditioning every night. It was always very pleasant returning there after the day's or evening's activities. If you want something that will entertain you day and night it is not the place to stay but if you want a very nice accomodation while pursuing interests in northeastern Puerto Rico I would highly recommend it

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Middle Island, Long Island, New York
Reviews.Title: “Super Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: sambuca
Reviews.Content: Love this hotel. Great price, magnificent views of the ocean and rainforest. Very nice and accomodating staff. Loved the breakfast in the restaurant. The Blue Iguana had awesome food(nice presentations), fun atmosphere, pool tables, it was also nicely decorated. The pool area was very relaxing, never more than 10 people,usually less than 5. We saw the almost completed new pool area, it is going to be outrageous!The only complaint is that the sheets kept coming off the bed, like they were too small. The comforter was pretty badly stained also.Don't stay in the guest houses, they may be $20 cheaper, but it seems like another hotel. Rooms are completely run down. Make sure to stay in the main hotel, and you'll be very satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive Spanish style resort hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A bunch of travellers were unexpectedly detoured to this inn due to the blizzard in the US. It turned out to be a really pleasant surprise. The hotel is modern, with an open spanish style lobby and styling. The rooms were large and well kept. The pool was right next to the hotel but private and luxurious. Two restaurants and a sports bar inside. The staff was a little overwhelmed by the sudden surge in guests, but was helpful and friendly. It was close to a luxury resort, but much more inexpensive. Please note that there is a small companion building with very spare basic rooms adjoining (the former hotel before they remodeled) called the Scenic Inn which cannot be recommended. Also the surrounding area of Fajardo is a little run down. Still this was a real treat, and I wouldn't hesitate to return and relax!

Reviews.Title: “The Good, The Bad, and The Ugly”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Good: at $65.00 per night, it's very affordable (we stayed in the scenic inn). location wise, it's very attractive: minutes away from Culebra beach ferry, El Yunque Rain forest, Luquillo beach, and the phosphorescent bay. the pool is sweeeeet and plans for a new, much larger pool (with swim up bar) is in the works. in-room a/c units are arctic class. tv offers nice channel selections like HBO, Showtime, and Cinemax. Iguana Bar/Mexican restaurant is terrific. the main hotel and hotel grounds are beautiful. the staff was generally very friendly. Bad: nothing to do! the hotel makes a zero effort in making the place lively. pool and restaurants/bar close TOO early. one, count it, ONE ice machine on the entire premises. NO telephones, clock radios or remote control for the TV, so forget a wake up call, listening to music and/or lying in bed watching tv. the Starfish restaurant (for seafood) is God awful. a little salt and pepper goes a loooooong way. carefull with the towels and room key! $50.00 replacement charge for EACH missing towel, $200.00 for losing the key! Holy S--T! and yes, they make you sign out for EVERYTHING! UGLY: cats! behind the scenic inn lies a cat burrow. we counted atleast 12. they tend to roam freely at night, and are always fighting. room had an ugly ceiling stain (water damage?) and the towel rack always fell off. no attempts from the hotel to remedy both. the awesome balcony of the scenic inn (if set-up properly) is nothing more than a mattress storage space. we found one in the hallway, just next to our door. it's as if they don't care or, its a result of poor hotel management. avoid room number 10 of the scenic inn. all the other rooms have coffee tables w/ chairs, tv stand/drawer combo and ample living space. number 10 looks like a converted closet. the poolside restrooms and main lobby restrooms could use something called a "urinal scented cake". cheap and effective. whoa. Summary: you get what you pay for folks! truthfully, i was pleased most of the time. my thing is this: if they have the resources to build a new and impressive pool, then surely they could address the other minor issues. if they got it together, they would be a force in the Fajardo area hotel wars. my experience aside, when in PR, just have FUN!

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: adventure523
Reviews.Content: A wonderful hotel! The perfect place to stay if you are on your way to Viequez-- right by the ferry station. Clean, large rooms, very friendly staff, and a great restuarant on site. Also a gorgeous location. Definitely recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Great mid-priced hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading mixed reviews, I was very pleasantly surprised. It's not a 5-star hotel, but it doesn't claim to be. The rooms were clean and spacious. The pool was always clean and warm. The staff was friendly and the food at the Blue Iguana was great. Just beware of Fajardo drivers! We also booked a sailing charter with Captain Mingo on the Getaway and it was fantastic!!! Hotels in PR are expensive - this was a great mid-price alternative!

Reviews.Title: “Do not eat there”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My comforter had a blood stain. They came and changed the sheets and put the same comforter on the bed. The Inn and the rooms are nice But they have ant problems. The 2 restaurants they have I got sick from both of them. The first one, the Starfish restaurant I ordered room service Sirloin steak welldone with white rice and beans and side salad and lemonade. The steak came rare and no flavor what so ever, the beans came in a cup that when I opened it had some weird bubbles on top, the salad the tomato and cucumbers,etc were sliced so thinly you could see right through it, the lemonade was good but the cup was so tiny. 20 minutes afterwards I felt so sick I had to lay down. The next day I said maybe I should try the other restaurant the Blue Iguana Mexican Bar and grill I had nachos with cheese,beef,sour cream,guacomole, onions and peppers and got very ill,weak,faint, I vomitted later that night. I called the front desk to tell them I felt very sick from the food in the restaurant and they were very unresponsive. Someone had wrote that the pool is always open all night not true, and the pool is only 4 feet and the bottom of the pool is so rough that you scrape and injure your feet. They have posted signs pool closes at 8.

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great value. The room was basic, clean and on the larger size. They are constantly cleaning but there is a musty smell. I think it might be the water. I didn't find that problem in the hotels in San Juan. The staff was expremely friendly and helpful. They didn't charge us for the first night we were suppose to be there but couldn't because of a cancelled flight. We booked the bioluminescent bay kayak trip through them which was the best thing we did in P.R. Swimming in the lagoon was a mesmerizing experience.

HotelInfo.Name: The Fajardo Inn
HotelInfo.Address: Parcelas Beltran #52, Fajardo 00740, Puerto Rico
